loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Simona es madre de cuatro hijos, vive en el barrio 25 de Febrero, su negocio es la venta de ropa que vende desde hace varios años, el cual inicio con dinero propio, de un tramo que vendió en el mercado Oriental, ya que las ventas estaban bajas.
Y deseaba probar vendiendo ambulante en los departamentos, lo que le ha resultado mejor.

Compra por cantidad de docenas ya que así vende a mejor precio, y va distribuyendo en las diferentes tiendas de los departamentos.
Pues es cansado ya que viaja a kilómetros para lograr el objetivo de vender. Parte de su inversión es propia pero trabaja con financiamiento lo que permite aumentar el volumen de compra y venta es por eso cada vez le resulta favorable a largo plazo. Con este préstamo comprara seis docenas de pantalones para damas y varón  cuatro docenas de camisa de damas y varón, telas variadas para ofertar estilos y colores. Con esto espera mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Simona is a mother with four children. She lives in the February 25th district. She sells clothes for a living and has been doing this for several years. She started her business with her own money that she raised by selling her spot in the Oriental Market since sales were few. She has had better results travelling in the departments to sell her merchandise. She purchases by the dozen since this way she can offer better prices and she distributes to the different stores in the departments. She is tired since she has to travel many kilometers to sell her merchandise. Part of the investment is her own, however she uses financing which allows her to buy more and sell more since this is better in the long run. With this loan she will buy six dozen pairs of men's and women's pants and four dozen men's and women's shirts in a variety of fabrics in order to offer different styles and colors. She hopes that this will increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Simona will use the loan to buy larger quantities of clothing, such as pants and shirts for men and women, in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Hardworking K. Julius has been investing in the transport sector for the last eighteen years. His determination and good customer skills have seen him through to this day as he operates on the Ibanda-Mbarara road.

Though with hassles, Julius has managed to maneuver through, earning a profit of 150,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis. With his vision to attain good living conditions, he hopes that this loan will help to contribute towards his need to buy another car for a taxi business on the same route. This will enable him to earn more revenue and be able to fulfill his family obligations.

loans.use: To purchase another taxi for his business

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu A. is a widow with six children, four girls and two boys. Two girls are already married and the others are still attending school. She has been operating her tailoring business for three years with another source of income coming from her married daughters. Mwanamkuu sells from home, neighbors and passersby being her potential customers. Mwanamkuu is asking for a loan of Kshs 25,000  to purchase handbags and shoes for retail sale. She hopes to open a shop someday.

Mwanamkuu decided to join Yehu to access loans and to  improve her living standard. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, rent and electricity.

loans.use: To buy brand new handbags and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Shishikara Group

texts.fr:
Esperate N. est une commerçante âgée de 25ans qui habite la Commune de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de charbon et de la Biere industrielle alcoolisée au quartier Kanyosha à Bujumbura. C’est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 3ans juste a sa sortie de l’école ou elle a obtenu le Diplôme A4 en études professionnelles. Son époux, Etienne Habonimana, est lui aussi un commerçant. Elle est maintenant  au 6e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 2 enfants âgés respectivement de 3 ans et 1 année 6mois. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour diversifier son business avec les produits vivriers comme la farine de manioc, l’huile de palme,mais aussi augmenter la quantité des produits habituels  qu’elle revend aux clients. Elle espère ainsi que cela lui permettra d’acquérir une plus grande capacité de générer du bénéfice et ainsi avoir son propre capital pour devenir une commerçante grossiste dans l’avenir. Elle va continuer à demander le crédit Turame  car les conditions d’accès sont plus souples par rapport aux autres institutions financières.

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Shishikara ».
texts.en:
Esperate N. is a 25-year-old merchant living in the Kanyosha borough of the Bujumbura mayorship, where she sells coal and commercial beer. She has been leading this activity ever since graduating from school with an A4 professional degree. Her husband Etienne Habonimana is also a merchant. She is now in her 6th group loan cycle with Turame. She is the mother of two children who are 3 and 1 ½ years old. She is requesting the loan from Kiva to diversify her business with food products such as cassava flour or palm nut oil, but also to improve the quality of the products she currently offers her customers. She hopes this will enable her to increase her revenue-generating ability, and also accumulate enough capital to become a wholesaler in the future. She will continue to request loans from Turame because their loan conditions are more flexible than those of other financial institutions. She is a member of the “Shishikara” communal loan group.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: diversify her business with food products such as cassava flour or palm nut oil, and improve the quality of the products she currently offers her customers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
K. Gloria, a trained midwife, has been providing medical services to her clients, especially mothers in labor, for four years in Kasule, Mubende. Here in Uganda one of the common medical problems faced is that there are very few health facilities to cater to the sick. Thus very many women here die on giving birth due to inadequate services.

Gloria’s main problem is not having enough space to deliver health services to the many patients who visit her medical clinic. With this loan, she is looking at putting into execution her plan to construct an extension house to support the accommodation of her patients. This will see her earn more revenue.

loans.use: To construct an extension to her health facility

loans.name: Nuris Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Nuris es madre de familia de dos hermosos hijos, madre esforzada y dedicada al trabajo, para lograr estabilidad. Junto con su esposo ha logrado construir su casa de concreto, aun de tierra, pero un techo digno.
Su esposo trabaja como conductor, y gana poco pero es un trabajo fijo, no ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa, ya que las ventas están bajas, aunque no se deja de vender, y las ganancias va rotando en compra de productos, gastos básicos de agua y luz, entre medicamentos para sus hijos que por el invierno se han enfermado.
Pero su anhelo es mejorar su piso para una mejor higiene, 
Con este préstamo comprara: granos básicos, golosinas, lácteos, carnes, pollo, productos enlatados, y verduras para lograr aumentar sus ventas y poder cubrir sus gastos. Contenta ya que a trabes de este medio sigue invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nuris is a strong mother of two beautiful children who is dedicated to her job, selling food to achieve some stability. Together with her husband she was able to build a concrete house. Although it has a dirt floor, it is a dignified place. Her husband works as a driver, and his wages, though consistent, are low. They have not been able to make improvements to their home since Nuris' sales are low, although she hasn't stopped trying, and the money she makes goes back into buying products and paying for basic services like water and electricity, along with medication for her children, who were sick during the winter. Her goal is to improve her home's floor to make it more hygienic. With the loan she is requesting, Nuris plans to purchase basic grains, snacks, dairy products, meats, chicken, canned goods and vegetables so she can increase her sales and cover her expenses. She is happy because in this way she can continue investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, snacks, dairy products, meats, chicken, canned goods and vegetables

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a small-business owner in New York who sells beauty products to Hispanic beauty salons. He started his business in order to be more independent and to increase his income. He started his business with only $500 capital and has expanded the business and clientele over the past two years. His pride comes from selling products that are of high quality and from making beauty salons look more professional. He enjoys his job because he is constantly meeting new people and business owners.

With his loan, Jose will be able to repair his car, which he uses daily to travel between clients. He personally delivers his products and checks in with the clients he has sold to. His loan from ACCION USA will allow him to make improvements to his car so it is more adequate for his job. This will allow him to be able to sell to more clients, which will expand his business and allow him to invest in more high-end products.

One of Jose's goals for the future is to grow his business by expanding the selection of products he sells and his client base. With this loan, he'll have more security and will be able to better serve his clients. Jose has had one previous loan with ACCION USA, which was very helpful in developing his business early on. He is very motivated by Kiva lenders and hopes that those who have the business aptitude will also have the chance to get a loan for their business.

loans.use: To make repairs to his car, which is used to deliver products

loans.name: Kijjubwe Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
T. Rose, aged 46 years, has been selling goats to earn a living in the periodic markets that take place around the area in western Uganda. In this business she deals with farmers directly to purchase their livestock and then finds a ready market for them supplying to butchers, hotels and other customers in the market.

Rose’s main disadvantage in the course of doing this business has been the unstable prices in the market and low capital input. With hard work and efficient customer care skills, she has managed to keep his business going for over fourteen years.

In a month, Rose makes profits totaling to 260,000 Ugandan shillings. Her future plans are to fully expand her business transactions which will earn her more revenue to pay for her children’s education. With this loan, she anticipates great progress in achieving this dream and in stocking more goats for sale.

loans.use: To stock more goats  and expand her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 42 años, vive en su casa que es propia, al lado de su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos.Se dedica a la venta de bebidas, desde hace varios años, y  le resulta bastante rentable gracias a la dedicación diaria. Ella se inicio vendiendo bebidas en su casa, pero gracias a sus esfuerzos ahora las vende desde su pequeña tienda, y lo hace con la ayuda de su madre, quien la apoya en la atención cuando tiene que salir. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues le permite tener la libertad de dedicarse a su hogar, y a la vez generar ingresos económicos para la manutención de su familia.Espera seguir creciendo para que en el futuro pueda  terminar de construir su casa y así desea tener un local más grande, haciendo que su negocio luzca mejor y se haga más rentable.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete en pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas, para continuar progresando.Gloria tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  mayor cantidad de bebidas gasificadas, para aumentar sus ventas, y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Gloria, 42, lives in her own home with her partner and their two small children. She has sold beverages for several years; it’s been profitable thanks to her daily attention to it. She started out selling beverages in her home but, thanks to her efforts, she now has a small store. Her mother helps out by tending to customers whenever she has to go someplace. She enjoys her work very much because it gives her the freedom to tend to her household as well as earn income to support her family. She hopes to continue growing so that in the future she can finish building her house. She also hopes to have a larger store so that her business will look more appealing and thus become more profitable. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion in order to continue to progress. Gloria will use the requested funds to buy larger amounts of carbonated beverages to increase sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock beverages for her store.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija R. T. is a married woman with three children all attending school. For nine years she has been operating her business  selling peas and dumplings  door to door, at the market,  and from home to her neighbors. In addition she has houses  for rent. With a loan of Kshs 80,000, Hadija wants to purchase a bundle of baking flour, one sack of peas and two dairy cows.
Hadija faces the challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Hadija would like to run a bakery in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of baking flour, 50kgs of peas and two dairy cows.

loans.name: Kalamba Tukole Womens Gp, Mubende Group

texts.en:
W. Yusuf, aged 48 years, has been operating a Laundry and dry-cleaning business in Kalamba Trading Centre, Mubende.

This hardworking married father of five children started up his business five years ago where he cleans and irons clothes for his customers for amounts that vary with the number of clothes worked on. This has seen him earn 70,000 Ugandan shillings on a weekly basis as many people tend to be lazy on cleaning their own clothes, which helps him get a market.

With this loan, Yusuf looks forward to buying Laundry and dry-cleaning machines as they will help him make his work faster and easier. This will get him more customers and further improve his revenue.

Yusuf says that he taught himself the trade after he saw a need for the business and although he describes himself as successful in business, he still needs help from loans. In future, Yusuf hopes to open up another laundry shop to expand business.

loans.use: The revamping of his business and purchase of new laundry and dry cleaning machines

loans.name: Asonta

texts.es: Asonta, D. 54 años, es una madre D. familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Feliciano D. 80 años y el menor D. sus hijos Francisco D. 25 años, quien le ayuda en el cuidado D. su chacra. Con mucho esfuerzo Asonta ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, plátano, maíz y café, productos que son llevados a vender al por mayor en la ciudad D. Pichanaki. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse firme en su economía, es por eso que pone todo su esfuerzo en sacar adelante este negocio. Lleva  20 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Pichanaki, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo espera comprarse nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto D. los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Asonta is 54 years old. She is the mother of a very loving and hardworking family. She lives in her own house with 80-year-old husband Feliciano. The youngest of her sons is 25-year-old Francisco, who helps her look after their small farm. Through much hard work, Asonta has managed to work her land and make them productive. She grows bananas, corn and coffee, which she then sells wholesale in the town of Pichanaki. Through considerable effort and with the income she receives from the sale of her crops, she is able to keep her business going. She loves looking after her own crops and has been working in this way for 20 years. Carrying her products to Pichanaki is the most difficult task she faces, since the sacks are very heavy and she gets very tired. In time, she would like to buy more land, to increase the amount of crops she produces. This is her fourth loan from MFP and she has always been very punctual in making her payments. She expects to be this time also. Asonta is a very active member of her communal group and always keeps herself informed of the agreements that the group has reached. With the 1000 soles that she has requested, Asonta will buy more fertilisers and insecticides, so as to improve her crop yields.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and insecticides for her crops

loans.name: Bolivianitas Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Santiago II, se reúne cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal  Bolivianitas. Su presidenta es Albertina Julia P. de 39 años, casada y madre de dos niños, ella tiene su taller de chaperia, el cual administra conjuntamente  con su esposo, en esta oportunidad necesitan el préstamo para adquirir capital fijo como la moledora, el mismo le permitirá agilizar el trabajo. Albertina valora mucho el ahorro que tiene en Pro Mujer, ya que en su casa no puede ahorrar.
Sus demás compañeras también cuentan con negocios propios de comercio, servicio y producción. Todas necesitan el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Bolivianitas Group meets every two weeks in one of the Pro Mujer centers, Santiago II. Its president is Albertina, 39, who is married with two small children. She has an auto repair shop which she runs together with her husband. They need a loan to buy fixed assets, such as a grinder, which will allow them to streamline work. Albertina greatly appreciates the savings that she keeps with Pro Mujer, since she cannot keep savings in her house. The rest of her friends also count on their own businesses in commerce, service and production. All of them need this loan to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fixed assets (grinder)

loans.name: Tripple Stars Development Group Of Ntungamo

texts.en:
M. Stephen, aged 38 years with a family of six children, has been operating a retail shop in Ntungamo town selling general merchandise for over three years. There, he trades in a variety of products common for domestic use like sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil and much more, earning him a profit of 600,000 Ugandan shillings.

Stephen’s main drawback is that he has a limited stock of products in his shop that cannot satisfy his customers’ demand. Therefore, he is looking forward to increasing the stock in his business when he gets this loan and also expanding into a wholesale shop. This will help him earn more revenue and sustain his daily life needs as he envisions improving his family’s standard of living and, further, buying a motorcycle to hire out.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his store

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro, de 43 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposa y sus dos hijos.Desde hace 6 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, de una reconocida marca a nivel mundial. Para comercializar sus productos, al por mayor, viaja a diferentes provincias y abastece a sus clientes fijos. Es por esta razón, que se  encuentra feliz con su trabajo, aunque sea poco usual que un varón se dedique a la venta de estos productos, pues es un rubro femenino,  pero él  no se hace problemas, pues gracias a este trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, y le gusta porque además es un trabajo tranquilo. En el futuro quiere seguir mejorando su negocio, para lograr mayores ventas, ya que anhela convertirse en un gran empresario. Actualmente se encuentra construyendo su casa, pues piensa que esto le ayudará para que en el futuro instale  un negocio en su casa.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y siempre se ha caracterizado  por ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.Isidro tiene planeado invertir el  dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de  mercadería en productos de belleza,  al por mayor, para viajar y distribuir estos productos pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes. De esta manera espera seguir trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Isidro is 43 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and 2 children. For the past 6 years, he has been selling beauty products from a well-known international brand. To sell his products wholesale, he travels to visit established clients in different provinces. For this reason, he is very happy in his work, although it is not typical for a man to be involved in the sale of such products. This does not seem to cause him any difficulties and it is thanks to this job that he is able to provide for the costs of his home. In the future, he would like to continue improving his business and sales, since he hopes to become a successful businessman. At present, he is building his own home, in which he hopes one day to establish his business. This is the second loan he has requested from MFP. He has always been responsible in making his payments on time. Isidro is planning to invest the money he has requested in purchasing a large amount of beauty products wholesale. He will then travel and distribute these products, since he already has various pending orders. In this way, he hopes to continue working in search of progress.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large amount of beauty products for his business

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, un distrito de relieve bastante accidentado dada su cercanía a la sierra, sus actividades principales son la agricultura y el comercio, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y comercio de animales desde hace 10 años, ella cría aves de corral y animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona para adquirir animales y revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo y en Cayaltí. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo de la mejor manera posible.

Fabiola desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Fabiola es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, bastante entregada a su familia y a su trabajo, sus dias transcurren entre el cuidado de su hogar y el de sus animales. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 33 years old. She is married and has two school-aged children. She lives with her family in the Oyotún district, an area with very rugged terrain due to its proximity to the Andean highlands. The chief activities in the zone, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, are agriculture and trade. For the past ten years, Fabiola has worked raising and selling animals. She raises domestic birds and small animals in the back yard of her home. When the animals have reached a good stage of development, she offers them for sale to buyers who visit the zone to purchase animals and resell them in the city of Chiclayo and in Cayaltí. This business allows her to help her husband with the household expenses; she always tries to support her family in the best way possible. Fabiola would like to acquire more animals as well as nutritionally balanced animal feed to expand her business and obtain greater profits. To reach this objective, she finds it necessary to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 500 Peruvian new soles. Fabiola is a responsible and hard-working woman who is extremely dedicated to her family and her work. She spends her days caring for her home and family as well as her animals. In the area where she lives, her neighbors and acquaintances consider her a steady and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying small animals and balanced animal feed to expand her business

loans.name: Retamitas Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Santiago II, se reúne  la Asociación Comunal  Retamitas. Su presidenta es Angélica M. de 43 años, casada y madre de cinco niños, ella se dedica al comercio de abarrotes (arroz, fideo, azúcar), tiene su propia tienda instalada en su domicilio, vende desde las 6 de la mañana a 10 de la noche, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, fideo, pañales y licores. Sus demás compañeras también cuentan con negocios propios de comercio, servicio y producción. Todas necesitan el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Retamitas” meets at one of the Community Centers of Pro Mujer, Santiago II. Their president is Angélica M.. She is 43, married, and has five children. She sells groceries (rice, noodles, sugar). She has her own store set up in her house. She sells from six in the morning until ten at night. Her children help her. She now needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, diapers, and liquor. The rest of her colleagues also have their own businesses of selling, providing services, and production. All of them need the loan to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To diversify his business by buying sanitary products and reselling them at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aide Plus Group

texts.en:
Aide Plus is a group of owners of small businesses chaired by Lyly K.. It is composed of 27 members who are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.
Lyly K. is 33 years old, married and the mother of four children whose ages are between 1 and 14 years old. Two of them attend school.
She sells loaves of bread at the market located at the heart of Kinshasa. Lyly has been a micro-entrepreneur since 1999. Her business is developing progressively. Lyly is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of products with her next loan by buying two racks of loaves of bread and reselling them at a profit with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $35 per week. Her ambition is to someday open a pastry business.

loans.use: increasing her inventory by buying two racks of loaves of bread and reselling them at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
Olga C. C. integrante de la Asociación Comunal San Pablo que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Santiago II, tiene 30 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, esta es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer ya que fue invitada por un funcionario de la institución. Olga se dedica a vender ropa hace 4 años con el apoyo de una amiga pudo sacar adelante su negocio que además le permite cuidar a su pequeño hijo. Ella tiene su puesto de venta en la Ceja, específicamente en la avenida Tihuanaku. Con el préstamo tiene planificado comprar más ropa y tener mayor clientela. Ella tiene el deseo estar por mucho tiempo con la familia de Pro Mujer.
Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen diversas actividades económicas del área de producción, servicio y comercio.
texts.en:
Olga C. C. is a member of the San Pablo Communal Association which in turn belongs to the Santiago II Center. She is 30 years old and lives near the city of El Alto. This is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer [For Women], having been invited by an official of the institution. Olga has worked for 4 years selling clothing. With the help of a friend she has been able to move ahead with her business while still being able to take care of her young son. She has a sales location in La Ceja [an area near El Alto], specifically on the Tihuanaku Avenue. With the loan she plans to buy more clothing and have a larger clientele. She wants to remain for a long time with the Pro Mujer family. The other members of this association have various economic activities in the areas of production, service, and commerce.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 63 años, es un padre muy amoroso y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Anita (63) y sus 3 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Desde muy joven, se dedica  al cultivo de café, ya que esta es la actividad que se ha realizado en su familia, desde muchas generaciones atrás. Vende el café a sus compradores fijos, que llegan hasta sus chacras, y ellos  posteriormente llevan el producto a venderlo a la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, ya lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus plantaciones, porque debe realizarlo con cuidado. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para poder incrementar sus plantaciones de café.Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y se compromete a hacerlo, además en su banco comunal es un integrante muy respetuoso con el resto.Luis tiene planeado invertir los  mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, en la compra de más abono y fertilizantes para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Luis is a 63-year-old loving and hard-working father. He lives in his own home with his wife, Anita, also 63, and their three children, who are his motivation in all his endeavors. Since he was very young, Luis has made a living cultivating coffee because that is what his family has done for many generations. He sells his coffee to fixed buyers who come to his farm, and they in turn take the product to the city to sell. What he most enjoys about his work is cultivating his land, and he does it with a lot of care, since he has been doing this activity for 30 years. He considers fumigating his coffee crops as his most difficult task. This is his third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he knows he has to make his payments on time and promises to do so. Luis is a very respected member of his community bank. He plans to invest the loan in the purchase of more compost and fertilizers for the upcoming planting.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Leonardo Jaime

texts.es:
Leonardo Jaime thornè D. 37 años vive con su cónyuge y  2 hijos D. 4 y 6 años D. edad, en el Municipio D. Malambo, área metropolitana D. BarranquilL., y tiene el negocio D. vender agua purificada y frigoríficos que él mismo procesa, además D. otro donD. alquiL. lavadoras. Leonardo quiere comprar  una carretilL. para L. moto, para facilitar el transporte  D. sus tanques D. agua y necesita tambien adquirirá mas tanques para ampliar sus posibilidades D. mercado; esta es L. razon  por lo cual está aplicando a un crédito por valor D. $1.000.000 COP.
Leonardo es auxiliar contable y trabajó durante 6 años con el estado en el municipio D. Malambo, pero hace 2 años quedó sin empleo y con su liquidación comenzó a vender carnes frías , luego se dio cuenta que el servicio D. alquiler D. lavadoras era una buena alternativa y compró sus primeras 2 lavadoras y cuando hace un año, a través D. L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, conoció a un microempresario que venD. agua purificada, comenzó como su vendedor y este finalmente al ver su capacidad emprendedora, le recomendó a esta organización, donD. solicitó su primer crédito, con el que compró su propia planta purificadora con tres filtros D. ozono y 1 tanque D. almacenamiento, en L. actualidad esta es L. actividad que más ingreso le genera, pero tiene L. dificultad para transportar distribuir el agua y ha recurrido a su hermana para que le facilite L. moto con carretilL. adjunta, para cumplir con los pedidos. Leonardo dice que su vida ha cambiado desD. que recibió su primer crédito conL. Fundación, porque logró independizarse y han mejorado notablemente sus ingresos familiares. Sueña con tener una vivienda propia y fortalecer el negocio mejorando su infraestructura e incrementando su clienteL.. Su desafío inicial fuè cuando perdió su empleo, pero esto lo llevó a desarrollar su potencial emprendedor y en este momento las condiciones son otras, aunque aún como no tiene casa propia L. purificadora L. tiene en L. casa D. su madre. Leonardo se siente muy conternto porque en Malambo este es un buen negocio porque L. percepción D. los ciudadanos D. que su agua no es potable, los lleva a buscar el negocio D. Leonardo como una buena alternativa D. consumo D. agua pura.
texts.en:
Leonardo Jaime T., 37, lives with his partner and their 2 children, 4- and 6-years old, in the Malambo neighborhood of BarranquilL.. He operates a business selling cold, purified water that he processes himself. He also has a second business renting washing machines. Leonardo wants to buy a trailer for his motorcycle so that he can more easily carry tanks of water and he needs to buy more tanks so that he can expand his water business. That´s why he´s applying for a COP$1,000,000 loan. Leonardo is a bookkeeper and he worked for the state in Malambo for 6 years before he was laid off 2 years ago. He used his severance pay to start a business selling cold meats. He then hit on the idea of renting washing machines, a business for which he bought two machines. A year ago, the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo matched him with a microbusiness selling purified water. He started working for the business as a salesman. When he saw the potential for the business, he applied to the Fundacion for a loan so that he could start his own business. He bought a water purifier with three filters and 1 storage tank and the business now generates more than his other. The problem is that he can´t easily carry the water so he has asked his sister to help him by riding along in a sidecar for deliveries. Leonardo says that his life has changed since he received his first Fundacion loan because it´s allowed him to set up his own business and increased his income. Losing his job was a challenge, but it has allowed him to develop his potential as an entrepreneur. Since he doesn´t have a house of his own, he operates the business at his mother´s house. Leonardo is very happy with the business because he can sell safe water to the people of Malambo where the feeling is that the water is not safe.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy trailer for transporting water for water business.

loans.name: Bertilda

texts.es: Bertilda, de 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cirilo de 39 años, quien trabaja en la municipalidad de Pichana, y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. El trabajo al que se dedica, es el cultivo de plátano y café. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, puesto que sabe que las ganancias que reciba, dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así vera que todo esfuerzo tiene su recompensa, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que desinfectar con productos químicos, ya que corre el riesgo que se enferme. Con el tiempo espera sembrar todas sus tierras, para obtener mejores ingresos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más insumos para evitar las plagas de sus campos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Bertilda is a 38-year-old woman who is very hard-working and responsible. She lives in her own home with her husband Cirilo, 39, who works in the municipality of Pichana, and their four beloved children, for whom they want to provide a better future. She makes a living cultivating bananas and coffee. She wakes up very early in the morning every day to work on her crops, knowing that her profits will depend heavily on the quality of her products. What she most likes about her job is harvesting her lands, since she gets to see all of her hard work bearing fruit. She has been doing this activity for 20 years, and considers disinfecting her crops with chemical products as the most difficult task, since she runs the risk of getting sick. With time she hopes to plant all of her lands and increase her income. This is Bertilda's fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she tells us this will help her very much in making progress with her work. She is very beloved by the rest of her fellow community bank members, since she is very close with them. With the 800 nuevos soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase more supplies to rid her crops of pests.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to rid her crops of pests

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer German Busch, se reúne la Asociación Comunal COPO DE NIEVE, con 8 integrantes 

Una de las integrantes es Barbara V. de 34 años, casada  y madre de 4 niños. Tiene el negocio de fabricación y venta de alfombras hace 15 años, y con el préstamo tiene planificado comprar material de trabajo como hijos e hilacha, le colaboran en el negocio sus hijos y su mamá. 
Las demás integrantes de éste grupo cuentan con variados negocios y necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería, materia prima según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
In one of the central offices of Pro Mujer in German Busch, the communal bank "Copo de Nieve" meets. The group has 8 members. One of the members is Barbara V.. She is 34 years old, married, and is the mother of 4 children. She has had a business making and selling rugs for 15 years. With the loan she plans to buy materials for her work such as yarn and fabric remnants. Her children and her mother also participate in this business. The other members of this group have a variety of businesses, and they need this loan to buy merchandise and raw materials according to the type of business that they have.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw material (yarn)

loans.name: Las Gardeneas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  las Gardenias les gusto el nombre porque dicen que ellas son como las flores de bonitas,  son 6 integrantes: la Sra. Ma. Magdalena Aragón Vázquez  se dedica a la venta de antojitos, la Sra. Milia B. R. a la venta de paletas  de hielo, la Sra. Petra T. B. se dedica a la venta de queso y crema, la Sra. Berenice V. Méndez a la venta de raspados, la Sra. Azucena Rojas F. va a iniciar la venta de zapatos, la Sra. Nancy V. Vázquez también va a iniciar una actividad, la venta de dulces.
Ma. Magdalena es la representante del grupo ella es madre soltera por que  se separo de su esposo hace 5 años a pesar de eso, ella no se dejo caer en la depresión y decidió salir adelante y trabajar para sus hijos: Leticia de 17 años, Gabriela de 16 años, Ricardo de 13 años. Ella empezó trabajando en el parque industrial de Cuautla, era cocinera y su horario era de 8:00 a 6:00 de la tarde por tal motivo descuidaba mucho a sus hijos es por eso que decidió poner un negocio en su casa para ya no abandonarlos tanto tiempo y este fue la venta de antojitos, este negocio le permite disfrutar más a sus hijos porque lo atiende de 8:00 a 12:00 del día,  lleva 1 año con él y le va muy bien
Con el crédito quiere surtirse de mercancía para elaborar los alimentos que ella prepara como son: las quesadillas, sopes y tacos. Su meta para el futuro es construir un local especial para su negocio ya que por el momento vende en la calle afuera de su casa.
Ma. Magdalena dice que está muy contenta de que Fundación Realidad les dé la oportunidad de darles un préstamo a ella y su grupo: las gardenias. Está segura de que no les fallarán. También les agradece a las personas de KIVA porque están dispuestos a ayudar a la gente que más lo necesita y así pueden sacar adelante tanto a sus negocios como a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Gardenias" (The Gardenias). They like the name because they say that they are like those beautiful flowers. There are 6 members: Magdalena Aragón Vázquez sells snacks, Milia B. R. sells popcicles, Petra T. B. sells cheese and cream, Sra. Berenice V. Méndez sells raspados (shaved ice treats), Azucena Rojas F. is going to start a shoe business, and Nancy V. Vázquez will also start a business selling sweets. Magdalena is the representative of the group. She is a single mother, because she separated from her husband 5 years ago. In spite of this, she did not let herself fall into depression; she decided to push ahead and work for her children: Leticia, who is 17; Gabriela, who is 16; and Ricardo, who is 13 years old. She started working in the industrial park of Cuautla; she was a cook and she worked from 8am until 6 in the evening. This schedule did not allow her to care for her children, and for this reason she decided to start a business in her house making snacks so she would not have to leave them for so much time. This business has allowed her to enjoy her children more, because she attends to the business from 8am until noon. She has had this business for a year, and it is going very well. With the loan she wants to stock up on merchandise to make the food that she prepares, such as: quesadillas, sopes and tacos. Her goal for the future is to build a special place for her business, since at the moment she sells in the street outside her house. Magdalena says that she is very content with the Fundación Realidad. They have given her and her group (The Gardenias) the opportunity to take loans. She is sure that they are going to succeed. Also, she is grateful to the people from Kiva because they are willing to help the people who need it most, and in this way help them get ahead with their businesses and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 33 años, es un padre muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Yeny (27) y sus 3 pequeños hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Con muchas ganas de trabajar Raúl sale todos los días a cultivar sus tierras, él tiene  principalmente plantaciones de café y plátano, productos que vienen a comprarle personal de cooperativas de la ciudad, debido a la buena calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad, y considera que lo más difícil es tener que fumigar sus tierras, ya que las plagas perjudicarían sus cultivos. Para más adelante, espera que su producción mejore en cantidad, pues de eso dependen los ingresos económicos de su familia.Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, esta muy satisfecho de haberlo obtenido y promete  pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, además en su banco comunal es un integrante muy querido.Raúl tiene planeado invertir los mil nuevos soles solicitados en la compra de más abono para sus chacras, ya que desea que produzcan en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Raúl is 33 years old and is a very happy father and worker. He lives in his own home with his wife Yeny (27) and their three small children, who are the principal motivation for all of his efforts. Having strong work ethic, Raúl goes out every day to cultivate their land. He mainly has coffee and banana plantations. Because of the high quality of his products, his buyers include staff from urban cooperatives. What he likes most about his work is cultivating his land. He has 15 years of experience doing this and believes that the most difficult part is having to spray the crops in order to prevent pests from harming them. In the future, he hopes to see an increase in the quantity of production, given this is what his family's income depends on. Raúl plans to use the requested $375 to buy additional compost for his crops, making it possible for them to yield greater quantities. He is a very valued member of his community bank. This is his third loan with MFP. He is very pleased to have received it and is committed to making all payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase compost for his crops

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eduardo de 48 años y sus 4 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, Dina trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra plátano y café, ya que estos productos son muy solicitados en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lleva  24 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas, considera además que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos. Para el futuro espera poder comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción actual. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono.
texts.en:
Dina, 42, is a very happy and hard-working mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Eduardo, 48, and their 4 young children, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life. With her husband, Dina works every day in the fields. With much work she has achieved great productivity from her land, and she now plants everything, since she knows that every product she obtains will be of very good quality. She mainly plants plantains and coffee, since these products are in high demand in the market of the Pichanaki city. For 24 years she has done this work and what she most loves about her job is keeping her crops safe from pests. She considers her greatest difficulty to be transporting her crops. In the future she hopes to purchase more land to increase her production. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she feels that this loan will help her greatly in the development of her activity. In her community group she is a very responsible member, of which she is very proud. The 2000 soles she is requesting will be invested in improving her crops; for this, she will buy fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for improved production

loans.name: Luz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Luz tiene 60 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo, todos sus hijos ya están independizados. ResiD. en el distrito D. Oyotún, un distrito D. territorio bastanta accidentado debido a su cercanía con la sierra, sus principales actividades son la agricultura y el comercio. Se encuentra ubicado a dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace diez años a la venta D. produtos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, este negocio nació D. la necesidad D. contar con algunos ingresos adicionales con los cuales salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar, ella trata D. manterner su negocio brindando un trato amable y productos D. calidad a sus clientes.

Luz desea adqurir mas productos para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Luz es una mujer que da lo mejor D. si para sacar adelante a su trabajo y a su familia. En la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Luz is 60, married and lives with her husband; all of their children are now independent. She lives in the Oyotun district, a rather rugged district of territory due to its proximity to the mountains. The main activities in the district incluD. agriculture and business. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For ten years Luz has sold basic needs products and groceries in a store located in her home. This business was born from the need for additional income to succeed and help her husband with household costs. She tries to maintain her business through offering kind service and quality products to her customers. Luz wants to acquire more products to increase her sales and earn more income, and in order to achieve her goal she has found it necessary to request a first loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Luz is a woman who gives the best of herself to succeed in her business and help her family to succeed. In her neighbourhood her neighbours and acquaintances hold her in high esteem and trust her.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of basic needs products and groceries

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén, de 33 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Luisa (32) y sus 3 pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Trabajando arduamente Rubén ha logrado convertir sus cultivos en uno de los mejores de su poblado, gracias a esto, sus  productos son de muy buena calidad y siempre tiene compradores que pagan muy bien por ellos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, y ya lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que puedan atacarlas. Para mas adelante desea comprar un auto  con el cual pueda transportar sus productos, y así calcula que tendría mayores ganancias, pues ahorraría en el transporte de su mercadería.Es  el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo, y en su banco comunal es un integrante muy cumplido y activo.Rubén tiene planeado invertir los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados en la compra de cantidad de abono para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Rubén, 33, lives in his own home with his wife Luisa (32) and their 3 little children, to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. Working hard, Ruben has made his crops some of the best in the village. Thanks to this, his products are of very good quality and he always has buyers who pay very well for them. What he likes most about his work is harvesting his products. He has been doing this for 20 years and he considers the most difficult part to be keeping his crops safe from the pests that can attack them. Later on, he wants to buy a car with which he will be able to transport his products; this way, he calculates that he will have better earnings, since he will save on transportation of his merchandise. This is his third loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to pay the quotas punctually if he wants to access another loan. In his community bank he is a very responsible and active member. Ruben plans to invest the requested 800 soles in the purchase of fertilizer for his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 42 años, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rosa de 29 años y sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En los años que tiene de vida, Jorge nunca le huyo al trabajo y es que desde muy joven trabajó en cualquier oficio. Ahora posee chacras, las cuales le dan los ingresos que necesita para mantener a su familia. Paralelamente a esta actividad, trabaja también en la municipalidad de la comunidad de San Juan, y con este nuevo ingreso económico ha logrado poner una pequeña tiendita, que ahora ha procurado mantenerla surtida y por eso es muy concurrida por todos sus vecinos. De todas las actividades que realiza, le gusta más trabajar en su tienda, puesto que disfruta mucho el brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes, pese a que son largas horas que tiene que estar en su negocio, pero no le importa, con tal de progresar en la vida. Con el tiempo, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor comodidad. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, en sus primeros pagos fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, es de los pocos hombres de su grupo comunal, por lo cual es muy querido por el resto de las socias. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Jorge, 42, is a very responsible and hard-working father. He lives in his own home with his wife Rosa, 29, and their 2 young children, who are the motivation behind all of his work. In all his life, Jorge has never avoided work; since a very young age he worked in various jobs. He now owns fields, which provide him the income he needs to maintain his family. He also works in the municipality of the San Juan community. With this new income he has been able to open a small store, which he has kept stocked; so it is very popular with the neighbours. Of all of his jobs, he most likes working in his store, since he benefits greatly from offering good service to his customers, despite the long hours he has to spend in the store. But this does not bother him; it's all about progressing in life. With time, he hopes to expand the facilities of his store to offer his customers greater convenience. This is his fifth loan with MFP. He was very punctual with his first payments and he hopes to continue being so. He is one of the few men in his community group, so he is very dear to the rest of the members. With the 700 soles he is requesting, he will purchase more products to improve his store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more products to improve his store

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal La Nueva Esperanza, está ubicado en el departamento de Huancavelica, inicia su ciclo 3 con 15 socias.

Edita, es casada y tiene 02 hijos de 20 y 18 años. Edita se dedica a proveer madera para fabricar muebles y construcciones. Edita ha podido adquirir mercadería gracias a los prestamos obtenidos y así a podido atender mas pedidos, generándole esto buenos ingresos. Edita quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por lo cual quiere acceder aun crédito nuevamente, de esta manera hacer de su maderera una de las mas importantes y prosperas.

Mercedes, es casada y tiene 01 hijo de 07 años, quien va a ala escuela. Mercedes fabrica piñatas y adornos para fiestas infantiles, negocio que ha tenido mayor demanda, ya que ha podido tener mayor producción gracias a sus créditos. Mercedes necesita de un nuevo préstamo, para seguir produciendo en mayor cantidad y así alcanzar su primera meta, que es tener su propia piratería.
texts.en:
The La Nueva Esperanza ("The New Hope") community bank is located in the Huancavelica department. It is starting its third cycle with 15 members. Edita is married and has 2 children ages 20 and 18. Edita supplies lumber for making furniture and buildings. Edita has been able to acquire merchandise thanks to the loans she obtained, and this way she has been able to fill more orders, generating a good income. Edita wants to keep investing in her business, so she wants to take out a new loan. This way she will make her wood business one of the most important and prosperous. Mercedes is married and has 1 child, age 7, who goes to school. Mercedes makes pinatas and decorations for children's parties. This business has had much demand, and she has been able to have better production thanks to her loans. Mercedes needs a new loan to keep producing in greater quantities and to meet her first goal, which is to have her own pinata store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of good quality material and items for their businesses

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Antonio (55) y sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Trabajando arduamente junto a su esposo ha logrado hacer de sus cultivos unos de los más productivos de su poblado. Todas las mañanas sin importar las condiciones del clima, salen a trabajar sus chacras, ya que saben que de ello dependen los ingresos que obtendrán por la venta de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta las ciudades de Pichanaki y La Merced. Y con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción, y así planea que obtendrá mayores ganancias.Es el  tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y espera ser muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, y  en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra.Victoria tiene planeado invertir  los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, en la compra de mayor cantidad de  abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Victoria, 46, lives in her own house with her husband Antonio (55) and their two small children, to whom she wants to give a better quality of life. Working hard with her husband, she has managed to make her crops some of the most productive in their town. Every morning, no matter what the weather is like, they go out to work their fields, since they know that the income they will receive from the sale of their crops depends on it. What Victoria likes most about her work is working the fields. She has been doing this work for 30 years, and she thinks the most difficult part is transporting her crops to the cities of Pichanaki and La Merced. And with time, she wants to buy more land to increase her production, and in this way she plans to have more earnings. This is the third loan that Victoria has had with MFP, and she expects to be very punctual with her payments. In her communal bank, she is a very respected member due to the responsibility she demonstrates. Victoria plans to invest the three thousand new soles she is asking for in the purchase of more fertilizer to make her land more fertile.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Karla Jennifer

texts.es:
Karla es una madre de familia de 20 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, un distrito dedicado principalmente a actividades agrícolas como la ganadería y el cultivo de tabaco, se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años al negocio de venta y preparación de alimentos. Ella prepara salchipapas y salchipollos, estos platos son originarios de nuestro país y se venden en diversos establecimientos tanto formales como ambulantes, consisten en una cobinación de papas y salchichas fritas en el caso de salchipapas y de papas y pollo frito en el caso del salchipollo.

Karla vende estos platos de modo ambulante, el negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el rubro y a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus alimentos, ella cuenta actualmente con una clientela fiel que siempre acude a su establecimiento.

Karla desea ampliar sus ventas adquiriendo mas insumos para seguir preparando alimentos, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es tener su casa propia ya que actualmente vive en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Karla is a 20 year-old mother who lives with her husband and her son in the Nueva Arica district. In this district the economic activities are primarily agricultural, such as the raising of livestock and the cultivation of tobacco. It is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. For 3 years she has been preparing and selling food. She makes salchipapas and salchipollos. These dishes are typical of this country, and are sold in diverse establishments, from restaurants to street vendors. These dishes consist of a combination of potatoes and fried sausages, in the case of salchipapas, and potatoes and fried chicken, in the case of salchipollo. Karla sells these dishes on the street, and this business allows her to help her husband with the support of the family's expenses. As a result of her experience and her good cooking, she now has a regular clientele who always comes to her establishment. Karla wants to increase her sales, acquiring more supplies so that she can continue to prepare food. For this reason she has requested for the first time a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 800 Peruvian soles that will help her achieve this objective. She is a woman who is very hardworking and devoted to her family. Her main wish is to have her own house, since she is currently living in her parent's home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to expand her business producing and selling food

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: Leoncio, de 48 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Cristina de 49 años y sus 4 hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El cultivo de café y plátano es la actividad a la que se dedica Leoncio, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a trabajar a sus chacras, con el único fin de esforzarse mucho para que sus cultivos tengan muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, para evitar las plagas de sus siembras. Con el tiempo, espera sembrar más, de esa manera tener una mejor producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro aporte. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más café, para ampliar sus actuales plantaciones.
texts.en:
Leoncio, 48, is a very loving and responsible father; he lives in his own house with his wife, Cristina, 49, and their four children for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Leoncio is a coffee and banana farmer; he goes out very early in the morning every day to tend to his fields his only goal being to do his best to insure high quality crops. What he enjoys the most about his work is cultivating the land; he has been in this line of work for 10 years and considers the most difficult part of it fumigating the fields to avoid pests. In time, he’d like to plant more so that production will be better. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he realizes that he must make all his repayments on time if he wants to have access to future loans. He is a very trustworthy and active group member who plans to use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more coffee plants in order to increase the size of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional coffee plants.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
La  Sra. Karla Solórzano P. es una persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio en el mercado Israel lewite.
Ella junto con su marido administra el negocio, trabajan de lunes a domingo de las siete de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde vendiendo gaseosa, jugos, ropa y juguetes, ella se sube a los buses que se encuentran en la cotran del mercado cerca de donde tiene su tramo.
Ella a trabajado con ceprodel tres prestamos los cuales han sido para la compra de mercadería y asi poder ofertar mas productos y hacerle frente a la competencia que se encuentra al lado.
Karla dijo que se siente satisfecha con los prestamos que ceprodel le ha dado los cuales me han ayudado mucho en mi negocio.
texts.en:
Karla Solórzano P. is an enterprising person who has her business in the Israel Lewite market. She runs it together with her husband; they are open from Monday through Sunday from 7am until 6pm selling soft-drinks, juices, clothing and toys. She gets into the buses that stop at the market’s Cotran (bus station) near her stall to sell her products. She has been collaborating with Ceprodel for three loans that she’s used to buy merchandise in order to have more varied stock to offer and be able to compete against competitors nearby. Karla said that she’s satisfied with Ceprodel’s loans which have been very helpful for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, purified water, Shaler Kola, clothing, purses, knapsacks, juices, toys.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: La señora Gloria Maria A. tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos menores. La señora tiene en su casa un negocio de venta de mercadería en general, ella vende leña, frijoles cocidos, frutas, golosinas, etc. Ella ya tiene 2 años de tener este negocio, el cual empezó debido al bajo salario que ganaba su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad, esto con el objetivo de brindar manutención a sus hijos. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras variadas de sus productos, ya que quiere empezar a vender más para ganarles más. Además, aduce la señora, cada día los precios de los productos están cada día más caros. Este se ha convertido en un desafió para ella, debido a que la situación económica del país cada día está más difícil. Ella sueña con seguir adelante en su negocio, tratando siempre de que sus hijos estudien y se preparen.
texts.en:
Gloria María A., 48, is married and has 4 children, two adults and two minors. She has a general store in her home where she sells firewood, cooked beans, fruit, snacks, etc. She has been in this line of work for 2 years. She began it because her husband’s salary as a security guard was too low and she needed more income to support her children. She wants this loan in order to buy assorted products to stock in order to increase sales and profits. She also cites the fact that product prices are rising daily; this has become quite a challenge for her because the country’s economic situation is more difficult each day. She dreams with being able to continue with her store always trying to insure that her children study and prepare themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: David Agustin

texts.es:
David de 22 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (su originalidad fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil, cuando se gradúo del colegio no encontró trabajo y su papa le empezó a enseñar como hacer panes.     

Después que el aprendió ha hacer panes el invirtió sus ahorros en un horno y empezó a venderlos, por esa buena decisión el ahora el tiene una pequeña panadería en su casa, trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Cada pan lo vende a $ 0.10. 

Para una mejor atención a sus clientes el quiere dar desayunos y comprar con el préstamo una licuadora y sacos de harina para hacer mas pan. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener su panadería mas surtida.
texts.en:
David, 22, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (it used to be a field where many orchids grew), Guayaquil. When he graduated from high school he didn’t find a job so his father taught him how to bake bread. When he learned how to bake he used his savings to buy an oven and started selling bread. This good decision has led to his having a small bakery in his home. He works from 6:30am until 9pm every day; he sells each roll for $0.10. To provide better customer service, he wants to start selling breakfast and wants to use the loan to buy a blender and sacks of flour for more bread. In the future, he wants to finish building his house and have a better stocked bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a mixer and flour.

loans.name: Flora Maria

texts.es:
Flora de 52 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (su originalidad fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil, hace ya algunos años ella tiene su negocio de comidas rápidas su hija le ayuda venderlas hasta las 22h00pm. 

Para tener el negocio tuvo que invertir su ahorros en víveres para comida, poco a poco con esfuerzo su negocio de comida fue creciendo. Ahora ella tiene su puesto de comidas rápidas y vende arroz con pollo, carne. Para darle un mejor servicio a los clientes ella quiere readecuar su puesto de comida comprando con el préstamo cañas, cemento y víveres.    

Una de sus metas es tener su propio restaurante y tener canchas deportivas para alquilar.
texts.en:
Flora is 52 years old, and she lives in the urban area Las Orquídeas (it got its name because it was a field with lots of orchids) in Guayaquil. She has had her fast food business for some years now. Her daughter helps her sell the food until 10:00 p.m. To have the business she had to invest her savings in supplies for food. Little by little, and with effort, her food business was growing. Now she has a fast food stand, and she sells rice with chicken and meat. To give her customers better service she wants to make adaptations to her food stand. She will use the loan to buy cane, cement, and supplies. One of her goals is to have her own restaurant and to have sports fields to rent.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cane and cement

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
El comité “Prosperidad” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. 
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, peluquería, preparación de comidas rápidas. 
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Aurelia R. quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles  en un copetín en su casa.
Ella cada día se levanta muy temprano para preparar los comestibles más tradicionales de la zona como empanadas, milanesas, huevos, chipas. 
Los preparados de la señora están hechos de forma muy higiénica y con productos nuevos y fresco, por lo que los clientes acuden con frecuencia para  degustar los preparados de la señora Aurelia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que normalmente utiliza para sus comestibles.
texts.en:
The “Prosperidad” (Prosperity) committee was formed when several neighbors in the city of Villa Elisa decided to join together. All of the group members have independent activities: some are in sales, others are hairdressers and some prepare fast food. The members formed a very unified and capable group able to undertake activities together that strengthen their companionship. One of the group members is Aurelia R. who sells food in a small snack bar in her home. She gets up very early in the morning every day to prepare traditional dishes from the area like: empanadas (turnovers), milanesas (breaded meat), eggs and chipas (corn and cheese bread). Her meals are prepared very hygienically with new and fresh ingredients so customers come by frequently to enjoy Aurelia’s dishes. She is asking for funding to buy the ingredients that she normally uses to prepare her meals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baked goods, vegetables, fruits, meat, condiments, beverages, disposable containers, etc.

loans.name: Amparo De La Concepcion

texts.es: Amparo de la Concepción tiene 49 años. Pues de desde muy joven le ha gustado el trabajo, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita con Fundación León, que es su mayor ayuda que tiene hasta los momentos pues ella ha demostrado que han sido para la inversión de su negocio. Ella se dedica al destace de cerdo negocio que lo realiza desde hace 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre están visitándola por los buenos productos que ofrece. Ya que es el único oficio que conoce y que le ha generado ganancias. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Amparo de la Concepción, 49, has enjoyed working since she was a young woman. This isn’t her first loan request from Fundación León, which is her major help at the moment, because she has demonstrated that the loans have been to invest in her business. She has been butchering pigs for over 4 years and most of her customers come to her due to the high quality of the product she offers. This is the only work she knows how to do and it has produced profits. She will use the requested funds to buy pigs. Her dream is to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 34 años, es una madre muy alegre y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Tomas de 37 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. El trabajo al que Marcelina se dedica, es cultivar plátano y café. Es que todos los días, desde muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en la siembra de estos productos. En lo posible procuro que su producción se mejor cada día, ya que eso dependerá para poder obtener las ganancias que necesita. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, de esa manera recibe la recompensa gracias a todo el esfuerzo y empeño que puso sobre sus cultivos. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras de las plagas. En adelante, desea cultivar todas sus tierras, pata incrementar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes, para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marcelina, age 34, is a very happy and loving mother. She lives in her own house with her 37 year old husband, Tomas, and their two dear children. They wish to give their children a better education. Marcelina grows bananas and coffee. Starting very early in the morning, she works everyday cultivating these products. As far as possible, her production improves each day. This is what she depends on to be able to get the earnings she needs. What she likes most about her work is harvesting her land. That way she gets the reward that is thanks to all of the work and determination that she put into her crops. She has been doing this activity for 20 years. The most difficult part is taking care of her fields so that they are free of pests. Later, she wishes to plant all of her fields in order to increase her production. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She says that this loan will help her a lot in the progress of her work. She is very dear to the rest of her colleagues in her communal bank because she is very supportive of them. She will use the 3,000 PEN that she is requesting to buy more natural and chemical fertilizers in order to improve her crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more natural and chemical fertilizers in order to improve production

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 40 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Víctor de 38 años y su hija menor Yanira de 11 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El cultivo de plátano y café es la actividad que realiza diariamente Maribel. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados en la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde lleva a vender sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para poder sembrar más. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su grupo comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los trescientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Maribel is a simple, 40-year-old, hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband Victor, 38, and her minor daughter Yanira, 11. She wants to offer them a better quality of life. Cultivating plantains and coffee is what Maribel does every day. With much effort she has made her fields very productive, and her crops very high quality and much appreciated in the city of Pichanaki, where she takes them to sell. What she likes most about her work is caring for the crops; she has been doing this for 15 years. Maribel thinks that the most difficult part is transporting the crops, since the sacks are very heavy and tire her greatly. In the future she wants to purchase new fields, to be able to sow more. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she intends to be very punctual in her payments, since she doesn't wish to create problems for her communal group, in which she feels very content. With the 300 new sols she requests, she will purchase more manure for her farms.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MANURE FOR HER FIELDS OF PLANTAINS AND COFFEE

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, es conviviente, tiene 6 hijos el mayor de 20 años y el menor de 14. Dina tiene una chicharroneria en un local alquilado este negocio lo maneja con su esposo desde hace 10 años, antes se dedicaba a la venta de emoliente.
