Gracias a los prestamos que ha recibido ha podido comprar su casa, su esposo también le ayuda, es chofer de ruta.
Dina tiene en FINCA 12 años aproximadamente, gracias a los prestamos que ha recibido ha podido mejorar su negocio, pues le ha apoyado en la inversión y gracias a las capacitaciones sabe como tratar a sus clientes.
Dina solicita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será utilizado en la compra de 20 cajas de bebidas para su negocio.
Su sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Paloma (The Dove) communal bank; she has 6 children the oldest of whom is 20 years old and the youngest is 14. She rents a locale where she runs a chicharronería (fried pork) with her husband; she’s been in this business for 10 years but used to sell herbal teas before this. Thanks to the loans she has gotten she’s been able to buy her house. Her husband, who is a public transportation provider, helps her out. Dina has been collaborating with FINCA for about 12 years and the loans have made it possible for her to make improvements to her business because she’s been able to invest in it and thanks to the training sessions she has learned how better to treat her customers. Dina is asking for a 400 sol loan to buy 20 cases of beverages. Her dream is to successfully raise her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 cases of beverages.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 49 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho para sobresalir, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fortunato de 65 años y sus 4 menores hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los cultivos de Olga, es uno de los mejores cuidados de su poblado, la producción de plátano y café son de muy buena calidad, ya que ella ha procurado aplicar abono a sus chacras. En el mercado de Pichanaki, que es donde vende sus productos, los clientes solicitan mucho su cosecha, motivo por el cual siempre obtiene un buen precio por ellos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la época de recolección, ya que siente que los meses de arduo trabajo, son recompensados, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y parte de su trabaja es cuidar sus plantas de las plagas. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar su producción, para así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que siente que tiene un compromiso con la institución. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus chacras, ya que desea que estén bien fertilizadas.
texts.en:
Olga, 49, is a woman who has worked hard during her lifetime to get ahead. She lives in her own house together with her husband, Fortunato, 65, and their 4 children. The children are the main reason for her efforts. Olga's crops are one of the best cared for in her village. The production of bananas and coffee is of very good quality, since now she has been able to put down fertilizer in her fields. In the Pichanaki market where she sells, the customers look for her products and thus she always gets good prices for them. What she most likes about her work is harvest time, since she feels that the months of tough work have been paid back. She has been farming for 30 year and part of her work is to keep her plants free of disease. With time she wants to improve her production so that she can increase her earnings. This is the fourth loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with her payments since she now feels committed to the institution. In her communal group she is a member who is committed to the development of the group. With the one thousand five hundred new sols that she is requesting, she will buy fertilizer for her fields since she wants to keep them well fertilized.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz María es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, es separada y tiene 4 hijos, el mayor estudia en Lima la carrera de derecho. Luz Maria con el apoyo de sus otros 3 hijos trabaja en su tienda de abarrotes que tiene en su casa, ella saca a delante a sus hijos, pues también se apoya económicamente alquilando habitaciones a estudiantes en su casa.
Desde que empezó con FINCA Peru ha aprendido a manejar su dinero e invertir, ha superado la separación con su esposo, y las capacitaciones le han ayudado a madurar, resalta mucho la capacitación que ha recibido sobre autoestima.
Con el préstamo que ha solicitado Luz Maria va a comprar abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite al por mayor.
Su sueño es ver su casa construida, pues aun le faltan los acabados.
texts.en:
Luz María is a member of the Paloma communal bank. She is separated and has 4 children. The oldest studies law in Lima. With the help of her other 3 children Luz María works in the grocery shop she has in her house. She supports her children with the store and also by renting rooms in her house to students.

Since she began with FINCA Peru, she has learned how to manage and invest her money. She has gotten over the separation from her husband, and the training she has received has helped her develop and enhanced her self-esteem.

With the loan she has applied for Luz María is going to purchase inventory such as rice, noodles, milk, and cooking oil at wholesale. Her dream is to see her house completed, for it lacks some finishing touches.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, es viuda tiene 3 hijos de 15, 19 y 25 años, el mayor está estudiando Contabilidad. 
Dina tiene una tienda que ha abierto en su casa hace 2 meses, antes vendía comida en el terminal. Dina aun está superando el fallecimiento de su esposo hace 9 meses, él le apoyaba como chofer haciendo colectivo en un carrito que tienen ambos, ahora ella tiene que contratar un chofer para que haga la ruta que hacían su esposo entre Cangallo y Huancapu ciudades de Ayacucho.
A Dina le gusta participar de su Bancomunal en FINCA Perú desde hace tres años, en ciclos anteriores ha formado parte de la Junta Directiva como Tesorera. 
Con el préstamo que está solicitando, Dina comprará llantas para su auto y aprovechara en implementar con más cosas su tiendita que recién está empezando, su hija de 15 años le apoya los fines de semana. El sueño de dina es tener una casa propia, para ello está ahorrando , pronto podrá comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the communal bank Paloma. She is a widow and has 3 children, aged 15, 19 and 25 years. The latter is studying accounting. Two months ago, Dina opened a shop at her house. Before, she used to sell food at the terminal. Dina is still overcoming her husband’s death 9 months ago. He used to support her driving a car they jointly owned. Her husband used to cover the route between Cangallo and Huancapu (cities in Ayacucho), but now Dina has to hire a driver. Dina likes to participate in her communal bank. She has been doing this for three years, and in previous cycles, she has been the treasurer of the board of directors. With this loan, Dina will buy tires for her car. She will also seize the opportunity to incorporate a few things to the small shop she just opened, and that her daughter helps her run during the weekends. Dina’s dream is to own a house. She is saving, and soon will be able to buy a piece of land for it.

Translated from Spanish by Liliana Matos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires for her car

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es: Rosa Virginia tiene 30 años su actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada. Ella dio inicio hace más de 3 años por lo que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida que ofrecía en su vivienda pues tenía demasiados problemas de salud y se cansaba, pero siempre le ha gustado diversificar en actividades pues tenía que mantener a sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo pero no le perjudico para buscar otro negocio así poco a poco es que ha ido creciendo con su nuevo negocio como la venta de ropa usada. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima. Sueña con tener un lugar estable para vender.
texts.en:
Rosa Virginia is 30 years old. She sells used clothing. She started off a few years ago by selling food from her home, but she had a number of health problems, and always felt tired. She doesn’t mind branching out into different kinds of business because she has two children to support. Her used clothing business has been growing little by little, day by day. Rosa will use her loan to buy some basic merchandise. She dreams of being able to do business at a regular location.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, tiene 4 hijos, dos de los cuales ya son independientes y no viven con ella, tiene 4 nietos. 
El negocio de Felicitas es la venta de aserrín, es la única distribuidora de este producto en Huamanga, Felicita trae en triciclo los sacos de aserrín a su negocio y de ahí los distribuye a sus clientes, reparte un aproximado de 700 a 800 sacos, el aserrín es utilizado para la fabricación de ladrillos, transportar ganado, pescado congelado, sus ventas los realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1100 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de aserrín de diversos tipos, por sacos y al por mayor. 
El sueño de Felicitas es tener un carro para transportar sus productos a otros lugares, incrementar su negocio y salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Paloma communal bank. She has 4 children, two of whom are independent and do not live with her. She has 4 grand-children. Her business is the sale of sawdust. It is the only distributor of this product in Huamanga. Felicia brings bags of sawdust to her business by tricycle and form there distributes them to her customers. She distributes approximately 700 to 800 bags. The sawdust is used for brick-making, livestock transportation and seafood freezing. She sells with the help of her children. Felicitas needs a loan of 1100 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of sawdust of various types, in bags and wholesale. Her dream is to have a car to transport her products to other areas; to expand her business and get ahead with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of various kinds of sawdust

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad, de 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en casa de su hermana junto a sus 3 queridos hijos. Lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Sus días de trabajo es cocinar deliciosos platos para sus vecinos, su negocio es la venta de comida, la cual vende en un pequeño restaurante que ha puesto en su poblado. Debido a la gran sazón que posee su restaurante es muy concurrido y sus comensales siempre salen con la barriga llena y el corazón contento. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, ya que es muy buena haciéndolo, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender sola a todos sus clientes. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar las instalaciones de su restaurante, para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus anteriores créditos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades. En su grupo comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más cubiertos y platos, también invertirá en mesas nuevas.
texts.en:
Trinidad, 39, is a very hard-working and happy woman. She lives in her sister's home with her three beloved children. She most desires to improve their quality of life. She cooks delicious food for her neighbours; her business is food sales, and she sells in a small restaurant that she has opened in her village. Thanks to the rich food, her restaurant is very popular and her patrons always leave with full stomachs and happy hearts. What she most likes about her job is the cooking, since she is very good at it. She has been doing this for three years, and finds that the most difficult part is tending to her customers alone. With time, she wants to improve the facilities of her restaurant, in order to offer her customers better convenience. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and as she has with all her previous loans, she wants to repay it on time and without difficulty. In her community group she is very respected, since she is the most active and engaged member. With the 2000 soles she is requesting, she will buy more cutlery and plates, and she will also invest in new tables.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of tables, cutlery and plates

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is a maintenance worker, but part-time he sells discounted brand-name items. His inventories include perfume, clothing, and watches. He has always liked sales and wants to earn extra income. For three years, Ramon has been selling these brand-name items to family, friends, and his growing clientele. He buys his inventory in bulk so that he can resell them at discounted prices. 

With this loan, Ramon will be able to buy more inventories. He will be able to reach out to more customers and further expand his business. He supports himself, his wife, and their two children.

Ramon has had two previous loans from ACCION USA, which helped him get his business started. With his third loan, he plans to add to his inventory and increase sales. In the future, he hopes to open a storefront and maintain a stable business.


About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA:
Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and a laptop

loans.name: Albino

texts.es: Albino, de 47 años, es un padre muy responsable y amoroso, viudo y desde entonces comparte su vida en compañía de sus 2 queridos hijos en su casa propia. La actividad a la que se dedica Albino, es el cultivo de plátano y café. Las extensas tierras que posee, lo han convertido en uno de los principales productores de la zona. Sus productos los lleva a vender a la ciudad de “La Merced”, donde ya tiene compradores esperándolo, puesto que siempre ofrece cultivos de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar el café y lo hace con mucho empeño, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. En el futuro, desea comprar un carro, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre esta muy al tanto de los acuerdos que tiene con sus compañeros. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus tierras, también invertirá en fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Albino, 47, is a very responsible and loving father. He is a widower, and since then has shared his life with his 2 beloved children in their own home. He cultivates bananas and coffee. With his vast lands he has become one of the main producers in the area. He brings his produce to the city of La Merced, where he already has customers waiting for him, since he always offers produce of very high quality. What he most likes about his job is harvesting the coffee, which he does with much effort. He has been doing this for 30 years and considers the most difficult part to be keeping his crops safe from the pests that can affect them. In the future, he wants to buy a car, with which he will be able to transport his products. This is his second loan with MFP, and he is prepared to pay his quotas punctually and he has already started to save up. In his community group he is a very happy member and is always very aware of the agreements he has with his peers. With the 1000 soles he is requesting, he will purchase more manure for his land, and also invest in fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of manure for the care of his farm

loans.name: Narcisa Aracely

texts.es:
Narcisa de 54 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (este lugar su originalidad fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil, ella tiene un puesto de venta de bebidas (colas, jugos, energizantes). 

Ella trabaja vendiendo bebidas al por menor y mayor, trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00am hasta las 15h00pm. No ha tenido oportunidad de arreglar su casa pero ahora con los ingresos que tiene de la venta de bebidas quiere mejorar su casa. Por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento arena y hierro. 

(En la foto aparece con una pared que esta construyendo), su meta es terminar de construir su casa y seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Narcisa is 54 years old. She lives in Las Orquídeas, an urban zone (it got its name because the countryside had lots of orchids) in Guayaquil. She has a stand where she sells drinks (colas, juices, and energy drinks). She works selling drinks for retail and wholesale. She works everyday from 8:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. She has not had the chance to fix up her house. But, now she wants to improve her house with the income she has from selling drinks. She wants to use the loan to buy cement, sand, and iron. (A wall that she is building appears in the photo.) Her goal is to finish building her house and to continue helping her family economically.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, sand, and iron

loans.name: Diego Ramon

texts.es:
El sr.  Diego Ramon I. C. tiene 33 años y esta casado con la señora Roberta Benitez Cáceres de  29 años, tienen 4 hijos , 3 varones de 10 , 9 , y 8 años respectivamente y una nena de 7 años que están cursando sus estudios primarios.
El señor Diego se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y repuestos para motocicleta desde hace 10 años. 
 El negocio funciona en su domicilio que se encuentra en una zona estratégica en la ciuda. 
El mismo desea invertir en la compra lubricantes y repuestos para motos  en forma mayorista, de esa manera obtendría un menor precio de costo sobre los mismos  por lo que tendría mayor ganancia por la venta de sus mercaderias cantidad.
texts.en:
Diego Ramon I. C. is 33 years old and is married to Señora Roberta Benitez Cáceres, who is 29. They have 4 children: 3 sons who are 10, 9, and 8, respectively, and one daughter who is 7 years old. Their children are studying in primary school. Diego has sold lubricants and spare parts for motorcycles for 10 years. He operates his business from his home, which is located in a busy area of the city. He wants to invest in the purchase of lubricants and motorcycle spare parts at wholesale. This way, he would be able to get a better price for these items and can have better profits on the sale of his merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spart parts for motorcycles, as well as engine oil and lubricants in bulk

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es: Aldo, de 25 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Elsa de 22 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Los campos de cultivo, han sido en la vida de Aldo, una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron que trabajando en la chacra nada le faltaría, es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, donde siembra plátano y café. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende la tranquilidad económica de su familia. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima. Con el tiempo espera seguir trabajando duro y mejorando sus cultivos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Aldo, 25, is a cheerful and hardworking man. He lives in his own home with his wife Elsa, 22, and their 3 beloved children, to whom they wish to provide a better future. The fields that he cultivates have been, in the life of Aldo, an activity that has been necessary for survival; from the time that he was very small his parents always taught him that by working in the fields he would never lack for anything. For this reason, he decided to continue in his family's line of work, and now he has his own cultivations where he plants bananas and coffee. What he likes most about his work is to plant, because he knows that the economic tranquility of his family depends on this activity. He has been doing this work for 8 years, and what he considers most difficult is to care for his crops when there are abrupt changes in the weather. Over time he hopes to continue working hard and improving his crops. This is his 6th loan with MFP, and he knows that this support will be very beneficial to him in developing his business. In his communal bank, he is a very responsible member, which is the reason that he is well respected. With the 800 Peruvian soles that he requests, he will buy more organic and chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to care for his crops

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es: El señor Héctor Antonio tiene un negocio de soldadura de manera  ambulante en pues el servicio que ofrece es de muy buena calidad. Por lo que siempre ha sido un joven muy trabajador y que siempre está proporcionando a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad la cual asiste al colegio, su esposa trabaja por su cuenta de manera ambulante,  tiene más de 3 años  cuando inicio a laborar pues fue a temprana edad para salir adelante ya que no contó con el apoyo de sus padres por ser de escasos recursos. Es por ello que Héctor busco esta alternativa para subsistir él y su familia. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Héctor Antonio has a business as a traveling welder. The service he offers is of a very high quality, as he has always been a very hard-working young man. He always provides his family with the income they need. He has a ten year-old son who is attending secondary school, and his wife works for herself as a street vendor. He started to work more than three years ago. It was an early age to get ahead, but he could not count on the support of his parents because they had little resources themselves. This is why Héctor looked for another way to sustain himself and his family. Now, he is requesting this loan in order to purchase raw materials for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his welding business

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María Santos tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, un distrito de territorio bastante accidentado debido a su cercanía con la sierra, su actividad principal es la agricultura, la zona se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, ella tiene una clientela fija que siempre acude a su establecimiento ya que el tiempo que lleva en el negocio, la calidad de los productos que ofrece y el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes le han hecho conocida en el rubro. Las ganancias que percibe de esta actividad las utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias, para lograr su objetivo de ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer alegre y dinámica, en la zona donde vive es bastante conocida por sus vecinos que la consideran una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es crecer como empresaria para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Santos is 35 years old, single, and lives with her family in the district of Oyotún. This district is situated in rocky territory since it is located near the mountains. Agriculture is the main industry in the area, which is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 10 years, María has been selling basic necessities and groceries from a store she operates from her home. She has an established customer base that has always supported her the entire time she has been in business. The quality of the products she offers and the good service she provides to her customers have allowed her to become recognized in the area. With the revenue that her business generates, María has been able to cover her personal expenses and support her family.

María wants to expand her business by acquiring more products to satisfy the demand of her customers, increase her sales, and earn more income. To accomplish this goal, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

María is a cheerful and dynamic woman. In the area where she lives, she is well-known among her neighbors who consider her to be a hardworking and enterprising woman. Her greatest wish is to grow as a businesswoman so that she can provide her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries & basic necessities for her store

loans.name: Las Amigas De Tlane (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama (LAS AMIGAS DE TLANE) se pusieron este nombre por que todas sin excepción alguna se llevan muy bien, y se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo. Son 6  integrantes que conforman el grupo: Elena Espíndola, Felipe C., Felipe F., Anabel C., Maria concepción, Alberta Aragón  todas ellas son residentes de la localidad Tlanepantla,
Elena cuenta con 35 años de edad, es casada con el Sr. Jesús arias espino de 28 años de edad el es taxista, tienen a su hijo de 1 año y medio, ella  tiene otros 2 hijas del primer matrimonio, ellas se llaman:, Ana laura Rodríguez Espíndola (17 años, casada), Sindy Rosario Rodríguez (11 años, vive con abuelos paternos), me comenta que hace 3 años ya no se dedican a la agricultura (nopal), por que no contaban con el capital para poder sembrar, pero ahora que ya cuentan con este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pencas de nopal y abono para empezar a producir, también desea adaptar a fuera de su casa un negocio de venta de taquitos esto seria por la noche. Para que pudieran tener un extra en sus ganancias.
La mayoría de las integrantes del grupo se dedican a la agricultura (nopal), el crédito lo van a utilizar para compra de abono orgánico y químico que ahí en su localidad lo venden muy caro, pero que es necesario para su producción, ellas están  contentas por que  Fundacion Realidad y Kiva las han apoyado mucho y están agradecidas por ello,  ahora que  conocen cual es la finalidad de hacerse conocer por esta vía es para que se mejoren económicamente. Dan muchas gracias por la oportunidad que les dan y les piden que no las dejen de apoyar.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Amigas de Tlane” (The Friends of Tlane) because everyone gets along well and has known each other for a long time. There are six members of the group: Elena Espíndola, Felipa C., Felipa F., Anabel C., Maria Concepción, and Alberta Aragón. All of them are residents of the town of Tlanepantla.

Elena is 35 years old and married to Sr. Jesús Arias Espino, who is 28 years old and works as a taxi driver. They have a 1½ year old son. She also has two other daughters from her first marriage: Ana Laura Rodríguez Espíndola (age 17 and married) and Sindy Rosario Rodríguez (age 11 and lives with her paternal grandparents). For the past three years, Elena has been growing “nopales”, which are the edible leaves of the prickly pear cactus. She does not have the capital to continue farming, so she is requesting a new loan to buy cactus pads and fertilizers so that she can been producing them again. Elena also wants to set up a space outside of her house where she can sell taquitos at night so that she can earn extra income.

Most of the members are engaged in growing nopales. The loan will be used to buy organic and chemical fertilizers since they are very expensive where they live, but are essential to their production. They are satisfied with the support provided by Fundación Realidad and Kiva and express their appreciation. The members now know the action they need to take to improve their financial situation. They are thankful for the opportunity given to them and hope that the support will not end.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cactus pads & fertilizers

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee es conviviente y tiene 25 años, Renee viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza 2 veces por semana, y de las ferias compra quesos, leche que vende en su barrio. Además Renee vende golosinas en el cerro acuchimay en donde tiene un puesto.
Renee es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer y solicita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropas interiores, chompas, productos que comprara en la ciudad de Lima.
Los sueños de Renee son tener un puesto estable de ropa, tener una casa propia porque hasta ahora vive en la casa de su mama.
texts.en:
Renee is 25 years old and in a common law marriage. She travels to the different fairs in the region to sell a variety of clothing. Renee engages in this business twice a week. While at the fairs, she buys cheeses and milk and sells them in her neighborhood. Renee also sells candy at Acuchimay Hill where she has a vending stand.

Renee is a member of the Communal Bank “Florecer” (To Blossom). She is requesting a loan of 1200 PEN to buy undergarments, sweaters, and other products that she acquires in the city of Lima. Renee dreams of having a stable vending post where she can sell clothing and having her own home because she currently lives at her mother’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase undergarments, sweaters, and other types of clothing

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
Lisbeth pertenece al Banco Comunal Florecer, Lisbeth es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos que están estudiando.
Lisbeth inicio su negocio hace algunos años, tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado que cambio hace 6 meses, sus ventas han mejorado por la ubicación de su negocio, actividad que realiza todo el día, por las noches vende caldos hasta las 10 de la noche.
Lisbeth necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles dinero que será invertido para la mejora la presentación de su cocina, cambio de mayólicas.
Lisbeth sueña con implementar una polleria grande.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Florecer” (To Blossom). She is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children who are in school.

Lisbeth started her business a few years ago. She has a restaurant that changed six months ago to a rented location. Her sales have increased since moving to this location. She works all day and sells soups at night until 10pm.

Lisbeth needs a loan of 2200 PEN to replace her ceramic dinnerware in order to improve the presentation of her dishes. She dreams of opening a large chicken shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ceramic dinnerware

loans.name: Ker

texts.es: Ker tiene 66 años de edad, se le considera un hombre muy carismático, vive con su hijo en su casa propia. Siendo natural de la selva peruana, Ker aprendió desde muy pequeño los secretos culinarios de la selva, gracias a su madre, quien le enseño con mucha paciencia como se debían preparar, logró instalar un restaurante en su ciudad natal. Sin embargo tuvo graves inconvenientes con los ladrones por lo que cerrar su negocio. Es así que decidió darse otra oportunidad pero en otra ciudad, lugar donde ahora tiene su casa, acondicionando un pequeño restaurante, que con ayuda de su hijo ofrecen actualmente los mejores platillos de la selva, siendo muy conocido por los lugareños de su barrio. Además el esfuerzo y empeño que pone a su trabajo ha hacho que gane clientes, quienes están muy contentos de ir a su restaurante, ya que además de comer muy rico también pasan un buen momento. Se le considera un cliente muy antiguo en MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con el pago de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Ker is 66 years old and considered to be a very charismatic man. He lives in his own home with his son. Being a native of the Peruvian jungle, Ker learned at a young age the secrets of jungle cuisine from his mother, who taught him with great patience how to prepare these dishes. Ker managed to open a restaurant in his hometown, but he faced serious problems caused by thieves which forced him to close his business. However, he decided to give the restaurant business another opportunity, but this time in another city where he now makes his home. After equipping his small restaurant, Ker now has the help of his son in offering the best jungle dishes that are well-known among the neighborhood locals. As a result of the effort and commitment to his work, he has been able to attract customers who are happy to come to his restaurant so that they can enjoy the rich food and have a good time.

Ker is a long-time client of MFP and has been very prompt with his payments. The loan he requested will be used to buy ingredients for preparing his dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients used in preparing his dishes

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza pertenece al Banco Florecer, tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Lorenza vende golosinas, frutas de manera ambulatoria en la avenida mas transitada de su barrio, para lo cual cuenta con una carreta, en algunas oportunidades vende en la puerta del colegio, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Lorenza solicito un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos y frutas.
Los sueños de Lorenza son construir su kiosco para tener un lugar seguro y pueda vender mas productos.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of Florecer (“Blossom”) Bank. She is 55 years old, married, and has three children. Lorenza takes a cart around the busiest street in her neighbourhood, where she peddles candy and fruit. She sets up near the entrance to the school almost every day. Lorenza has asked for a loan of 1000 soles, which she’ll use to buy more cookies, candies and fruit. She dreams of one day building a kiosk, so that she’ll have a stable, steady place to do business from.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cookies, candy and fruit.

loans.name: Domingo Asilo

texts.es:
El señor Domingo Asilo A. B., tiene la edad de 42 años es casado y con su familia radican en el Barrio San Ignacio, tienen 3 hijos adolecentes que actualmente estudiantes de secundaria, la señora labora como comerciante apoyando a la cabeza del hogar en los gastos de su casa.

El señor se dedica  a la agricultura de la piña,  y tiene más de  21 años de experiencia en esta actividad, uno de los principales problemas que afectan a su producción son los gases de volcán, que se encuentran en las cercanías de sus terrenos, dentro de los planes a futuro está la diversificación de los cultivos en otros que así como la piña se consuman en masa, él solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas que aporten un mejor mantenimiento a los terrenos y una mejor cosecha para este año, que le permita el capital necesario para la incursión de fuentes de ingreso para el bienestar de todos los miembros de la familia. Sobre todo que son adolecentes que por su edad le demanda mejores condiciones y independencia y privacidad de espacio, esta inversión les permitirá mejorar sus recursos económicos para el mayor bienestar socio económicos de ellos.
texts.en:
Domingo Asilo A. B., 42, is married and has three, teen-aged children who are in secondary school; they live in the San Ignacio neighborhood. His wife is a merchant and helps her husband meet household expenses. He is a pineapple farmer; he has over 21 years experience in this line of work. One of the main problems that affect his crops is gas from the volcano that is near his fields. His future plans include diversifying his crops with other products, like pineapple, that are of mass consumption. He is asking for funds to buy fertilizers and pesticides that will help him better maintain his fields so that this year’s harvest will be better thus producing higher income that will benefit the entire family, especially the teen-agers who need better living conditions, independence and private space. This investment will provide better socio-economic conditions for them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for field maintenance.

loans.name: Musuq Inti Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Musuq Inti que significa Nuevo Sol en quechua, inicia su quinto ciclo con 17 socias.
Julia es fiscal del Banco Comunal, es socia hace 2 ciclos y lo quemas le gusta es que le enseñaron a ser responsable y no ser pesimista, Julia es casada, tiene 4 hijos, una D. ellas ya termino la universidad y trabaja, 3 D. ellos están estudiando en la universidad, Julia tiene una panadería en su casa, tiene un horno D. leña, elabora panes típicos como biscochos, chapla, productos que reparte a las tiendas, para lo cual cuenta con un carro.
Además tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa que atienD. con la ayuda D. sus hijas en sus tiempos libres. También Julia siembra papa y quinua, que luego venD. en los mercados, negocio que piensa dejar D. realizar porque ya no es rentable.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina y manteca. 
Julia sueña con comprar un carro para realizar transporte urbano en la ciudad D. Ayacucho y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Julia desearía mas joven para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
“Musuq Inti” means “New Soles” (Peruvian currency) in the Quechua language. The Musuq Inti Community Bank is starting its fifth cycle, with 17 members. Julia has been a bank member for two cycles. She has always been taught to be responsible and positive. She’s married with four children—one has already finished university and entered the work force. The other three are still studying. Julia runs a bakery out of her home. She prepares traditional biscuits and chapla. She uses her car to distribute these products to stores. She also has a grocery store in her home. Her daughters help her run it in their spare time. Julia grows potatoes and quinoa, too, and sells it in markets. She may soon give up growing produce, though; it’s not profitable. Julia needs a loan of 600 soles for flour and butter. She hopes to one day buy a new car so that she can easily travel around Ayachuco. She wants to see her children become professionals, and she hopes to stay young so that she’ll be able to work for years to come.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour and butter.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jhonatan es un joven emprendedor de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja y su bebe de 3 añitos llamada Fiorela, quien es su gran motivo para salir adelante. Todos ellos viven en una casa  que le cedieron sus padres. El trabajo al que se dedica, es el trasporte público, es así que gracias a su gran esfuerzo adquirió una moto en el cual brinda este servicio desde hace 3 años, generándole los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Pero su trabajo no es tan fácil como parece pues requiere de gran esfuerzo físico para poder movilizar su vehículo por las calles de su zona que en su mayoría son muy arenosas, habiéndose quedado estancado varias veces en la arena. En un futuro él tiene pensado con un socio poner un local de reparación de motos pues ha ganado gran experiencia en este rubro, él espera poder concretar sus metas pues quiere darle a su hija una buena calidad de vida. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará algunas herramientas y demás cosas que le son necesarias para comenzar con su sueño de poner un taller.
texts.en:
28-year old Jhonatan is an enterprising young man who lives with his wife and little daughter, 3-year old Fiorela. She is the big reason why he wants to get on in life. They all live in a house which was given to him by his parents. Jhonatan works in transportation. Through hard work he managed to acquire a motorbike which he has used to transport the public for three years and thus earn money to support his family. However, his work isn’t as easy as it seems. It requires a lot of physical effort to be able to drive the bike through the streets of his neighbourhood, many of which are made of sand. He has got stuck many times. As for the future, Jhonatan is thinking of opening a motorbike repair workshop with a partner as he has gained a lot of experience in this line of work. He hopes to fulfill this goal as he wants to provide his daughter with a good standard of living. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP and he expects to pay back the loan on time. With the money he will buy some tools and other necessary items so he can get started on his dream of opening a repair shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tools for his new motorbike repair shop

loans.name: Aner Eliu

texts.es:
La señora Aner Eliu S. S., tiene 25 años de edad vive en Veracruz, Ticuantepe, en la capital de Managua, es soltero y tiene su moto taxi que realiza servicios de transporte en la zona, vive con su padres y espera tener los recursos para mejorar las condiciones de habitad de ellos.

Dentro de otros de sus planes principales esta la siembra de media manzana de tomate de unos terrenos que heredo, este joven solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan la continuación de las remodelaciones del hogar de sus padres, ahora solicita para la edificación de unos cuartos con la intención de poder ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones que permitan un óptimo esparcimiento. Ha sido ocn la ayuda de Afodenic con los Fondos Kiva, que le han permitido estas comodidades.
texts.en:
25-year old Aner Eliu S. S. lives in Veracruz, Tichantepe, in the capital city Managua. He is unmarried. He earns his living by transporting people around on his motobike taxi. He lives with his parents and hopes to have enough money to improve the house where they live. One of his main plans is to plant tomatoes on one of the 1/2 manzana (about 0.8 acre) lots which he has inherited. Aner is asking for a loan to buy construction material to continue the renovation of his parents’ house. He wishes to build some more rooms so that his family can have better living conditions and more space to spread out. He has been helped by Afodenic and Kiva before, and this assistance has been very useful to him.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build more rooms

loans.name: Kutimuy Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa Regresa en quechua, inicia su ciclo 42 con 13 socias.
Zoila es socia D. muchos años, inicio con un ahorro D. 1 dólar en otro banco comunal, ahora integra el Banco Comunal Kutimuy y tiene nuevas amigas, durante este tiempo aprendió a ser puntual, responsable, y sobre todo a ahorrar con su dinero pudo terminar D. construir su casa.
Zoila tiene 60 años y vive con sus nietas que están a su responsabilidad, tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su nieta. Además Zoila viaja a las ferias en donD. venD. verduras, panes y D. allá compra cereales, carne que venD. en su tienda.
Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar.
Zoila sueña con tener mas ahorros para su vejez y superarse mas.
texts.en:
The Kutimuy Communal Bank (Kutimuy means “to return” in quechua) begins its 42nd cycle with 13 members. Zoila is a long-time member: she started with another communal bank, saving 1 dollar, and now she is part of the Kutimuy Communal Bank and has maD. new friends. During this time she has learned to be punctual, responsible and, most of all, to save her money, and this way she could finish building her house. Zoila is 60 years old and she lives with her nieces, who are under her responsibility. She has set up a shop in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables and meat, and her niece helps her in this business. Moreover, Zoila travels to various fairs, where she sells vegetables, bread and buys cereals and meat she then resells in her shop. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice and sugar. Zoila dreams of increasing her savings for her old age and of excelling in her job even more.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y vive en una casa que le cedieron sus padres. El tiene una carrera técnica en el rubro salud, en el cual trabaja durante las mañanas, pero durante la tarde, para generarse más ingresos se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su motocarro. Su mayor anhelo es poner un taller de venta de repuestos de moto, con un amigo en sociedad, por ello esta trabajando muy duro para concretarlo. Sus jornadas diarias son provechosas puesto que es muy diestro en el manejo de su vehículo por las calles arenosas de la zona en al que vive. Walter espera seguir poniéndole empeño a su labor y así convertirse próximamente en un prospero empresario. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, refaccionará su moto para dejarla óptima, además quiere comprar algunas cosas para hacer realidad su sueño de tener su taller propio.
texts.en:
Walter, 31, is single and lives in his own house that his parent’s gave him. He has a technical career in the health sector that he works at during the week. However, in order to earn additional income, he works evenings providing public transportation services in his vehicle. His greatest wish is to be able to open a vehicle replacement parts store in partnership with a friend; he is working very hard to reach this goal. His daily shifts are quite profitable because he is very skilled in driving his vehicle in the sandy streets of his neighborhood. Walter expects to continue to work very hard in order to become a prosperous businessman. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to be very punctual with all his repayments. He will use the requested funds to service his vehicle in order to have it in optimal working conditions. He also wants to buy a few things he needs to make his wish to have his own workshop come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Granada (Flat) Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo llamado Granada (Flat), porque donde ellas se ubican las calles tienen nombres de fruta y una de ellas es este. El grupo lo conforman cinco mujeres que son amas de casa y que además entre ellas existe una buena relación de amistad y siempre que alguna esta en problemas las demás acuden para ayudar. Las integrantes son; Ana Lucia Texiz Fernández (Gimnasio), Mónica O. A. (venta de colchas por catalogo), Ivonne V. Rodríguez (venta de pozole), Carmen R.
texts.en: Introducing the Granada (Pomegranate) group, whose name is inspired from the fact that where its members live streets are named after fruit. The group is composed of 5 women, all housewives, and who are also bound by a good friendship: when one of them has problems the others are always there to help out. The members are: Ana Lucia Texiz Fernández (gym), Mónica O. A. (sale of bedspreads from a catalogue line), Ivonne V. Rodríguez (sale of maize stew), Carmen R.

loans.use: To buy biodegradable plastic bags (garbage and kilo bags for individual products)

loans.name: Mollecito De Covadonga Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mollecito D. Covadonga, inicia su cuarto ciclo con 19 socias.
Las socias realizan diversos negocios como L. venta D. verduras, leña, abarrotes en general, animales menores, cereales, entre otros.
Rufina es L. presidenta del Banco Comunal, ingreso por invitación D. su hermana y lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones y el incentivo al ahorro.
Rufina es casada y estudio algunos años D. L. primaria, Rufina viaja a las ferias en donD. compra animales y luego se dedica al engorD. D. animales, los que después comercializa en los mercados y restaurantes.
Rufina es muy entusiasta y ya tiene muchas amigas en el Banco Comunal, Rufina ahorra todas las semanas y es muy puntual.
Rufina necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que  invertirá en L. compra D. alimentos para animales.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Mollecito D. Covadonga Communal Bank begins its 4th cycle with 19 members. The members dedicated themselves to the selling of different products, such as vegetables, wood, groceries, small animals, cereals and so on. Rufina is the president of the Communal Bank: she became a member through her sister and what she likes more about her Communal Banks are the trainings and the incentive to saving. Rufina is married and she attended a few years of primary school. Rufina travels to fairs where she buys animals, then she fattens them and she finally sells them in the markets and to restaurants. Rufina is very zealous and she has many friend in the Communal Bank. Rufina saves some money every week and is very punctual. Rufina needs a loan of 600 PEN, money she will use to buy animal food. Her goal is to improve her business and for it to keep on growing.

Translated from Spanish by EmanueL. VilL., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animal food.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las tareas agrícolas, en la actualidad trabaja junto a su esposo en el junto cultivando papa de diversas variedades, habas, oca y cebada, en sus propios terrenos. Asimismo cría cerdos, ovejas y vacas, y al cabo de dos meses son comercializados en la feria  ganadera de su localidad. De la misma forma, la cosecha que obtiene es llevada al mercado para su venta, obteniendo buenas ganancias. En adelante desea tener mas animales para aumentar su ganado y ampliar su siembra. Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP,  es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras de este aporte que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para mejorar sus cultivos, así como cerdos y ovejas para aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene en su establo.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 28, lives with her husband and two children in her own home. She has been tied to farming all her life. Currently, she and her husband work farming various varieties of potato, broad beans, oca (a tuber) and barley on their own lands. She also raises pigs, sheep and cows which are sold in her area’s livestock fairs. Her farm crops are also taken to the market for sale, generating good profits. In the future, she’d like to have more animals to increase her cattle herds and she’d like to increase her plantings. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she’s very responsible with her payments; she is grateful to all the people who will contribute to this loan that will be very useful for the success of her business. She will use the requested funds to buy sacks of manure to improve her crops as well as to buy pigs and sheep to increase the number of animals in her stable.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and sheep as well as sacks of manure for her crops.

loans.name: Grano De Oro Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Cascada, se reúne cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal  Grano de Oro, éste será su primer préstamo con la familia de Pro Mujer. Su presidenta es Angela C. de 32 años, casada y madre de cuatro niños.
Angela se dedica a cofeccionar prendas de vestir hace dos años, tiene un pequeño taller en su mismo domicilio, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, villa Mercedes.
Necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima y seguir operando en su negocio. Sus demás compañeras también cuentan con negocios propios de comercio, servicio y producción. Todas necesitan el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Asociación Comunal Grano de Oro (Golden Bean Communal Association) meets in one of Pro Mujer Cascada’s community centers. This will be the Association’s first loan with the Pro Mujer family. Its president is Angela C., age 32, married and the mother of four children.

For two years, Angela has been engaged in making clothing. She has a small workshop in her home, located in the Villa Mercedes section of the city of El Alto.

She needs the loan for the purchase of raw materials and to continue operating her business. The rest of her colleagues have their own sales, service and production businesses. They all need the loan in order to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 32 años de experiencia en la ganadería y en la agricultura, junto con su esposo sacaron adelante a su hijo que ahora en mayores de edad. Ahora sigue dedicándose a estas tareas  para apoyar al menor que aún está estudiando. Es así que siembra papa, maíz, trigo y habas, adicionado a esto cría animales vacuno, ovino y aves, intensificándose más en está última actividad, principalmente pollos que tiene. De esta tiene muchas posibilidades de salir, y más ahora que su esposo es su principal ayuda, por ello desea dedicarse a esta labor hasta donde tenga fuerzas. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos y sabe que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra, así como quiere comprar cuyes reproductores de raza para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Segundina, 59, lives with her husband and two children in her own home. She has 32 years experience in farming and cattle-raising. She and her husband raised their son who is now an adult. She continues to dedicate herself to these tasks in order to support her youngest child who is still in school. She farms potato, corn, wheat and broad beans. In addition, she raises cattle, sheep and barnyard fowl, especially chickens. All these activities provide her with several avenues to succeed especially now that her husband is her main help; she hopes to be able to dedicate herself to these activities as long as she has the strength to do so. This is her 6th loan with MFP. She is very responsible with her payments and knows that this loan will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy sacks of manure for her next crop as well as to buy breeding, pedigree guinea-pigs to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy breeding guinea-pigs and sacks of manure.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.en:
María Teresa G. T., a 23-year-old pepper producer and mother of three, lives in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles de San Carlos, located in Northern Costa Rica. María is a dedicated mother and producer. She plans to focus her efforts on the planting and harvest of Tabasco peppers. María works in cooperation with her family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land they work is their own. María´s husband works at a local orange-producing factory as a harvesting laborer in order to supplement the family income. The money he earns helps pay bills for electricity and to buy food. The rural zone where María and her family live is one of the few places in Costa Rica without running water. The family must pump water from a nearby well as needed. María is working hard towards the sustenance of her family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from her land and labor.
 
Although this is an individual loan, the community in which María and her family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Coquital community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of tabasco peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of seedlings and necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All laborial and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by María with the help of her family members in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles, located in the Northern Region of Costa Rica. María will need roughly one year before her peppers will reach maturity and be ready for harvest.
 
Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or, PROPICA is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Coquital, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

In general, the work day is divided into mornings and afternoons. In the morning, the domestic tasks are carried out such as cooking, cleaning and caring for younger siblings. Afternoons are generally dedicated to harvest and planting, working the land as needed. 

The main factor that has stood in the way of increasing her production levels has been the Costa Rican government and various other institutions. Formal banks, lending agencies and government bodies have failed to recognize the producers of the Coquital region as legitimate producers, worthy of financial and governmental support and services. 

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to María, her family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital, and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, María wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. She wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in her neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and nutrients necessary for the production of peppers.

loans.name: Tesoro Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Tesoro inicia su primer ciclo con 20 socias, este banco se formo con L. solidaridad D. otro Banco Comunal Llamado Llapanchik donD. sus socias invitaron a cada uno D. sus familiares, conocidos para formar este nuevo Banco Comunal.
Es el caso D. Yoriko que es hija D. L. secretaria del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, Yoriko es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con su mama, su alegría y compañerismo hizo que L. nombraran presidenta D. su Banco Comunal y Yoriko se comprometió a conducir su Banco para que sea el mejor, Yoriko ya conocía del trabajo en Finca pues en muchas ocasiones acompaño a su mama al Banco Comunal.
Yoriko junto a su familia se dedican a L. panificación en un horno alquilado, elabora panes, galletas que luego reparte a las diferentes tiendas D. acuerdo a sus pedidos con L. ayuda D. su familia. Además Yuriko estudia en un instituto. Su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. harina y azúcar.
Los sueños D. Yoriko es terminar sus estudios y ejercer su carrera, además D. tener un horno propio.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Tesoro (Treasure Communal Bank) began its first cycle with 20 members. This bank was formed with the assistance of another communal bank called the Banco Comunal Llapanchik (Llapanchik means “all of us” in Quechua), which invited family members and acquaintances to form this new communal bank. This is how Yoriko, the daughter of the secretary of Banco Comunal Llapanchik, became a member.

Yoriko is 20 years old and single. She lives with her mother. Her cheerfulness and team spirit caused her to be named president of her communal bank, and Yoriko has promised to make the bank better. Yoriko was already acquainted with Finca’s work because she accompanied her mother to communal bank meetings.

Yoriko, together with her family, is engaged in bread making in a rented oven. She makes breads and cookies that she then distributes with the help of her family to different shops according to their orders. In addition, Yoriko studies at a technical school..

Her loan will be invested in the purchase of flour and sugar. Yoriko dreams of finishing her studies and working at her career, as well as having her own oven.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of flour and sugar.

loans.name: Elisban

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Santiago del la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es El Sr. Elisban; él tiene 25 años de edad, El socio es soltero y se dedica a la compra al por mayor de libros, obras literarias, colecciones de libros y almanaques, afiches y otros. Nuestro socio trabaja vendiendo libros en la feria Túpac Amaru, el socio junto a otros compañeros de banco son jóvenes trabajadores y muy responsables, Nuestro socio en particular solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de sus proveedores.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Elisban belongs to the communal bank, “Lideres del Tercer Milenio,” Leaders of the Third Millennium. He lives in the Santiago district in the Cusco province and department. Elisban is 25 years old and single. He works as a purchaser of books, literary works, book collections, almanacs, and posters, among other things. He sells books in the Tupac Amaru market. Elisban along with fellow bank members are hardworking, responsible young people. He is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise from his suppliers. This member values and is infinitely grateful for the loan since it allows him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. Moreover, he is committed to making his payments in the stipulated time period.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise from suppliers

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, ya independizados, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, un distrito que ha venido experimentanto un moderado crecimiento comercial en estos ultimos años, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores agrícolas, como la mayoría de hombres del lugar, trabajó en una empresa agrícola durante algunos años y con las ganancias que obtuvo de esta actividad pudo adquirir un terreno propio en el cual cultiva granos y cereales para hacerse de ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia.

Actualmente tiene sembrado maíz, y espera tener una buena cosecha para poder asegurarle a su familia la estabilidad que merecen, es por ello que está trabajando arduamente para mejorar la producción de su cultivo. Para ayudarse a lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y asegurarse una buena producción.

Pablo es un hombre trabajador y que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder darle a su esposa la calidad de vida que ella se merece. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Pablo is 60 years old. He is married and has two children who are already grown and independent. He lives with his wife in the agricultural district of Cayaltí, an area which has been experiencing moderate commercial growth in recent years. The district is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Since he was very young, Pablo has worked in agriculture, like most of the men in his area. He worked for an agricultural company for several years, and with his savings from this work, he was able to acquire a piece of land of his own, where he cultivates grains and cereals to earn income and help his family get ahead. Currently, his fields are planted with corn, and he hopes to have a good harvest so that he can give his family the stability they deserve. It is for this reason that he is working arduously to improve the yield of his crops. To help him achieve this objective, he has requested a loan of 1500 Peruvian new soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he plans to invest in buying fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his crops and ensure good production. Pablo is a hard-working man who enjoys what he does for a living. His greatest desire is to continue working so that he can give his wife the qualify of life she deserves. He has worked with our institution in the past, and he has been punctual and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his corn fields

loans.name: Leonor Aurora

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su madre y su hija de siete años de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace dos años compró una fotocopiadora para ampliar un negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet que funcionaba en su casa. La idea del negocio nació debido a que originalmente existían pocos establecimientos de ese tipo por la zona y que resultaba de gran ayuda para los estudiantes del lugar. Con estas actividades ella ha venido sosteniendo a su familia durante todo este tiempo.

Anteriormente Leonor había solicitado al fondo Kiva un crédito que utilizó en el mantenimiento de su máquina fotocopiadora, ella logró su objetivo por lo que agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva. Ahora ha recurrido nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa para solicitar un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantenimiento de las computadoras de su negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet.

Leonor es una mujer activa y luchadora. Ella sabe que para progresar debe seguir trabajando por lo que día a día se esfuerza para salir adelante y cumplir con su mayor anhelo: ver a su hija convertida en un excelente profesional. 

Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Leonor is 34 years old and a single mother to her 7 year old daughter. They live with Leonor's mother in the district of Paijan, in the region of La Libertad, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. Two years ago Leonor purchased a photocopier to add to a business she ran from her house, renting internet access. She had the idea because there were few businesses of this type in the area, and it was a big help to all the students. This business has enabled Leonor to support her family.

Prior to this, Leonor had requested funding from Kiva to help with maintenance on her photocopier. She is requesting a new loan so that she can do maintenance on the terminals she uses to provide internet access. Leonor is a hardworking woman. She knows that to get ahead, she needs to work very hard every day. Her primary goal is that her daughter has the chance to study for a good profession. Leonor has worked with us before, and she demonstrated that she is able to make her payments in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do maintenance on the servers she uses to provide internet access

loans.name: Ana Zela

texts.es:
Ana es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector La Arenita del distrito de Paiján,una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar junto a su esposo como obrera agrícola en una empresa de la zona desde hace más de tres años, generalmente trabajan en la recolección de espárragos y otras verduras. Con los ingresos que percibieron de esta actividad han ido instalando desde hace seis meses una bodega en su domicilio, allí ellos ofrecen a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes de uso diario.

Este negocio está teniendo bastante acogida ya que le provee a sus vecinos artículos por los que tendrían que ir hasta el centro del distrito (que está muy alejado) para adquirirlos, Ana es consciente de ello y trata de brindar a sus clientes productos de primera calidad, de modo que pueda seguir manteniéndolos y mediante ello pueda seguir percibiendo ingresos que le permitan seguir adelante.

Actualmente ella ha creído conveniente adquirir más productos para incrementar sus ventas y percibir sus ganancias, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ana es una mujer trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es verlos progresar y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a 28 year old mother who lives with her husband and their children in La Arenita, in the region of La Libertad, located about 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. Together with her husband, she has worked in agriculture for more than 3 years for a company located in the region. They usually work harvesting asparagus and other vegetables. Six months ago, with the income they earned from this work, they opened a small market in their home from where they offer their customers all kinds of grocery and every day household items.

Their business has been well accepted as they provide their neighbors with many things they would have to travel to the city center to get. Ana is careful to provide her customers with high quality products, and she knows that in this way they will continue to increase their sales and their quality of life. She is requesting a loan to purchase more products for their store, so that she can continue to grow the business. Ana is a hard working woman who is very dedicated to her family. Her greatest dream is to see her family improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for the small market they run from their home.

loans.name: Zorigtbaatar

texts.en:
Zorigtbaatar G. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Arhangai province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. The two oldest children go to a local middle school. Zorigtbaatar has been making traditional Mongolian shoes by hand since 1992 and started operating a transportation business in 2008. His working capital was 60,000 MNT in the very beginning of his shoemaking and now the working capital exceeds 800,000 MNT.

Zorigtbaatar would eventually like to expand his shoemaking business. The continued growth of both businesses - transportation and shoemaking - has enabled him to purchase a car and to improve his family's quality of life. Zorigtbaatar works hard and is a modest, easygoing person. He says, “I hope to operate a stable business so that I can continue to provide for my children's education.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase shoemaking materials such as glue, leather, rubber and tools as well as car repairing materials.

loans.use: To purchase shoemaking materials

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline L., 50, and her husband Joselito, an employee, have three children. Evangeline helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has managed her own computer shop for some time.

Evangeline has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her computer shop.     

To ensure the success of her business, Evangeline would like to apply for a PHP 13,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying hardware, soft ware, and accessories to increase number computers that she can rent. She will also use some of the loan for computer maintenance.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can buy her own house and lot for her and her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying hardware, soft ware and computer maintenance

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
Normita M., 52, is married to Gaspar M., a taxi driver. They have two children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has managed her own variety store for quite some time.

Normita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 14,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries, toiletries and beverages needed to replenish and maintain her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying groceries, toiletries and beverages needed to replenish inventory

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en: Odsuren L. is 65 years old and lives with her husband and son in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger — a traditional housing tent. Her husband is retired and their son works in the local court decision implementing agency. Odsuren operates a food retailing business out of a small shop. She started her business in 1993 with working capital of 80,000 MNT and since then, it has increased 10 times. Over the years she has worked hard to build a stable business operation and has gained much experience. Her business is very important to her and her family. She says, "My only wish is to enlarge the business and purchase a bigger store than the current one." Odsuren is an open-minded, easy-going and hard-working woman. She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto T., 54, is making sure that his family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Melba T., a tailor, they are blessed with three children. He makes sure that he earns well so that their family can have a better life. He has been managing his own fruit and vegetable stand for the past few years.

Alberto has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with his previous loans, he was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  He is consistent in paying his dues because he used the money he borrowed to expand and improve his fruit and vegetable business.     

To ensure the success of his business, he would like to apply for a 14,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to his expanding business by buying more quantities of vegetables and fruits to be incorporated into his current product inventory.

He dreams that his business will continue to grow so that he can provide for his children’s education.
