His Express Soweto group members in Faulu Kenya have guaranteed him a loan of Kes.30,000.  He plans to buy timber and nails for making furniture.  He wants to meet his customers’ needs by stocking his shop with different furniture designs. His desire is to open other outlets in 10 years.

loans.use: To buy timber and nails for making furniture

loans.name: Aïssa Mbodj

texts.fr: Madame Aïssa Mbodj B.,âgée de 40 ans, s'active dans le commerce de tissus et portables depuis 18 ans.  C'était losqu'elle s'est mariée et elle a senti le besoin d'aider son mari qu'elle a entrepris le business. Elle compte des clients et clientes très fidéles qui viennet chercher chez ellez les marchandises. Cependant, elle sollicicte pour la première auprès de U-IMCEC un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour s'approvisionner.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aïssa Mbodj B., 40 years of age, has been in the business of selling woven fabric and supplies for 18 years. She started in this business when she got married and felt there was a need to assist her husband. Aïssa has faithful clients who come to her for their purchases. She is therefore requesting this first loan from U-IMEC for 150 000 Francs CFA to buy supplies.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of cloth and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of grain and other agricultural necessities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her field and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming land and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousseynou N. est un travailleur social au niveau du PDEF. Vue que les rémunérations des travailleurs sociaux  ne pouvaient pas satisfaire ses besoins, il s'est investi dans le commerce d'habillements où il trouve son compte. Marié et pére d'un enfant âgé de 3 ans, Monsieur N. trouve ce commerce en plus des bénéfices qu'il tire, lui permet de se faire des amis et est très apprécié pazr les jeunes qui constituent les 60% de ses clients.
Cependant Monsieur N. Ousseynou âgé de 34 ans souhaitait un crédit de 150 000 FCFA pour s'approvisionner en prêt à porter afin de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousseynou N. is a social worker at the PDEF. Unable to make ends meet on a social worker’s salary, he started to sell clothing with positive results. Married and a father to a 3-year old child, Mr. N. has found that in addition to any profits made, his business has allowed him to make friends and has become very popular with the younger crowd who comprise 60% of his customer base. Mr. N., age 34, would like to get a loan in the amount of 150,000 francs CFA to stock up on ready to wear items in order to cope with customer demand.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ready to wear clothing

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 30 years old and  married.  Josephine lives by selling a variety of goods in her shop.  These goods include cooking oil, foodstuffs like rice, beans, peas, and Irish potatoes. This is her fourth successful year in this business.  Josephine opens her shop from 7 am until 8 pm every day.

Josephine, after realizing that her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully and that the foodstuffs are highly demanded by a large number of people, is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Josephine will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodtuffs including rice, beans, peas, Irish potatoes, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her arable land and purchase planting supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying manure and seeds

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en:
Victoire is 48 years old and divorced. She takes care of four children who are between 9 and 17 years old. Victoire works hard so that she provides all the basic needs of her children. Victoire owns a small business (a restaurant) in her living place and it is profitable.  The hours of her business are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day, even during the weekend.

Victoire is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business, which will make her efficient as well as effective and more successful. This loan will help her buy additional equipment and foodstuffs to satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy equipment and foodstuffs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia R., 37, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Eleneto R., 41, a jeepney driver, they have two children.  She has always been challenged to provide the daily needs for her family. She makes sure that she earns well so that her family can have a better life. She has been into direct selling of branded apparel, and popular brands of cosmetics and toiletries for some time now. Sonia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying additional items and advance orders of her patrons.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide an education for her children. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growth of cultivatable surface and purchase of grain

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Madame Amy G. est âgée de 55 ans. Elle faisait jadis de la coiffure  chez elle. Maintenant vu son âge avancé, ses filles se chargent de ce métier pour maintenir la clientèle. Cependant, Madame Amy G. s'est lancée dans la vente de voiles,, de l'encens (thiouraye) et autres. Ainsi, pour renouveler son stock de marchandises elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 FCFA auprès de U-IMCEC où elle est membre depuis 2009.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy G. is 55 years old. She was formerly a hairdresser at her home. At present, given her advanced age, her daughters have taken over the business in order to maintain customers. Meanwhile, Mrs. Amy G. has begun selling veils, incense (thiouraye) and other goods. In order to replenish her stock of merchandise, she has requested a loan of 100,000 CFA francs from U-IMCEC, of which she has been a member since 2009.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up supplies

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 49-year-old determined lady who does tailoring.  Previously, she was earning a living from her grocery shop.  She started tailoring so that she would get more income.  She hopes to expand her business, which she has been running for two years.  Jane is very skilled in tailoring and desires to open a tailoring college to help young girls who cannot afford a university education.  Jane is glad to be associated with a group in Faulu Kenya because she has gained business ideas with fellow group members. She has requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy fabric and thread for making clothes.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread for making clothes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita V., 42, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Margarita, a widow, has always been challenged to provide for the daily needs of her family. She makes sure that she earns well so that her family can have better lives. She has been managing her own general store for years and is now planning to expand to a new variety store.

Margarita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for an 11,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used to buy more quantities of groceries, beverages and other items for the opening of her new variety store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and that she will be able to buy her own house and lot. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying additonal stock to be incorporated into her current product inventory

loans.name: Togoontumur

texts.en:
Togoontumur S. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She operates a dairy-trading business, purchasing dairy products from a nearby small village and transporting them to the market in her town. Togoontumur started her business in 1995 with working capital of 30,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) and it soon reached 2,900,000 MNT. 

Since her business has become increasingly profitable, she has been able to provide for her three children's university tuition fees and purchased a car for her husband as well. 

Togoontumur's main goal is to expand her business and she wishes one of her children would inherit her business in the future. She is an open-minded and hardworking woman. 

Togoontumur is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products at wholesale prices in order to increase her sales in the market.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Foresighted and affable M. Godfrey has, for the last eight years, banked on his agricultural business in Rweibane Mazinga, Bushenyi, to get by. This married 30-year-old gentleman has, with the support of this business, brought forth a change for the better in the welfare of his family of three.

This business was handed down to Godfrey by his late father. Seeing the hard work the old man had put in was some sort of hard act to follow at the beginning but, with belief and with the support of family, he got into his stride. In a week, his business brings in 30,000 a week.

With this loan, Godfrey is upbeat. He says he is going to bring change to bear in his business by paying for the mulching of his gardens and also by buying manure for his banana plantations.

loans.use: To buy manure for his plantations and to pay for mulching

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Madame Astou Ngom est mariée mère de 5 enfants. Elle s'active dans le commerce depuis longtemps. Tout est arrivé lorsque son voisin commerçant lui a proposé des tissus pour essayer de les écouler dans son quartier.  Et c'est à partir de cemoment qu'elle décida de se convertir dans le commerce pour combattre l'oisiveté. Les choses se sont développées petit à petit et elle est même arrivée à diversifer la vente de tissus par la vente de l'encens qu'on appelle thiouraye en wolof. 
Membre de U-IMCEC depuis Novembre 2009, elle sollicite pour la première fois un crédit de 50 000 FCFA pour acheter quelques tissus e de l'encens afin de voir comment ça se passe avec les mutuelles
texts.en:
Ms. Astou Ngom is a married mother of five children.  She has been active in commerce for a long time.   Everything fell into place when her merchant neighbor suggested she try to sell fabrics in her district.  And from then on, she decided to switch to this business to combat idleness.  Things developed little by little, and she has even managed to diversify her sale of fabrics with the sale of incense, which are called thiouraye in Wolof.  A member of U-IMCEC since November 2009, Astou is requesting for the first time a loan of 50,000 francs CFA to buy some fabrics and incense in order to see how this will go with the group members.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth and incense

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Batdorj S. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and 3-month-old daughter in the Arhangai province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife is a student and their daughter stays at home. 

Batdorj started a transportation business in 2002 with his father. He is a good driver and that has enabled him to transport more people and goods. His daily revenue ranges between approximately 18,000 and 20,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). Batdorj is committed to not only improving the lives of his wife and child, but he also wants to expand his business through opening his own taxi-service center. 

Batdorj is a hardworking and gentle person who says, “I want to provide my customers with fast, safe and reliable service.” He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to buy a newer, more reliable small-size truck so that his business will become even more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase a truck

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of herbicides, grains, and seeds

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario O., 36, is married to Alfredo O., 43, who is a jeepney driver, and they are blessed with five children.  Rosario wants to make sure that her family has enough provisions to meet daily needs. She has always been challenged to provide for the daily needs of her family, and she hopes to improve her family’s living standards. She adds to her family’s income by managing her own retailing business of eggs. 

Rosario has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance in regards to her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of additional capital to expand her business by buying eggs in bulk for sale.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and that she can provide education for her children. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying bulk eggs for retail

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en: Chimgee B. is a single mother who lives with her two daughters in the Arhangai province, western Mongolia. She and her daughters live together in a house they own. Chimgee operates a used clothing retail business in the local market. She began her business in 2005 by importing clothing garments from China. Chimgee began her business with a working capital 500,000 MNT, and it has now reached 1,700,000 MNT. Chimgee lost her husband in a car accident in 2004. She is an open-minded and hard-working woman who wishes her daughters get good education in the future. Chimgee is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing as well as diary products in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and diary products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ploughing; purchase of grain and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing corn and manioc

loans.name: Chinbaatar

texts.en: Chinbaatar D. is 34 years old and lives with his wife in the Arhangai province, central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife seasonally works for a private company as a decoration plasterer. Chinbaatar operates a transport service in his town. He purchased a large van in 2008 with a working capital 700,000 MNT, and it has now reached 1,500,000 MNT. He has also fully repaired his van. He has found success with his business and has gained much experience as a driver over the years. Chinbaatar is a very honest and hardworking person and is known for his good character by his customers. He hopes to continue to provide a quality and efficient transportation service in the future. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Famous Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Yaa A. is currently the group leader of 'Famous Trust' bank group made up of 10 members. Yaa is lovely and a strong woman. She is 43 years old and sells kente cloth to customers in her community. She also engages in farming to supplement her income. She plans to invest the loan to purchase a variety of kente cloth to meet customers’ demand. 

Kente cloth is a famous richly woven traditional fabric of single or multiple colors, usually worn during special occasions like festivals, parties, out-door events and other social gatherings This has created a market for women like Yaa.

Yaa has divorced and she is the mother of five children from age 5-22. She lives with her children in a family house. She says that she dreams of being able to grow her business to support her children through university education.

loans.use: To purchase kente cloth in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying seeds and manure and to expand her fields

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr:
Mariée et âgée de 39 ans, Madame Maréme S. évolue dans le petit commerce depuyis 2 ans.Elle a débuté par la vente de produits de dépigmentation qui étaient très prisés par les jeunes femmes. Mainteneant, elle vend du parfum, de l'encnes et des laits de beauté. 
Membre de U-IMCEC, Madame S. souhaitait un crédit de 100 000FCFA pour s'approvisionner en produits.
texts.en:
Ms. Madame Maréme S., 39 years old and married, has been working in small-scale commerce for two years. She started by selling depigmentation products, which are very popular among young women. She now sells perfumes, incense, and beauty lotions. A member of U-IMCEC, Ms. S. wishes to obtain a loan of 100,000 francs CFA to stock up on products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren D. is 27 years old and lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Dolgorsuren currently sells single use consumer goods such as paper cups, plastic baggies, and rolls of tape at Narantuul, the biggest and most crowded market in Ulaanbaatar. She started her business in 2005 with her ex-husband but they are divorced and now she is working alone. Her daily sales range between 150,000 to 200,000 MNT approximately and are supplemented twice a week.

Dolgorsuren has recently purchased a plot of land with her business revenue. She is very hard working, open minded and very persistent in achieving her goals. She says, "My business is continuing quite well and I have a plan to build a house on the plot of land where we currently live." She is requesting a 1,335,000 MNT loan to purchase a large quantity of plastic baggies.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of plastic baggies

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Mme T. Edoh vit à Gapé-Avegan où elle est née en 1966. Marié et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle est cultivatrice. C’est une grande productrice de souchet et de maïs. Son ambition est d’accroître considérablement sa production agricole au cours de cette campagne agricole. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite sera donc destiné au labour, au sarclage et à l’achat d’engrais.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edoh T. lives in Gapé-Avegan, where she was born in 1966. Married and the mother of four children, she is a farmer. She excels at growing yellow nut sedge [a tuber plant] and corn. Her goal is to greatly increase her production this season. Thus the loan she is seeking will be used towards the costs of labor and hoeing and the purchase of fertilizers.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of labor, hoeing and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for plowing and to purchase seeds

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr: Monsieur Issa D. est un retraité âgé de 68 ans. C'est après sa retraite qu'il s'est converti dans l'embouche bocine. Ainsi il a commencé à élever des moutons pour se rendre utile et avoir une retraite paisible d'après lui. Il compte avec ce prêt de 200 000 FCFA acheter des moutons pour développer son élevage.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa D. is a 68-year-old retiree.  After retiring from his profession, he switched to the fattening of livestock.  So he started to raise sheep to make himself useful, he says, and to have a nice, quiet retirement.  He plans on using this loan of 200,000 francs CFA to buy sheep for developing his livestock farming.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sheep

loans.name: Javzansuren

texts.en: Javzansuren D. is 48 years old and lives with her four children in the Arhangai province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Javzansuren operates a clothes making business in her town where she not only sews the traditional Mongolian style clothing, but she also sews European style clothing. She started her own business in 2006 with working capital of 3000,000 MNT and now it has reached 2,000,000 MNT.  Because she has gained a lot of experience, she knows what her customers want and how much they are willing to pay for her quality clothing. Janzansuren is a friendly, generous and hardworking woman who wants to enlarge her business. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics and finishing materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Plowing and buying manure and herbicides

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 32 years old and married with five children who are between 2 and 11 years old. Marie Chantal is best known in the shoe selling business and this is her eighth successful year in this business. The hours of her business are from 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Marie Chantal is in the process of requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase different sizes of shoes (mainly women's shoes). With the additional stock, Marie will hopefully earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability. In addition, Marie Chantal will improve the lifestyle of her work.

loans.use: To buy different styles of shoes to sell

loans.name: Nyame Ye Nyame Group

texts.en:
Jones describes himself as a nice man. He is 35 years old and he is the leader of the “Nyame ye Nyame” (translated as, "God is God") borrower group. Jones is a trader in Kente cloth. Kente cloth is a famous richly woven traditional fabric of single or multiple colors, usually worn during special occasions like festivals, parties, outdoor events and other social gatherings. 

Jones has operated his business for the past 12 years. His second business is farming. Jones is excited to be taking out this loan, with which he plans to purchase kente cloth in bulk. He dreams of owning a store to showcase his kente cloth.

Jones is married to a woman who is also a trader in kente cloth and they have four children from age 1-13.   He hopes to put aside more savings to be able to provide good education for all their children. The other members of the group are mainly kente traders and farmers.

loans.use: To purchase kente cloth in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more car spare parts to reequip his shop

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Otgonbaatar C. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the Arhangai province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter attends a local middle school while her husband helps her out with her business.

Otgonbaatar operates a retail dairy products business in her town at the local market. She began this business in 2006 with working capital of 300,000 MNT and now it has reached 1,000,000. In 2008, she also began a clothing business. She purchased a car for her husband with the business revenues. Otgonbaatar attributes her business success to her knowledge of the local market demands. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more dairy products and consumer goods.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Abu Bakarr's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from a primary school in Lunsar, a small town in Northern Sierra Leone. This school was established in 1960 to improve on the standard of education for the children of Lunsar and its surrounding village. This school is staffed by nine dedicated teachers and has 324 pupils. Out of the nine staff, four have applied for a loan of 3,900,000 leones from SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time. 

Staff from this institution, like many other schools’ staff within SMT’s operational area, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their salaries alone. With the help of a loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land or house-building materials; or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers repay their loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Abu Bakarr, 46, is the headmaster at the school and leader of this group. He has been a teacher for 20 years. He was born in Lunsar, is married to a businesswoman and they have two children. One of his children is still a baby and the other one is in secondary school. Abu Bakarr will use his loan to buy furniture such as chairs and a bed. He will use the remainder to meet other family expenses.

loans.use: To buy furniture such as chairs and a bed

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en:
Meet the teachers of a primary school in Lunsar, a small town in Northern Sierra Leone! This school was built in 1986 to promote education within Lunsar and villages surrounding Lunsar. This is the first loan that teachers of this school are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, some of these borrowers will invest in their businesses, and others will buy pieces of furniture. Some pay school fees for their children, some will use it to buy a plot of land and so on.

Musa K. is the headmaster of the school and leader of this group. He is age 45. He was born in Port Loko, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married with four children: one of his children is a baby and three are in secondary school. Musa has been a teacher for 28 years now. 

Musa will hand over his share of the loan to his wife who is a petty businesswoman. His wife sells palm oil, rice and other market foodstuffs. This will definitely boost his wife’s business so that she, too, will be in a better position to contribute significantly towards running the home.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice and other market foodstuffs

loans.name: Stephen G.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the teachers of a primary school in the small town of Lunsar about 65 miles away from Makeni city. These hardworking and dedicated teachers have come to SMT for the first time seeking a loan of 7,660,000 leones. With the help of this loan, these teachers will embark on some meaningful projects that their mere salaries alone cannot support. Some of them will use their loan to buy pieces of furniture; others, to buy house building materials or a piece of land. Some will pay school fees for their children, while some of them will invest the loan in businesses. 

Stephen G. K. is the headmaster at the school and leader of this group. He is age 55. He was born in a place called Mange Acra, in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married with 14 children, 11 of whom are still in school. Stephen has been a teacher for 30 years now. Stephen will use his share of the loan to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs, iron rods, roofing nails, etc. 

(Inserted in the photo is a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs, iron rods, roofing nails, etc.

loans.name: Tanto Kuru Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Fatu C.. Fatu is age 45. She was born in Makolo village near Magburaka. Now she lives in Magburaka with her husband and two children. Her husband is a teacher and one of her children is attending primary school. For nine years now, Fatu has been selling cooked rice, fish, meat and vegetables. Fatu will use this loan to buy fish and rice wholesale. 

In the photo are members of the “Tanto-Kuru” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish and rice wholesale

loans.name: Kargbo United Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Memuna C.. Memuna was born in Magburaka 30 years ago. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Memuna has been selling market food for two years now. She sells groundnuts (peanuts), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), and pepper. She will use her share of the loan to buy these items wholesale. 

Pictured here are members of the “Kargbo United” group from Magburaka, a town in Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each. With this loan they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy groundnut, onions, margi and pepper

loans.name: Arsenal Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Marie C. who is pictured on the left. Marie is age 31 and was born in Magburaka town. She is married with three children. Her husband is a businessman and two of her children are attending schools. For 5 years now, Marie has been selling groundnuts (peanuts), pepper, tomatoes, salt, sugar, rice and oil. Marie will use this loan to expand her business by buying groundnuts, onions and rice wholesale. 

Pictured here are members of the “Arsenal” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts, onions and rice wholesale

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Monsieur Moussa D. est un comptable retraité âgé de 71 ans. Depuis sa retraite, il s'est lancé dans l'agriculture.Il compte des terres que lui avaient léguées ses parents et qui se sirtuent  dans une zone essentiellement agricole. Il sollicite cependant auprès de U-IMCEC un pre^t de 300 000 FCFA pour acheter de l'engrais afin d'assurer pour ses prochaines récoltes une production importante.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa D., aged 71, is a retired accountant.  Since retiring, he got started in agriculture.  He has land that his parents had handed down to him.  It is located in what is basically a farming area.  He is however requesting from U-IMCEC a loan of 300,000 francs CFA for buying manure in order to ensure significant production for the harvests to follow.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying manure

loans.name: Face Reality Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Face Reality” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. This will be their second loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of their previous SMT/Kiva loan, these entrepreneurs' businesses expanded. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each in order to further expand their businesses. 

Mohamed S. pictured on the right is the leader of this group. Mohamed was born in Magburaka. He is 35 years of age, married to a businesswoman and they have one child who is in primary school. Mohamed sells toothpaste, toothbrushes, cosmetics, shoes, and so on. He has been doing business for 8 years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy toothpaste, toothbrushes, cosmetics and shoes wholesale.

loans.use: Buy toothpaste, toothbrushes, cosmetics and shoes wholesale

loans.name: Sarkomo Group

texts.en:
Fatmata B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatmata was born in Shega village, about 45 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has 4 children – 1 in primary school, 2 in secondary school and 1 in college. For over 7 years now, Fatmata has been selling roasted meat, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), and rice. 

This is the first loan that Fatmata and her group members have applied for from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (SLL 600,000) to expand her business; she will buy palm oil and rice wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy palm oil and rice wholesale to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Plowing and buying manure and seeds

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with five children, who all attend school. She resides in and owns a three room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Josephine also takes care of additional family members. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Josephine is a tailor working at her home in Kyebando Nsooba Kawempe Division. She has been in the business of making uniforms for all schools around her home for eight years. Josephine sells these uniforms at both wholesale and retail levels. She works six days a week. Her business challenges are defaulters and transportation of the uniforms from Kiyembe in Kampala city to her home in Kyebando Nsooba. Josephine wants to use this loan to buy more school uniform materials. She hopes to see her business grow big and to start employing three girls. Josephine joined MCDT to boost her business by acquiring additional capital.

loans.use: To buy more school uniform materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Plowing, weeding and to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 37 years old, married with five children who are between 3 and 19 years old. Priscilla takes care of one dependent who is 20 years old; this one is a relative. Priscilla's husband is a motor bike taxi driver, and they both work hard for the development of their family. 

Priscilla owns a business selling cow meat; her business is well-known as well as organized. She employs two people as helpers so that her business runs smoothly. Priscilla has an experience of 16 years in her business and the hours of her business are from 6 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day.

Priscilla is now requesting her first loan from KIva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase many cows which will help Priscilla to satisfy many customers of cow meat. With this satisfaction, Priscilla will be able to earn more profits to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Oumarou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumarou Touré est un homme marié de 39 ans et sans enfant. Il vit dans la famille paternelle dans le quartier Naniérila de Bougouni.
Très tôt, Monsieur Oumarou Touré commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment  la charge des batteries qu’il a appris dès son jeune âge auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de plus 10 ans, Monsieur Oumarou Touré maîtrise parfaitement son activité et compte utiliser son propre compteur électrique (ne plus dépendre de ses voisins avec qui ils partageaient le même compteur).
Pour ainsi améliorer son entreprise Monsieur Oumarou Touré décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Monsieur Oumarou Touré compte utiliser ce prêt pour payer les frais d’abonnement  d’un compteur électrique auprès de la Société Énergie du Mali (EDM s.a.), exploitation de Bougouni.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Touré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice, il envisage agrandir son entreprise et assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Oumarou Touré, aged 39, is a married man who has no children.  He lives in his father's family in the Naniérila district of Bougouni.  Early on, he started working in revenue-generating businesses, especially battery charging, which he learned at a young age from his uncle.  With over ten years of experience, he has mastered his business and plans on using his own electricity meter (to depend no longer on his neighbors with whom they have been sharing the same meter).  Thus, to improve his enterprise, Oumarou decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first individual loan.  He intends to use this loan for paying the registration fee for an electricity meter from the Société Énergie du Mali (EDM s.a.) for use in Bougouni. With this loan, he plans to make a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA.  With the profit, he envisions expanding his enterprise and ensuring that family expenses are covered.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fee for the electrical network

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: labour et achat d’engrais

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama D. est un homme marié de 38 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le  quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de  Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, Monsieur Adama D. tenta plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus telles la vente d’habits, de chaussures, de tasses, etc, mais sans réussite. Il finit par apprendre auprès de son grand frère les activités  d’achat et de vente de divers articles pour  boutique. Avec plus de 2 années d’expérience, il maitrise son activité et est très sollicité.
 Pour améliorer son activité, Monsieur Adama D. décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique.
Il est à son troisième prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédent ont été correctement remboursés.  
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Adama D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 500 FCFA.
 Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique et assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr Adama D. is 38 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 3 children in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougoni. Having never attended school, Mr Adama Kiallo has tried several income-generating activities such as selling clothes, shoes, cups etc but without success. He ended up learning from his grandfather how to buy and sell various articles and run his own shop. With more than 2 years experience, he is mastering this business and his service is in high demand. To further improve his business, Mr Adama D. decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to buy various articles for his shop. This is his third individual loan and he has diligently repaid all his previous loans. He sources his products from Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and his clientele is the local population. With this loan Mr Adam D. hopes to generate a monthly profit of 60 500FCFA, with which he intends to make his shop larger and to cover all his family's expenses.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers pour boutique.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: labour, étendre ses surfaces cultivables et acheter des engrais

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with four children, who all attend school. She also takes care of her young brothers and sisters because her parents have died. She resides in and owns a two room house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water.

For the past five years, Sarah has had a business selling tomatoes, onions, oranges and mangoes from a stall that she owns. Her customers are people in the nearby community. She works six days a week and sells at both the retail and wholesale levels. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of tomatoes, oranges, onions and mangoes. Sarah's business challenges are perishability and transportation. She hopes to own a freezer. She joined MCDT to get additional capital.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, mangoes and oranges

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata D. est une femme mariée de 43 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni. 
Elle n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école,  dès à son jeune âge, elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère.
Avec une expérience de 15 ans Madame Aminata D. maîtrise les activités d’achat et de vente des habits et des chaussures, domaine dans lequel elle a opté de s’installer.
 Afin d’étoffer son fonds de roulement, Madame Aminata D. décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son  premier prêt.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, des colis de chaussures et des complets d’habits pour enfants. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali) auprès des grossistes du grand marché.
Elle effectue sa vente en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni et au marché les jours de foires. 
Elle compte réaliser,  avec ce prêt, un bénéfice mensuel de 28 000FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs Animata D. is 43 years old. She is married with 6 children and lives in a polygamous family with her husband, his second wife, and their children in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni. She did not have the opportunity to attend school, and so began income generating activities with her mother from a young age. With 15 years experience, Madame Aminata D. is mastering the business of buying and selling clothes and shoes, her chosen field of specialty. In order to increase her working capital,, Mrs Aminata D. decided to join Soro Yiriwaso with whom she is taking out her first loan. She intends to use this loan to buy boxes of shoes and sets of clothing for children. She gets her supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from the wholesalers at the main market. She is a mobile vendor, selling her wares through the different districts of Bougoni and at the market on fair days. With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 28 000FCFA which will essentially be used to grow her business.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 26 years old. He is married with 5 children between the ages of 3 and 10, all of whom are attending school.  He is a dairy farmer from Litein, in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for 4 years and has employed one person from the community. His products are milk, which he sells to the tea estate, and tea, which he sells to the Kenya Tea Development Authority. Before venturing into farming Richard was operating a hotel business.  His biggest challenges in farming are lack of animal feed, the high cost of artificial insemination services, which are not readily available, and a lack of knowledge about dairy farming.

Richard has requested this loan of KES 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will help him to repay the loan and to pay his children’s school fees. In the future, he would like to upgrade his dairy animals to high yielding cows, and build a dairy unit.  He will also request more loans from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Zaffarjon

texts.en:
A. Zaffarjon is a very courageous man who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and agriculture. He is the father of three children, and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, Zaffarjon has been able to get ahead in his business by purchasing cattle which he breeds on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It is for this reason that Zaffarjon has come to IMON International for a loan to purchase more animals for breeding.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history.  It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for breeding

loans.name: Mayira Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in Mayira, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feeding and clothing them. 

Alfred M. K. is the leader of this group. He was born in Yoni village, 35 years ago. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending school. 

Alfred sells soap, toothpaste, drinks, batteries, etc. He has been doing this business for 10 years now. With his share of the loan, he will expand his business by buying soaps, toothpastes, drinks, batteries wholesale.

loans.use: Buy soaps, toothpaste, drinks, batteries wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: labour, sarclage et achat d’engrais

loans.name: Dependable God Group

texts.en:
Petty trading like the sale of groceries is widespread in Ghana because it is easy to start the business up. It usually begins with table-top selling and then grows to become a kiosk and eventually becomes a supermarket. Angelina K. is an entrepreneur who has been trading in groceries like biscuits, bottled water, candies, canned foods, rice, cooking oil, toiletries, etc. for the past 8 years. She is now 48 years old. 

Angelina hopes that, one day, she will be able to grow her business into a big shop. She is excited to be taking the loan which she plans to invest in purchasing groceries in bulk to serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market. She also farms to generate additional income.

Angelina is married to a farmer and they have five children from age 9-18 years. She describes herself as a cooperative group leader of 'Dependable God' Borrower Group, made up of 10 members. She says her group members are cordial and as the leader she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: 27-year-old Abigail is married to an engineer and has one child.  She has been operating a beauty shop called Unique Salon for three years.  She was employed before she went into business for herself, and she is currently earning more income than before.  Abigail is a member of the group called Transparency in Faulu Kenya, where she saves her money on weekly basis.  Being in the group, she can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya.  With this loan of KES 40,000, she plans to buy beauty products such as nail polish, hair oil and hair treatments.  She hopes to open other outlets in the future.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as hair treatment, hair oil and nail polish

loans.name: Lunsar Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Lunsar” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Isatu S. is the leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a businessman and they have 2 children. Isatu has been a businesswoman for 8 years now; she sells soft drinks, beer, butter, milk, cocoa, sugar, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, beer, butter, milk, cocoa, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Unity Family Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Unity Family” group. They are small scale businesspeople in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 600,000 each from SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni. 

Mabinty O. (pictured second from the right) is the leader of this group. Mabinty was born in a village near Magburaka. She is approximately 45 years of age, married to a businessman, and they have seven children. Mabinty sells poyo (palm wine – wine tapped from palm trees), palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil) and groundnuts (peanuts). She has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Mabinty would like to buy gallons of palm wine and palm oil and bags of groundnuts.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm wine and palm oil and bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of herbicides, expand her farmable land and the purchase of fertilizer.

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Dramane Dembélé est un homme marié de 34 ans et père de 4 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le  quartier Faraba de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative du Mali)
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, dès à son jeune âge il mena des activités génératrices de revenus.
Pendant 10 ans il faisait les travaux journaliers auprès des commerçants notamment le transport de leurs marchandises avec un pousse pousse au marché et dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni,  sans succès.
C’est ainsi qu’il décida d’apprendre la vente d’articles divers dans une  boutique auprès de son oncle.
Avec plus de 7 années d’expérience, il maîtrise cette activité. Présentement sa boutique marche bien et  reçoit beaucoup de clients.
 Pour le renforcement de son commerce, Monsieur Dramane Dembélé décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt précédent obtenu avec Soro Yiriwaso a été correctement remboursé.
Il compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter une grande quantité d’articles divers pour sa boutique.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Dramane Dembélé compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA.
 Il envisage toujours d’agrandir sa boutique avec ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Dramane Dembélé is 34 years old, married and the father of four children. He lives with his wife and children in the Faraba borough of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali). Not having attended school, he embarked on revenue-generating activities from an early age. For ten years he performed daily tasks for merchants, notably using a “pousse-pousse” to transport their merchandise to market and to different areas of Bougouni, without encountering success. Thereafter, he decided to learn to sell various articles in his uncle’s shop. After more than seven years’ experience, he now masters this activity. His shop is working well and he attracts many customers. To strengthen his commerce, Mr. Dramane Dembélé decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. The preceding loan granted by the MFI was repaid in full. He intends to use this new loan to buy a large quantity of various articles for his shop. He gets his supplies from Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). With this loan, Mr. Dramane Dembélé is hoping to reach monthly earnings of 60,000 FCFA. He envisions using his earnings to extend his shop.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various articles for shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Production and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maimouna Sangaré est une femme mariée de 44 ans et mère de 4 enfants.  Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari, ses enfants et sa coépouse dans le quartier Médine de Bougouni. 
Elle a vite abandonné l’école au profit des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat  vente de légumes et des condiments alimentaires. Elle a appris cette activité  auprès de sa grande mère.
 Avec plus d’une quinzaine d’année d’expérience, Madame Maimouna Sangaré maîtrise  bien son activité et est très appréciée au marché de Bougouni. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, Maimouna décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle  est à son premier prêt.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, une grande quantité de légumes dans les villages environnants  de Sikasso auprès des producteurs et dans la foire hebdomadaire.
Elle effectue sa vente au grand marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Elle espère réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000FCFA. 
Avec ce bénéfice elle compte agrandir son entreprise afin de devenir une grossiste.
texts.en:
Ms. Maimouna Sangaré is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of four children.  She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, children, and co-wife in the Médine district of Bougouni. She had soon dropped out of school in favor of revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of vegetables and condiments.  She learned this business from her grandmother.  With over fifteen years of experience, she has a good command of her business and is much appreciated at the Bougouni market. In order to satisfy her clearly-growing customer base, Maimouna decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first loan.  She intends to use this loan for buying a large quantity of vegetables from producers in the village surrounding Sikasso and at the weekly fairs. She makes her sales at the big market of Bougouni to a customer base composed of retailers and consumers.  With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA.  She plans on using the profits to expand her enterprise in order to become a wholesale merchant. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama B. est un homme marié de 23 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, pendant des années il accompagnait son père dans les travaux champêtres au village.
Quelques années après il décida de venir à Bougouni pour apprendre la commercialisation des bétails auprès de son oncle.
Avec une expérience de 9 ans, Monsieur Adama B. maîtrise bien son activité et est très sollicité.
Afin de renforcer son capital, il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à sa première expérience. 
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, des moutons et  des chèvres.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages environnants de Bougouni et effectue sa vente à domicile et dans la foire hebdomadaire  de Bougouni, à une clientèle composée de bouchers et de consommateurs.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Adama B. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice, il envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama B. is a married man, 23 years old, and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children at his father’s place in the Hérémakono district, in the North of Bogouni. Not having had formal schooling, he has been helping his father with various manual jobs around the village. A few years later he decided to come to Bougoni to learn from his uncle how to raise livestock for sale. With nine years of experience, he is now very good at his trade, and his business is popular. In order to bolster his capital, he has decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, and this would be his first experience with the organization. He plans to use his loan to purchase sheep and goats. He buys his stock in Bougoni and nearby villages and sells out of his home and at the weekly market of Bogouni, to a customer base composed of butchers and consumers. With this loan, Mr. Adama B. plans to achieve a monthly income of 25,000 West African francs. Thanks to this income, he plans to expand his enterprise.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing small livestock

loans.name: Chatta

texts.fr:
Madame Chatta Samaké est une femme mariée de 25 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Madame Chatta Samaké n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école moderne. Très vite elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus telles la vente de condiments alimentaires. Cette activité ne lui réussie pas. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de faire le commerce de pagnes et de chaussures. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son amie. Avec 4 années d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité.
Après 4 prêts solidaires tous remboursés sans aucune difficulté, elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
C’est pour une améliorer de son activité, qu’elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des  pièces de pagne et  des colis de chaussures.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali). La vente se fait au marché et dans le quartier à une clientèle composée de  la population locale, et surtout  de femmes.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qui lui permettra  d’améliorer son entreprise et   payer les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Chatta Samaké is 25 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children in the Torakabougou district of Bougoni. Mrs. Chatta Samaké hasn't had opportunity to receive formal schooling. Very early on she got engaged in business activities such as selling food condiments. She didn’t have success with that line of business. And thus she decided to switch to selling “pagnes” [traditional colorful fabric for wrap clothing] and shoes. She has learned the trade from a friend of hers. Now, with four years of experience, she knows her business well. After four solidarity [group] loans, all repaid without any issues, she is now on her first individual loan. In order to upgrade her business, she decided to collaborate with Soro Yriwaso in order to purchase sets of “pagnes” and packs of shoes. She stocks up in Bougoni and in Bamako (the capital of Mali). She sells her wares at the local market to customers living in the area, mostly women. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly income of 35,000 West African francs, which will allow her to upgrade her business and to pay off the interest on her loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing "pagnes" fabric and shoes [for resale]

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Madame Codou D. est âgée de 53 ans et s'active depuis plus de 10 ans dans la vente de bissap (oseille. Elle reconnait avoir fait ce commerce par l'abondance de cette culture dans la zone de Bambey et le caractère lucratif de la vente à Dakar.Elle sollicite cependant un prêt de 50 000 FCFA pour s'approvionner en bissap
texts.en:
Ms. Codou D., aged 53, has been active for over ten years in selling bissap (dried hibiscus flowers).  She acknowledges being in this business due to the abundance of this produce in the Bambey area and the lucrative aspect of sales in Dakar.   She is however requesting a loan of 50,000 francs CFA for stocking up on bissap.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hibiscus flowers (bissap)

loans.name: Haggai Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Felicia is a hard-working businesswoman who sells underwear and ladies' wear to customers through door-to-door sales. She is married to a trader. She is a 47-year-old mother of two children, ages 16 and 18 years old. She spends most of her time taking care of her business and also supporting her children in school. She has acquired 7 years' experience doing this business. She plans to invest the loan to purchase assorted underwear and ladies' wear to meet demand. 

Felicia is also a farmer. She is optimistic about the future. She hopes to acquire a shop to expand her trade and support her children to attain university education.  

Felicia is currently the leader of a trust bank group called 'Haggai', named after one of the members. It is made up of six members. The others in the group are mainly farmers and as the group leader, Felicia ensures repayment by members.

loans.use: To purchase underwear and ladies' wear

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Niaré un homme marié de 28 ans et père de 2 enfants.  Il vit avec sa femme  et ses enfants dans le quartier Dialanicoro de Bougouni.
Après l’école coranique, Monsieur Adama Niaré se lance dans les activités génératrices de revenus. Il a fait la commercialisation des céréales pendant 4 ans au marché de Bougouni et dans les villages environnants les jours de foires hebdomadaires. Cette activité ne lui a pas porté fruit, c’est ainsi qu’il décida de commencer l’achat et la vente des condiments alimentaires au grand marché de Bougouni.
Avec 6 années d’expérience, Monsieur Adama Niaré maitrise son activité qu’il a appris auprès de sa sœur.
Afin de renforcer son activité, il décide de collaborer  avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). La majorité de ses clients sont les femmes.
Avec ce prêt, Adama compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 37 500 FCFA.
Il  ambitionne de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama Niaré is a married man who is 28 years old and father to two children. He lives with his wife and children in the Dialanicoro district of Bougouni. After attending Koranic school, Mr. Niaré started up his income generating activities. He sold cereals for four years at the market in Bougouni and in surrounding villages on weekly fair days. However, this activity did not bear any fruit and he thus decided to buy and sell condiments at the large market in Bougouni. With six years of experience, Mr. Niaré now masters this activity which he learned from his sister. In order to strengthen his business he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy a large quantity of condiments. He gets his supplies at Bougouni and in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). The majority of his customers are women. With this loan, Adama is expecting to make a monthly profit of 37,500FCFA a month. His ambition is to build a house to live in.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 32 years old and blessed with a three-year-old child.  Her husband works in a hotel while she runs a salon.  She has had her business for six months and hopes to expand it. 

Juliana belongs to the group called Transparency within Faulu Kenya, whose members are business people; some, like her, run salons.  Being a member of the group, she is able to save her money and she can be guaranteed a loan by the other members.  She is asking for a loan of KES 40,000 to buy beauty products and a hair drier.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and a hair drier

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Five years ago she got the idea to start raising cattle in order to contribute to the family finances. She took advantage of the space she had available on her family’s land to start this business, which she runs together with her husband. Slowly her number of cows has increased, and her clients have started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps, and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Gulnora invites you to be an important part of the growth of her business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history.  It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and fodder to expand the business

loans.name: Saibou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Saibou Touré est un homme marié de 37 ans et père d’un enfant. Il vit avec sa famille et son enfant dans le quartier Niebala de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fait l’école moderne, très jeune il commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des motos à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et cela sans succès.  Quelques années après il revient auprès de son oncle à Bougouni pour apprendre l’achat et la vente des pièces détachées.
Avec une expérience de  6 années, il maîtrise bien son activité.
Pour améliorer son commerce Monsieur Saibou Touré décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, des pièces détachées à Bamako.
Il est à son troisième prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont  été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Saibou Touré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 750 FCFA.
Il envisage avec ce bénéfice construire une maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Saibou Touré is a 37-year-old married man and the father of one child. He lives with his family and child in the Niebala district of Bougouni. Not having gone to a modern school, he started at a young age working in revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of motorbikes in Bamako (capital of Mali), although unsuccessfully. A few years later, he came back to his uncle in Bougouni to learn about buying and selling spare parts. With six years of experience, he has a good command of his business. To improve his business, Saibou decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to buy spare parts in Bamako. He is on his third individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. All of the preceding loans have been properly repaid. With this loan, he plans on making a monthly profit of 35,750 francs CFA. He envisions building a house with the profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying spare parts

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou S. est un homme marié de 36 ans et sans enfant qui  vit avec sa femme dans le  quartier Hérémakono  Nord de Bougouni.
Suite à la pauvreté de ses parents, il décida d’abandonner l’école et commença les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son oncle pour apprendre la vente  d’articles divers de boutique.
Avec une expérience de plus 6 ans, Monsieur Seydou S. maitrise son activité et est très sollicité.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, une importante quantité d’ articles divers pour sa boutique.
Il est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et effectue sa vente à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 38 500 FCFA Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou S. is a married man who is 36 years old and has no children. He lives with his wife in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougouni. As a result of his parents' poverty, he decided to leave school and set up income-generating activities with his uncle in order to learn how to sell various shop items. With more than six years' experience, Mr. S. now masters his business and is very much in demand. In order to satisfy his customer base which is growing sharply, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to buy a significant quantity of miscellaneous items for his shop. He is on his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loan was repaid on time. He gets his supplies in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) and sells to a diverse and varied customer base. With this loan he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 38,500FCFA. With this profit he is planning to expand his shop.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items for his shop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan K. I. is 24 years old. She is single and has one child, aged three years old, whom she hopes to provide with a quality education. Her business is located at a busy market area in Kakamega. She sells second-hand clothes to the local people. She says that this business is profitable, and the only major challenge she has is that her debtors fail to keep the promise to pay their debts as per their agreements, therefore bringing down her sales. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 30,000 to buy more clothes to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to open a boutique to sell more and make more income. She describes herself as hardworking, humble and honest.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
K. Ahmad has spent several years in the agriculture business growing potatoes and wheat on his land. He also raises cattle. It is important to stress that he is a man whose responsibility is to provide for his family by giving them all that is necessary for their development.  He has a friendly family who are always trying to help each other. 

Today Ahmad needs a loan to obtain technological assistance for his crops. With part of the loan he will also purchase cattle to increase his number of animals. He awaits the approval of this loan confidently, knowing that it will be of enormous use to his business, and that his family will benefit greatly.  The loan will improve Ahmad’s income and his family's living standards, for which he offers a sincere thank-you!    

Ahmad’s wife appears in the photo.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history.  It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 30 years old and a single mother of one.  She runs a green grocer for a living.  She started this business ten years ago and wants to expand it so as to generate more profits.  Faith also does dairy farming together with her group members in Githunguri Wisdom group, part of Faulu Kenya.  She supplies milk to Fresh Milk processing company, a well-known milk processing plant in Kenya.  As a single mother, she has to work hard to provide for her child.  She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shahar

texts.en:
Shahar sells fabrics for sewing national dresses.  She started her business 12 years ago. Her husband works as a teacher. His wages are small, and Shahar wanted to give her children abetter quality of life. Thanks to her efforts the business has gone very well. Now Shahar is requesting a loan of 9,000 Somoni. She will use the money to buy more merchandise, since her sales are increasing and she wants to have inventory in stock for all of her clients. With your contribution Shahar will move ahead.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history.  It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For plowing the field, hoeing and the purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano” se formó con la unión varias amigas y se encuentran trabajando con mucha esperanza y metas de cada una. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Una de ellas es la señora Nilda quien se encuentra realizando varias actividades dentro del Comité con la ayuda de sus compañeros.
