She hopes to earn 100,000 FCFA each month, which will allow her to take care of her family, especially since she is widowed, and to repay her loan to Soro Yiriwaso. She aspires to continue her business, and if possible, to open a store.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy millet

loans.name: Nana M’Barka

texts.fr:
Madame  Nana M’barka H.   est âgée de 54 ans, mariée  et mère  de 6 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari  dans une grande famille traditionnelle au 1er  quartier de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 9 ème année fondamentale (système scolaire Malien) pour  se marier, elle a commencé le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des salons marocains. Ayant passé plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de cette dernière, elle mena plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus telles que la vente de jus de fruits et finit par embrasser le commerce de moquettes, qu’elle mène depuis 3 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses articles qui sont souvent des importations mais également à son prix abordable.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 8 moquettes. Elle s’approvisionne à Tombouctou.
Madame Nana M’barka H.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet de participer à des événements sociaux (baptême, mariage etc.…) et de se prendre en charge. 
Son ambition est de promouvoir son commerce et d’aller en avant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nana M’barka H. is 54 years old, married and mother of 6 children. She lives with her husband in a large traditional family in the first district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having abandoned school in the 9th primary grade (Malian education system) to get married, she started business beside her mother who sold Moroccan living rooms. After spending several years in apprenticeship at her side, she ran several income-generating businesses such as the sale of fruit juices. She wound up taking up the trade of carpets that she has been engaged in for 3 years and enjoys a large customer base. The strength of her sales is due to the quality of her products that are often imported but also to her affordable prices. With the objective of increasing the size of her business to make more profits, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. This is her first individual loan that she intends to use to purchase 8 carpets. She gets her supplies in Tombouctou. Mrs. Nana M’barka H. sells cash and on credit to a customer base of women and men. With this loan, she plans to make a monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs. This profit will enable her to take part in the funding of social events (christenings, weddings etc.…) and support herself. Her ambition is to promote her business and go forward.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase carpets

loans.name: Alain

texts.fr:
jeune homme de 32 ans ,celibataire ayant a sa charge un enfant age de 2 ans exerce le commerce de la vente des tissus depuis 2005 , en general il vend des tissus et metrages qu'il achete chez les grossistes qui vont acheter en Chine.Ce commerce lui permet de prendre soin de son fils et differentes charges de sa famille.

Avec ce pret il compte acheter  un grand stock des coupons de tissus en soie et lin de qualite et a la mode pour satifaire les desirs des ses clients.  Tres entreprenant il s'efforce malges les difficultes et la cherte  des tissus et l'instabilite des prix pour trouver les meilleurs marches des tissus pour combler les besoins de ses clients.
A l'avenir il aimerait etre un grossiste aller lui meme en chine acheter pour faire la livraison en gros dans les boutiques et marches de la place.
Il a des grandes ambitions pour on enfant lui faire faire des longues etudes , construire une maison se marier et fonder une grande famille
texts.en:
This is a young unmarried man, aged 32, who has a 2-year-old child to support.  He has had a business selling fabrics since 2005.  In general, he sells cloth and yardage, which he buys from wholesalers who go to China to make their purchases.  This business enables him to take care of his son and to cover different family expenses.  With this loan, he plans to buy a large inventory of cuts of quality silk and linen that are in style in order to satisfy the desires of his customers. A very enterprising man, he exerts himself despite the difficulties, the high cost of fabrics, and the unstable prices. He does so in order to find the best markets for fabrics and to meet the needs of his customer base.   In the future, he would really like to be a wholesale merchant and go to China himself to buy goods in order to make wholesale deliveries to local stores and markets.  He has great ambitions for his child to advance far in school and for starting a large family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics and yardage

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Proveedor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jehová es mi Proveedor está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Ángela del Carmen Maltés Gutiérrez, coordinadora del grupo. Ella se dedica al comercio de mercadería en general de seis años.

Sus compañeras Reyna Isabel R. Aguilera es propietaria de una pulpería  y Adela Francisca V. García tiene una zapatería. Ellas invertirán el préstamo en sus negocios con la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, carne, verduras, plásticos, ropa, pega, cuero etc.
texts.en:
The Jehová es mi Proveedor group is comprised of three hard-working people. One of them is Ángela del Carmen Maltés Gutiérrez, the coordinator of the group. She has been selling general merchandise for six years. Reyna Isabel R. Aguilera is one of her colleagues. She has a mini market. Her other colleague, Francisca V. García, has a shoe shop. They will use the loan to invest in their businesses. They will buy raw materials like basic grains, meat, vegetables, plastic products, clothes, glue, and leather, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General merchandise like clothes and cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Martha Esi

texts.en:
Martha Esi M. sells corn dough in Abura. To prepare the corn dough, she soaks the corn in water overnight, grinds it in the mill, and leaves it for some hours before she begins to sell it in small quantities to her customers. She is married to a photographer. Martha Esi has received junior high education. She uses her income to help her husband take care of themselves. 

Martha Esi will add this loan to her own capital to purchase bags of maize to prepare corn dough for sale. With the new income that she is going to get as a result of the loan, she plans to build a storehouse for her bags of maize.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize to prepare corn dough for sale

loans.name: Rukiizi Abagambakamu Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
In the deep village of Rukiizi, Kyenjojo, exists a hardworking, customer-friendly, and determined gentleman who goes by the name of B. George. He has been running a produce-selling business now for close to three years.

The happily married father of ten children maneuvered through tough times before getting to where he is now. In a week, he makes 50,000 shillings and his dream is to put up his own maize mill in his village.

This loan will help George to purchase more crops he trades in like rice, maize, beans and peas.

loans.use: To purchase more crops to sell like rice, maize, beans and peas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell fabric

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es: Ángel Maria tiene 52 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de taller de bicicleta. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio pues siempre ha demostrado ser una persona capaz de salir adelante y pues siempre le ha gustado ser un padre responsable con sus hijos. Anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa pero al quedar lisiado por la guerra no pudo seguir trabajando con el tiempo y con sus ahorros logro establecer su propio negocio. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como pedales, asientos, cadenas, aceite entre otras cosas. Sueña con establecer un taller mas amplio y completo.
texts.en:
Angel Maria is 52 years old. He repairs bicycles for a living, and he’s been doing it for more than five years. He’s always been the kind of person to succeed, and he does his best to be a good father to his children. Angel used to work for a company, but he was injured in the war, and had to resign. With time and his savings, he was able to open his own business. Angel has asked for a loan so that he can buy some basic materials: pedals, seats, chains, oil, etc. He hopes to one day have a very well-stocked and complete workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yesu Mma Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Kente cloth is a famous richly woven traditional fabric of single or multiple colors, usually worn during special occasions like festivals, parties, outdoor activities and other social gatherings. Selling kente cloth is a lucrative business for many people like James. James describes himself as a nice person. He is 48 years old and he is the leader of the “Yesu Mma” (translated as, 'Children of Jesus') borrower group. He has operated his kente business for the past 8 years. James is excited to be taking out this loan, with which he plans to purchase kente cloth in bulk. He also operates a little grocery store to generate additional income for his family. He dreams of owning a shop to showcase his kente cloth.

James is married to a woman who is also a trader in fresh yams and they have three children from age 6-15 years. The other members of the group also sell kente cloth.  They plan to invest the loan to purchase stock in bulk to grow their businesses. James hopes to put aside more savings to be able to provide university education for his children.

loans.use: To purchase kente cloth in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay three months in advance on her rent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply her store with food products

loans.name: Rabiatu

texts.en: Rabiatu I. is married. She sells fresh eggs in small quantities and in crates in Abura by moving from one locality to the next. She has been through senior high school. Rabiatu uses her income to take care of herself. She will use this loan to purchase more eggs and salt to sell (which is going to expand her business). Rabiatu plans to reinvest the profit from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs and salt to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling food items, school supplies, and traditional cloth

loans.name: G.s Piedra Viva Group

texts.es: La señora Maria del Carmen tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, los cuales todos son mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo.  Otro integrante de este grupo es don Néstor Javier tiene 40 años de edad, El señor obtiene ingresos de la venta de frutas, las cuales vende en el mercado oriental. El señor solicito este crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en la compra de cosecha de naranjas y aguacates, que es lo que se está vendiendo mas ahora .El último integrante de este grupo es don Javier, tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y tiene una hija de seis meses de edad. El señor se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas, las cuales vende en el mercado desde hace 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad pues juntos se han unido para fortalecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is 62, married and has 5 children, all of whom are grown. She sells pig meat. Another group member is Nestor Javier, age 40. He makes his living from selling fruits, which he sells in the eastern market. He is requesting this loan with the intention of investing it in the purchase of a crop of oranges and avocados, which is what he sells the most at the moment. The final member of the group is Javier, 25, who is married and has a 6-month-old daughter. He buys and sells crops in the market. He has done this for 14 years. They joined together to strengthen their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working cpaital

loans.name: Sata

texts.en:
Sata M. cooks rice and tomato sauce to sell in Abura. She sometimes uses horse mackerel or red fish for her tomato sauce. She has been cooking this food for quite some time now. 

Sata is a single parent who has three children. She has been through junior high school. Sata uses her earnings to educate her children. She will use this loan to purchase more fresh rice and ingredients to cook for sale. Sata plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to buy an oven so she can start baking as well.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh rice and ingredients to cook for sale

loans.name: Los Girasoles De Rumichaca Baja Group

texts.es:
Nos dirigimos a la ciudad  D. Urubamba a visitar el banco comunal “Los girasoles D. Rumichaca D. Baja”  que se encuentra a una hora y diez minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco pero las reuniones D. los socios son en la comunidad D. Rumichaca que se encuentra a 10 minutos D. la ciudad D. Urubamba. La ciudad D. Urubamba se caracteriza por formar parte del valle Sagrado D. los Incas y está D. camino a las ciudadelas Incas D. Ollantaytambo y Machucpichu (Octava maravI. del Mundo).
 
Las actividades económicas principal D. los pobladores D. Rumichaca es la artesanía, agricultura, ganadería y el turismo.  El banco comunal D. “Rumichaca  Baja” está conformado por 20 mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La mayoría D. las socias decidieron abrir sus propios negocio económicos como: venta D. comida, crianza D. animales menores, venta D. jora y chicha, venta D. verduras, venta D. poroto, venta D. maíz y venta D. comestibles.

En la reunión escogimos al azar a una socia del banco comunal que fue la señora Visitación que muy amablemente nos atendió. La socia tiene 42 años, es casada, es natural D. Urubamba, tiene seis hijos (Rosemary D. 22 años, Carla D. 20 años, Cynthia 15 años, María D. 9 años, Gisela 6 años y Fabricio D. 3 años). La socia se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos, cuyes, gallinas y también se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura. Visitación venD. sus productos  agrícolas en el mercado ferial D. Urubamba los días miércoles. Su actividad económica complementaria es vender chicha D. jora los días lunes y jueves. Ya son 10 años que pertenece al banco comunal y le ha ido muy bien. La socia requiere el préstamo para su agricultura y ganadería. Una parte es para comprar abono y semI. y la otra parte es para la alimentación D. sus animales.
texts.en:
We went to the city of Urubamba to visit the "Los girasoles D. Rumichaca D. Baja" ("the Sunflowers of Rumichaca D. Baja") group. Urubamba is an hour and 10 minutes form the city of Cusco, but the members meet in the community of Rumichaca, which is 10 minutes from the city of Urubamba. The city of Urubamba is known for being part of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, and is on the way to the Incan citadels of Ollantaytambo and Machupichu (the eighth wonder of the world). The main economic activities of the villagers of Rumichaca incluD. crafts, livestock and tourism. The "Rumichaca Baja" community bank is composed of 20 hard-working and enterprising women. The majority of the members decided to open their own businesses such as: food sales; raising small animals; jora [a corn variety] and chicha [maize liquor] sales; vegetable sales; bean sales; corn sales; and grocery sales. In the meeting, we picked a member at random, and it was Miss Vistacion who answered us very kindly. She is 42, married, and a native of Urubamba. She has six children (Rosemary, 22; Carla, 20; Cynthia, 15; Maria, 9; Gisela, 6; and Fabricio, 3). She raises small animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and chicken, and she is also engaged in livestock and agriculture. Visitacion sells her agricultural products in the Urubamba market on Wednesdays. Her complementary economic activity is selling maize liquor on Mondays and Thursdays. She has belonged to the community bank for 10 years and it has gone very well for her. She needs this loan for her agriculture and livestock. Part is for purchasing fertilizer and seeds, and the other part is for food for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of fertilizer, seeds and animal food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying boards for making and selling furniture

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
43-year-old ever-smiling and jovial B. Adrian has been selling bananas for the last twelve years and he has benefited a great deal from the fact that the foods he sells are liked and bought almost every passing day by the indigenous people in Bwahika, Ibanda. Apart from the lowest common denominators, the foods he sells, such as cassava, potatoes, beans and bananas, are really fancied by hotel (restaurant) owners.

What has gotten Adrian this far is the fact that he has this pleasantly welcoming aura that he has cultivated over the years. A smile at a customer works miracles for a business – that's if you want to borrow a leaf from Adrian's experience. This has helped him build a good rapport with most of his established and prospective clients.

Adrian is married with three children and all of them are in good schools. This is something Adrian is so proud of. He knows it’s incumbent upon him to cater for his children in whatever they need. His family's welfare has also significantly improved due to his business, from which he makes roughly 20,000 shillings a week.

With this loan, Adrian wants to pay for the overhaul of his stall. He wants it enlarged so that he can purchase crops in bulk, well knowing that if he does not sell it all, he can keep some.

loans.use: To pay the costs of refurbishing his stall into a modern one

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa es una amable mujer de 63 años de edad, ella vive con su hija en su casa propia. Hace mas de 5 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, puesto que no tiene responsabilidad sobre, ya son independientes. Es por eso que puede realizar su trabajo con la mayor tranquilidad, es así que durante las mañanas trabaja en las labores del hogar, mientras que en la tarde sale a visitar a amigas, vecinas y familiares para ofrecer sus productos. Su gran carisma le ha dado mucha ventaja en su actividad, ha logrado colocar su producto y sus ventas están en aumento. Es por ello que se siente muy gratificada con su trabajo, por que le ha permitido hacerse conocida y ganar mas amigas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos para tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
Elisa is a kind woman of 63 years. She lives with her daughter in her own home. For over 5 years, she has sold beauty products since she does not have responsibility for children, as they are independent. For this reason she is able to do her work with peace of mind, and during the mornings she does housework, while in the afternoon she goes out to visit friends, neighbours and relatives to offer her products. Her great charisma has given her a strong advantage in her job; she has invested in her products and her sales are increasing. For this reason she is very happy with her work, and it has allowed her to become known and to make more friends. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the requested loan, she will buy a larger quantity of products to have them in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: La señora Melania es madre soltera, y tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando. La señora  se dedica a la venta y destace de cerdo, cabe señalarse este negocio lo empezó desde hace cuatro años, además que todos los viernes elabora nacatamales en su casa de habitación y vende al público en general. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras cerdos debido a que actualmente tiene mucha demanda de este producto. Ella también entrega carnes a las pulperías cercanas, generalmente entrega a crédito y sale a cobrar en la semana. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y mejorar su economía, que permita mejorar también la economía de sus hijos
texts.en:
Melania is a single mother, and she has three children who study. She sells and butchers pork. This business was started four years ago, and in addition every Friday she makes nacatamales [large Nicaraguan tamales] in her home and sells them to the general public. She is requesting this loan with the goal of buying pork, since there is currently a great demand for this product. She also delivers meat to the local grocery stores, normally offered on credit which she collects in the week. Her dream is to expand her business and to improve her economic situation, which will in turn allow her to improve the economic situation of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Food Service

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza M. sells cloths and cosmetics in Abura. She is married to a security man. Adiza has received junior high education. She uses her income to help her spouse take care of the family.

Adiza will use this loan to purchase additional cloths and cosmetics to sell. Adiza plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to build her own shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional cloths and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Ogya Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Nadia describes herself as an honest woman. She is 48 years old and is the leader of the “Ogya” (translated as "Fire") borrower group. Nadia lives in a town near Dormaa and sells a local food called Tuo-za-fi, (tz) for short in the community market. Tz is prepared with sieved maize grains cooked to become semi-solid and eaten with okra and tomato sauce. She has been selling her food for 10 years. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase food ingredients like maize, vegetables and meat. 

Nadia is married to a farmer and together they have seven children from age 13-24 years. Her dreams include expanding her food business and providing better education for her children. As the leader of the borrower group, Nadia ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es: La Sra. M. A. Maria del Pilar vive en camino grande perteneciente al distrito de Tate. Tiene un hijo a su cargo. Es madre soltera y trabaja como operaria de producción en el fundo IQF del Perú desde hace 3 años. La Sra Maria tiene casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Su sueño es poder terminar su casa y así poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La Sra. M. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Munante A. Maria del Pilar lives on Camino Grande in the Tate district. She has a child to care for. She is a single mother and has worked as a production operator in Peru's IQF farm for 3 years. Maria has her own home, and is working on its finishing touches. She is requesting this loan to finish her home in order to be able to offer her child a better quality of life. Her dream is to finish her home and thus offer her family a better quality of life. Munante is grateful for the support that we can offer her through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvements

loans.name: Las Semillitas Group

texts.es:
LAS SEMILLITAS 

Los 9 socios de la Alcancia Comunal LAS SEMILLITAS se reunen mensualmente para cordinar sus pagos, El Sr Juan trabaja en construccion hace 15 años el prestamo recibido lo invertira en la compra de una maquina cortadora de mayolica para realizar sus trabajos con major calidad en los acabados, ademas tiene como objetivo aperturar una ferreteria. El es soltero pero tiene una hija que mantener. Ana tiene una pequeña  bodega hace 8 años, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, a nuestra socia le gustaria ampliar su bodega  para tener mas ingresos y poder afrontar  los gastos que se generan en su hogar.
Los socios desean ampliar sus negocios así que demuestran ganas de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
LAS SEMILLITAS ("The Little Seeds") The 9 members of the Las Semillitas ("The Little Seeds") Community Bank meets monthly to coordinate its payments. Juan has worked in construction for 15 years. He will invest the loan in the purchase of a machine to cut ceramics to do his work with better quality finishes. He also wants to open a hardware store. He is single but he has a daughter to support. Ana has had a small store for 8 years. She is married and has two children. She would like to expand her store in order to have more income and to be able to cover her household costs. The members want to expand their businesses and they demonstrate the desire to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The sale of fried and smoked fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For double-purpose cattle.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr:
Femme de 53 ans marie a un Pasteur ayant 6 enfants; elle a commence le tricotage depuis son jeune age chez les religieuses, tres entreprenante elle avait acquerit trois machines a tricoter il ya de cela plusieurs annees
Avec ce pret elle compte acheter des lots pelotes de fils en gros de differentes couleurs pour tricoter des pulls pour enfant,adultes, des grenouilleres et de la layette. Pour la croissance de son manufacture elle pense faire au moins dix complets de layette par jour soit 60 complets par semaine pour deposer dans les 5 grandes maternites de la capitale, vendus a bon prix pour aider les femmes qui accouchent a avoir de quoi vetir leurs enfants.En plus de cela elle travaille a la reinsertion des jeunes filles meres pour leur apprendre a tricoter et l'aider dans son travail
Elle a des grandes ambitions,ouvrir une ecole de tricotage et grand magasin d'exposition et vente, ne travaillant pas seule,ses enfants aussi l'aident a faire le travail garcons comme les filles sont en oeuvre pour l'elargissement de leur unite de production
texts.en:
This is a 53-year-old woman with six children. She is married to a pasteur. She started knitting with nuns at a young age.  A very enterprising woman, she had acquired three knitting machines several years ago.  With this loan, she plans on buying in bulk some balls of yarn of different colors for knitting sweaters for children and adults, jumpsuits, and items for babies.  For the growth of her production, she is thinking of making at least ten baby outfits each day, thus sixty outfits a week. These products will be placed among the five major maternity facilities in the capital and sold at a good price to help new mothers to clothe their children.  In addition to this, she works at re-adapting very young mothers by teaching them to knit and to help her in her work.  She has great ambitions to open a knitting school and a large store for shows and sales.  Her children also help her with the work.  The boys as well as the girls are at work expanding their production unit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spools of knitting yarn, buttons

loans.name: Aseda Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Daniel describes himself as very hard-working. He is 35 years old and he is the leader of the “Aseda” (translated as "Thanks") borrower group. Daniel is a trader in goats. He purchases live goats from herdsmen and sells them to local food joint operators and restaurants operators at a profit He also sells coconuts. Daniel is excited to be taking out this loan, with which he plans to purchase many live goats to serve his customers. He dreams of expanding his business and providing better education for his children.

Daniel is married to a woman who is also a petty trader and they have four children from age 2-14 years. The other members of the group sell phone credit cards, soap, etc.  He exercises good leadership skills to ensure regular meeting attendance and repayment.

loans.use: To purchase live goats

loans.name: Luis Emilio

texts.es: El señor Luis Emilio, es casado y tiene dos hijos con edades de entre 16 y 18 años de edad. El señor Luis se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, principalmente perfumes, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante. El ya tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual empezó debido a la falta de empleo que tiene el país. El trabaja en compañía de su esposa, es decir ella le ayuda en la distribución de los productos. El señor desea invertir este crédito en la compra de más mercaderías, esto con el objetivo de vender más ahora que se acerca la fecha especial del día de las madres. Un reto que se le acerca al señor es en invierno, ya que las ventas para este periodo bajan considerablemente. El señor tiene el sueño de obtener más ganancias para así ampliar su tramo, el cual está localizado en el mercado.
texts.en:
Luis Emilio is married with two children between 16 and 18 years of age. Luis sells cosmetics, mostly perfumes, which he distributes as a street vendor. He has 20 years of experience in this activity, which he began due to the lack of work in his country. His spouse accompanies him, helping with the distribution of the products. Luis wants to invest this loan in more merchandise with the goal of selling more now that it is close to the special date for Mother’s Day. One challenge for Luis is that sales decrease considerably during the winter. Luis dreams of earning more income in order to expand his stand in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Salifu

texts.en: Salifu H. is into the sale of plastic containers, sauce pans and other things in Abura. She goes from one house to the other in her locality. She is married to a mason and has received senior high education. Salifu uses her income to help her husband take care of the family. Salifu will use this loan to purchase extra shoes, plastics and sauce pans to sell. Salifu plans to reinvest the new profits into her business.

loans.use: To purchase extra shoes, plastics and sauce pans to sell

loans.name: Dalila Judit

texts.es: La solicitante es casada, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando y le ayudan en su pequeño negocio que tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes.El Destino del credito es para compra de mercaderia
texts.en:
The loan applicant is married, and has two children who are studying and who help her with her small business selling groceries from her house. The purpose of this loan is to purchase goods.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Flora

texts.fr: G. Flora est née le 26 novembre 1981 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Flora est mariée à CODJIA Prince un commerçant. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a trois ans environs que la famille vit à Cocotomey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Flora vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Flora a fréquenté l'école jusqu'à l'université. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Flora mène comme activité, la vente de fournitures scolaires et de fournitures de bureau dans sa boutique size à Cocotomey. C'est dans les papeteries de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Flora fait ses provisions. Flora exerce cette activité depuis deux ans. C'est la première fois que Flora sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt en vue de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter son stock de produits, pour mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
G. Flora was born on November 26, 1981 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  She is married to CODJIA Prince, a merchant.  The couple have three children to support.  Two of the children are their own; all of them are in school.  For three years, the family has been living in Cocotomey, in the community of Abomey Calavi.  Flora helps out her husband and ensures that their different family expenses are covered.  She attended school up until the university level.  To meet her different responsibilities, she runs a business selling school supplies and office supplies in her shop in Cocotomey.  She acquires her goods from the paper suppliers of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She has been in this business for two years.  This is the first time that Flora has requested a loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and increasing her stock of products, so that she may respond better to the demands of her customers. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying three boxes of notebooks and more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking up charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cooking and selling rice, beans and other dishes

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena  tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad y trabajan, además que es soltera. La señora  Maria tiene un negocio de venta de ropa variada en un tramo localizado en el mercado, en el cual además vende ropa interior tanto de varón como de mujer. Ella empezó este negocio desde hace 35 años debido a la necesidad de tener un ingreso para mantener a su familia. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar varias compras de mercaderías de ropa interior, ya que es lo que está vendiendo más y desea aprovechar las ventas de mayo. Cabe señalarse su sueño es mantener su negocio con estos y otros productos y ampliar su negocio con otros productos como venta de CD, manzanas y uvas.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Elena is single and she has four grown-up children who work. She has a business selling assorted clothing from a stall in the market, where she also sells underwear for both men and women. She started this business 35 years ago because she needed an income in order to look after her family. Señora Maria Elena wants this loan to buy various items of underwear as that is what sells best, and she wants to make the most of the May sales. Her dream is to continue running her business and expand to sell other goods such as CDs, apples and grapes.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for working capital

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila tiene 53 años de edad, casada y comparte su vida con su pareja que tiene ya un hijo de primer compromiso, ambos tienen un hijo y juntos viven en su casa propia. Ella se dedica desde hace ya varios años, en la venta de pan, el cual compra al por mayor para posteriormente venderlo por unidad en la zona en la que vive. Desde entonces, se levanta muy temprano, a las 4 de la mañana para adquirir pan suficiente y luego venderlos de manera minoritaria. Este trabajo le es ventajo, puesto que no se hay una panadería cerca y muchos no pueden ir tan lejos para conseguir este alimento. Ella se siente contenta y tranquila ya que gracias a su trabajo se mantiene ocupada y puede brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. En un futuro le gustaría poner un negocio más fijo, puesto que sabe que la zona en la que vive es de difícil acceso. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito, comprará mayor cantidad de panes para así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lucila is 53 years old, married, and lives with her partner who has a child from his first marriage. They both have a son and live in their own home. For many years now she has been selling bread. She buys it wholesale to later sell it individually in the area where she lives.To date, she wakes up at four in the morning to get enough bread to resell. This job is profitable since there are no other bakeries nearby and many customers are not able to go very far to buy this product. She feels happy and relieved for having her job because it keeps her busy and she can offer her family a good quality of life. In the future she would like to put up a business that is more stable, since she knows that the area in which she lives is not easily accessible. This is her eighth loan with MFP and has always characterized herself as being punctual with her payments. With the loan, she will buy a larger quantity to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more bread to resell.

loans.name: Pablo De La Cruz

texts.es:
Pablo de la Cruz, tiene 30 años de edad, reside en El Municipio de Corinto, del Departamento de Morazán, Vive con sus dos hijos de 2 y 8 años de edad y su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y frijoles.
El Aprendió a cultivar granos básicos gracias a su padre quien le enseño, y se ha dedicado durante 15 años durante un horario de 6: 00 am a 1: 00 pm a la cultivar maíz y frijoles, actualmente dos terrenos de maíz juntos con otras dos personas que le colaboran. 
Pablo necesita un préstamo para la compra del abono para su cultivo de maíz, con este abono el obtendrá una mejor cosecha, la cual le ayudara a solventar los gastos familiares, compromisos  Y contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Sus aspiraciones son obtener una buena cosecha, que la época de lluvia sea favorable para su cultivo, de esta forma el podrá vender una parte de la cosecha y la otra dejarla para el consumo de su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo de la Cruz is 30 years old. He lives in Corinto, in the department of Morazán, with his two children (aged 2 and 8 years old) and life-long female partner. He grows corn and beans (frijoles). He learned how to grow basic grain crops from his father and has been working in agriculture for the past 15 years. He works from 6am to 1pm. At present, he and two colleagues are cultivating two plots of corn. Pablo needs a loan to buy fertiliser, so as to produce a higher yield. This in turn will help him cover his family costs and needs, and provide a better quality of life for his family overall. He hopes he will have a better harvest and that the rainy season will be favourable to his crops, so that he can sell some of his produce and keep the remainder for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertiliser for his corn crops

loans.name: Louise Akouavi

texts.fr: H. Louise Akouavi est née le 25 Août 1971 et est mariée à HOUESSOUVO Charles. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux représentent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a près de sept ans que la famille s'est installée au quartier Atropocodji dans la commune d'Abomey calavi. Louise et son mari s'occupent ensemble des diverses charges familiales. Louise n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses multiples besoins et assurer un bon train de vie à ses enfants, Louise vend divers produits (choux, concombres, laitues, condiments de sauces, etc.) dans son quartier. Louise s'approvisionne dans les marchés de Cotonou et auprès des jardiniers. C'est la première fois que Louise sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Louise Akouavi H. was born August 25, 1971 and is married to Charles HOUESSOUVO. The couple has three dependent children, two of whom are their own. All three children go to school. The family settled down in the neighborhood of Atropocodji in the Abomey-Calavi commune almost seven years ago. Together, Louise and her husband handle the various family obligations. Louise never went to school. In order to meet her family’s numerous needs and provide a good lifestyle for her children, Louise sells a variety of products (cabbage, cucumbers, lettuce, sauce condiments, etc.) around her neighborhood. She gets her stocks in the Cotonou markets and from gardeners. Louise is seeking her first loan with ALIDé to boost her activities and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various vegetables (carrots, cucumbers, cabbage, lettuce, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María de 48 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (la originalidad de este lugar fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Ella vende waype (en la foto aparecen los retazos con que utiliza para hacer los waype) a las ferreterías (almacén de repuestos, construcción y remodelación de casas) de Guayaquil. 

Antes de comenzar a vender waype, trabajaba en una textilera pero como tenia la frustrante idea de tener su propio negocio ella invirtió sus ahorros comprando retazos y convirtiéndolos en waype. Cada libra de waype los vende a $ 1.80.

Para tener mas producción ella quiere comprar mas retazos de ropa con el préstamo.  En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María, 48, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (started out as a field where many orchids grew), Guayaquil. She sells waype (rags) to hardware stores, replacement parts shops, construction sites and for home remodeling. (In the photo you can see the remnants she uses to make the waypes). Prior to selling waype, she worked as a textile worker but she was frustrated by the desire to have her own business. She used her savings to buy remnants and turned them into waype. Each pound of waype sells for $1.80. In order to increase production she wants to buy more fabric remnants with the loan. In the future, she’s like to finish building her house and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric remnants.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama I. sells maize and prepares kenkey and fish with hot pepper sauce in Abura. She has someone helping her sell her kenkey while she is away selling her maize. She has been in this trade for some time now. Mariama has not received any formal education. Her husband is a security man for a company. Her loan will be used to buy additional corn to prepare kenkey to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business. She also wants to establish a kenkey shop.

loans.use: To buy additional corn to prepare kenkey

loans.name: Abodee Foforo Borrower Group

texts.en:
Augustina describes herself as a lovely woman. She is 56 years old. She is the leader of the “Abodee Foforo” (translated as "New Creation") borrower group. She lives in a town near Sunyani and sells smoked fish in the community market. She has been running her fish business for 10 years. Fish is widely used in cooking as one the most common sources of protein in our diet. It is mostly used in the preparation of soup and sauces. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase cartons of smoked fish to serve her customers. She also sells groceries.

Augustina is married to a pastor and together they have three children from age 14-20 years. She dreams of expanding her fish business to be able to provide university education for her children. The other members sell foodstuffs. As the leader of the borrower group, Augustina ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Eveling Carolina

texts.es: Eveling Carolina tiene 28 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene esta actividad, pues inicio como una opción porque no tenía un trabajo y no ganaba un salario que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de su hogar, también tiene 1 hijo menor de edad que mantener, por lo que las compras de sus productos tiene que hacerlos en los departamentos es aquí los comprar a un precio más accesible. Con el financiamiento comprara pinturas de labios, polvos, pinturas de uñas y perfumes. Sueña con mejorar su actividad económica y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Eveling Carolina is 28 years old. Her business is selling cosmetics. She has had her business for more than 3 years. It began as an option since she was out of work and not earning a wage that could defray her household expenses. She also has 1 dependent child to support, so she has to make her sales in people's apartments. This does allow her clients to make their purchases at more affordable prices. With the loan, she will buy lipsticks, face powders, nail polish and perfumes. She hopes to improve her business and to keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria J.  es una señora   de 40  años de edad la cual vive con sus 4 hijos  en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Desde hace varios  años María  se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos.  Dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su hijos le motiva a  seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el negocio le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.
 Actualmente María  está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢641.000 (seiscientos cuarenta y un  mil colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades; además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.

María es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera poder  crear su propia Granja.
texts.en:
María Jiménez is a 40 year old woman who lives with her four children. They live in a community called Hernández, which is in Los Chiles in the Aljuela province. This is a community that is known for its mountainous areas and beautiful countryside; it is quite humid and is located along the highway that runs very close to the country’s northern border. Its main commercial activities are livestock production and farming, specifically basic grains, tubers, and oranges. For several years María has been raising chickens to fatten. She also raises laying hens for their meat and eggs. She sells her products to her neighbors in her community, and they are very satisfied. She says that having her children’s support motivates her to continue with the plan. She also says that her business is very interesting to her. This is because she has seen how, little by little, her business grows and the demand is stronger every time. María is currently requesting a small loan for ¢641,000 (six hundred forty one thousand colones) to buy more chickens and hens, concentrates, and products to treat illnesses. She will also expand and strengthen her location. She hopes that by doing this her business will grow more and she will improve her quality of life. Her business is going well, but due to the lack of money she has not been able to make it grow. She will use the loan she is requesting to increase her sales and to improve her family’s economic condition. María is a member of the “Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo” (Communal Credit Company for Development) communal bank, one of a hundred EDESA affiliates in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she plans to use it to be able to make her own farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hens and repair the corral

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es: Ana Del Socorro tiene 31 años, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Pues tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, que lo inicio con el motivo de generar ingresos, esa una mujer luchadora pues se levanta muy temprano desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche que llega a su vivienda, para realizar las visitas a su clientes, siempre está pendiente de lo que ellos le solicitan por encargo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima. Desea llegar a tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Ana Del Socorro is 31 years old. She sells general merchandise. She has been working in this business for 5 years. She started in order to generate more income. She is a fighter who gets up very early at 5 in the morning to visit her customers, and arrives home at 7 at night. She is always on top of what they ask her to get for them. The loan she is asking for is to purchase raw materials. She wants to have her own store one day.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase five cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cattle to fatten up

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati A. goes around her neighborhood in Abura selling children’s wear. She is married to a carpenter and has a child. She has no formal education. Fati uses her income to help her husband take care of their only son. This loan will enable her to purchase bales of children's wear to sell. Fati plans to reinvest her new profits into her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of children's wear to sell

loans.name: Margarita Del Scorro

texts.es: Margarita del Socorro tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y que disfruta de su actividad como es la venta de mercadería en general. Sus inicios se dan hace mas de 8 años pues cuando inicio era solamente con pocos productos como pantalones y camisetas, con el paso del tiempo fue que adquirió más ganancias y decide aumentar su capital. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de faldas, vestidos, camisetas, perfumes y calzado. Desea establecerse en un lugar que sea propio.
texts.en:
Margarita del Socorro is 41 years old, and a very hard-working woman who also enjoys her avocation as it is the sale of merchandise in general. Her start was more than 8 years ago - when she started it was only with few products, like pants and t-shirts, over thime it was he she acquired more profits and decides to increase her capital. The loan that she requests is for the purchase of skirts, dresses, t-shirts, perfumes and footwear. She wishes to establish herself in a place all her own.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty H. is married to a man who sells secondhand car parts. She has junior high school education. Gifty travels to buy sacks of groundnuts (peanuts), beans and onions for sale in Abura to those who need small or large quantities. She has been doing this for three years now. Gifty will use this loan to purchase more groundnuts and onions. Gifty plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to buy a storehouse for her goods.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnuts and onions

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 51 años, comparte su vida con su esposo Pedro y su hija Carmín de 14 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 5 años se ha dedicado al trabajo de tejido y venta de prendas de vestir, como: chompas, chalinas, guantes, gorros. Este oficio lo aprendió de su madre, que desde muy joven le enseñó las técnicas de esta actividad, ahora sola puede desenvolverse, además que puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es así que todo el día se dispone a realizar sus tejidos, mientras que su hija la ayuda, aprovechando que también esta aprendiendo este trabajo. Margarita se siente contenta porque tiene muchos pedidos, es por ello que mas adelante desea mejorar su negocio, para poder brindarle a su hija una buena calidad de vida. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de lana de colores, agujas, cierres, de esa manera podrá confeccionar todo los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Margarita is 51 years old. She shares her life with her husband Pedro and daughter Carmín, who is 14 years old. They all live in their own house. More than five years ago, Margarita started her business of weaving and selling garments such as jumpers, scarves, gloves and hats. She learnt this profession from her mother, who started teaching her the techniques of the work when she was very young. Now she is able to manage on her own and even covers her household costs. She spends all day weaving, helped by her daughter whom she is taking the opportunity to teach. Margarita is happy because she is receiving a lot of orders, which is why in the future she would like to improve her business so that she is able to give her daughter a good quality of life. This is her eighth loan with MFP and she has proven to be punctual with all her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy more coloured wool, needles, and fasteners. This will enable her to finish all her outstanding orders.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, needles and fasteners for making woven garments.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Rodeada por un hermoso valle y cubierta por tamarindos, es la Ciudad de Portoviejo, donde vive  La señora María  Fernández, quien se dedica al comercio de semi joyas brasileras,  lleva 4 años con este negocio, está comprometida desde hace 13 años y tiene 3 hijos, su casa esta ubica por el Puente el Salto, en la capital manabita,  ella compra en efectivo las joyas y  le queda de  ganancia  el 50 %, las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Portoviejo en un distribuidor, ella busco su negocio le gusto y se quedo con él, por las ganancias y beneficios que le deja.

Nuestra socia comenzó con 50 dólares de capital, su forma de vender es recorrer la ciudad y entregar a sus amigas las joyas  dejándoseles a 2 cuotas para que ellas puedan pagar.

 Su esposo es guardián de una empresa en Portoviejo, ella es de la capital manabita y el de manta. El dinero que solicita es para invertir en su negocio de joyas tales como aretes, gargantillas y anillos; la señora María dice que pensó  invertir en ropa pero es más caro y que no le resulta mucho, las joyas se están vendiendo mas, sobre todo la marca brasilera Gale.

Su sueño es llegar a tener su negocio en un local, para así no tener que salir a recorrer la ciudad.
texts.en:
The city of Portoviejo, surrounded by a beautiful valley and covered with tamarind trees, is where Ms. Maria F. lives. For the past four years, she has been working in the sale of semi-Brazilian jewelry. She has been married for over 13 years and has 3 children. Her home is located by el Puente el Salto, in the Manabita capital. She purchases with cash the jewelry and makes a 50% profit. She buys the jewelry in the city of Portoviejo from a distributor. She enjoys her business and wants to continue it because of the earnings and the benefits. Our member began with $50 in capital. Her method of selling her products is by traveling throughout the city and offering them to her friends but allowing them to pay in 2 payments. Her husband is a security guard at a company in Portoviejo. She is from the Manabita capital, while he is from the port city, Manta. She plans to invest this loan in her jewelry business by purchasing earrings, necklaces, and rings. Ms. Maria says that she originally thought of investing it in clothing but it is very expensive and may not produce very much profit. However, the jewelry sells more and better, above all the Brazilian brand, Gale. Her dream is to have her own shop so that she doesn't have to travel around the city.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rings, earrings, necklaces, and bracelets.

loans.name: Jemilatu

texts.en:
Jemilatu I. sells cassava powder, maize powder, fresh groundnuts and beans at the Abura market. Her stock of goods was in her shop at the market at the time of photo, so shown was what she had with her in the house yet to be conveyed to the marketplace. She has been in her line of business for four years now. 

Jemilatu is married and her husband is a plumber. She has received senior high education. Jemilatu helps her husband take care of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more groundnuts and beans to sell. She hopes to reinvest her new earnings into her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs (groundnuts and beans) to sell

loans.name: Jose Ignacio

texts.es: José Ignacio se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción. Pues desde hace mas de 11 años que tiene este negocio, con fondos propios pues tuvo que luchar mucho para iniciar este negocio que ahora es su medio de vida, siempre se levanta temprano para la elaboración de ladrillos, tejas y otros productos que ofrece, el atiende las 24 horas del día pues siempre está pensando en lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de arena, piedrín, palas, cemento entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
José Ignacio sells construction materials. He has been running this business for over 11 years, having fought hard to set it up with his own funds. Now it is his livelihood – he wakes up early everyday to make the bricks, tiles and other products he offers. He is 'on call' 24 hours a day and is always thinking about what his customers need. The finance he is requesting is to buy sand, gravel, shovels, cement, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Untie Ama

texts.en: Untie Ama S. is a single parent who has two children. She has no formal education. Untie Ama sells secondhand clothes for men and women in Abura. She has been selling secondhand clothes for two years now. Untie Ama uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase bales of secondhand clothes to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Untie Ama plans to complete the kitchen she has started building.

loans.use: To purchase bales of secondhand clothes to resell

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr:
Femme commercante de 48 ans,mere de 4 enfants dont l'age varie de 25 ans a 17 ans, elle eleve ses enfants et prend en charge leurs scolarites ,seule depuis plus de 10 ans.
Elle s'est lancee dans la friperie bientot 3 ans, elle s'approvisionne dans les grands depots de la place,et ses recettes varient entre 25000 a 13000f le jour.Des qu'elle va recevoir son pret elle compte acheter Des nouveaux ballots de friperie telle que les ballots de survetements, des pulls..., 
Usant de beaucoup de strategies pour accroitre son activite elle epargne aussi et est tres meticuleuse dans la gestion et sait convaincre les clients pour apprecier ses marchandises.A la longue elle veut elle meme etre grossiste et avec ses revenus construire une maison pour ses enfants et les aider a faire des longues etudes
texts.en:
This female entrepreneur is 48 years old and the mother of four children, from 25 to 17 years of age. For over ten years, she has been raising her children and paying their school fees on her own. It’s been almost three years since she deals in second-hand clothing. She stocks up at the big warehouses locally, and her daily sales add up to anywhere from 25,000 to 130,000 francs. As soon as she receives her loan, she will buy new bundles of second-hand clothing, such as outerwear, pullovers etc. She is using many different strategies to grow her business and also saves her money; she is very careful with managing the business and knows how to work with to get them interested in her wares. Her long-term goal is to become a wholesaler and, with the income obtained, to be able to build a house for her children and to help them continue with their education.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bundles of used clothing [for resale]

loans.name: Edwin Fabián

texts.es:
El señor Edwin Fabián A. se dedica con mayor frecuencia a realizar actividades agropecuarias como la siembra de maíz, ajonjolí y sandias también se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino, ovino, porcino y aviar con los que genera sus ingresos para la mantención de sus familia la que se compone de su esposa y sus tres hijas las que actualmente estudian secundaria. 
Actualmente este  cliente tiene como propósito mejorar los potreros en donde mantiene sus animales, solicito este crédito con el fin de tener a su disposición fertilizantes y los demás insumos para el establecimiento de sandia, con los que pretende pagar sus obligaciones y ayudar a comprar una parte de terreno de la finca, también sueña con poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Edwin Fabián A. has been dedicating increasing amounts of time to farming, including sowing corn, sesame, and watermelon. He also raises cattle, hogs, and poultry. These endeavors generate income to sustain the family, which consists of his wife and three daughters , both of whom attend secondary school. This loan candidate intends to improve the pasture where the animals are kept. He requests the loan to purchase fertilizers and the rest of the supplies to establish a watermelon crop. With the crop, he intends to pay his obligations and come closer to purchasing part of the land of the farm. Edwin also dreams of improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and fungicide

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es:
Ángela I. vive en La Villa Nueva de San Gregorio de Portoviejo, hermoso cantón de la provincia de Manabí, ella es auxiliar de enfermería, en el hospital provincial,  también  distribuye agua, para ella lo importante es trabajar y tener buenos ingresos, su esposo  trabaja de chofer en un transporte escolar, la señora Ángela para tener más ingresos  vende ropa en especial interiores en el hospital a sus compañeras y amigas del trabajo, para surtir su negocio compra en Guayaquil la mercadería y cada vez que tiene pedidos viaja.

La señora Ángela  en el hospital labora 6 horas diarias, el resto del tiempo lo dedica a sus otros negocios, Ángela deja a crédito a sus clientes.

 El crédito lo va a invertir en  mercadería, también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon, es distribuidora en Manabí, la empresa le envía desde Quito y ella lo distribuye  a los clientes.

El sueño de doña Ángela es que todos sus hijos trabajen y que no les falte nada, tiene 52 años de edad y de casada 29 años, tiene  tres hijos y su casa es propia.
texts.en:
Angela I. lives in La Villa Nueva de San Gregorio de Portoviejo, a beautiful county in the province of Manabi. She is a nursing assistant in a provincial hospital and also distributes water. For her, the most important thing is to work and make a good living. Her husband works as a chauffeur in school transportation. In order to earn more money, she sells clothing to her colleagues at the hospital and to her friends at work. To supply her business, she buys merchandise from Guayaquil and every time she has an order, she must travel to pick it up. In the hospital, Ms. Angela works six hours daily. The rest of the time she works at her other businesses. She also gives credit to her customers. She plans to invest her loan in merchandise and also to the sale of Avon products because she is a distributor in Manabi. The company sends her the products from Quito and she distributes them to the clients. Ms. Angela's dream is that all of her children work and never lack anything. She is 52 years old and has been married for 29 years. She has three children and her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blouses, pants, pyjamas, and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing women's handbags and shoes for resale

loans.name: Yeinis Ileana

texts.es: A sus 24 años de edad la señora Yeinis Ileana P. se dedica a realizar actividades comerciales como la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y otros productos, con los que ha logrado realizar la mantención de su familia compuesta por un pequeño de tres añitos de edad, su esposo quien realiza trabajos agropecuarios como la crianza de ganado y producción de granos básicos los que son un eslabón en su alimentación de su familia y también proveedores de ingresos para poder ir aumentando su negocio con el que han logrado construir su casa y comprar parte de su ganado, esta cliente al igual que su esposo sueñan con tener un mejor negocio con mas mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes, también desean aumentar mas su hato ganadero al igual que su terreno para la mantención de estos, solicitaron este crédito para realizar una inversión de mercadería en este negocio.
texts.en:
At her 24 years of age, Yeinis Ileana P. devotes herself to commercial activities like selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and other products. Through these activities she supports her family, which is comprised of her small three year old son and her husband. Her husband does agricultural work like raising livestock and growing basic grains. These activities not only feed her family, but they also provide income to be able to expand her business. Through the business they have built their house, and it has paid for some of their livestock. This client, along with her husband, dreams of having a better business with more merchandise to offer her customers. They also want to increase the livestock that they have. They want to get more land to maintain the livestock. They are asking for this loan to invest in more merchandise for this business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like clothes, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Salome Monserrate

texts.es:
En un hermoso valle, lleno de tamarindos, se encuentra la capital de los manabitas, Portoviejo, una ciudad hermosa, habitada por gente muy sencilla y solidaria, gente trabajadora y forjadora de sueños, como  Salome.

 Ella se dedica a vender productos farmacéuticos en la ciudad de Portoviejo, como Alcohol, crema belladona, merthiolate entre otros, trabaja junto al esposo, él se encarga de hacer la entrega a farmacias, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y trabaja sobre pedidos, tiene un vehículo que le es de vital importancia a la hora de hacer las entregas de los productos, en lo que concierne a inversión según lo que se va vendiendo va pidiendo a los laboratorios  o a  la casa comercial con la cual trabajan, por ahora se le ha agotado el stock y con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en surtir de nuevo su negocio, son 10 años ya  y según nos cuenta le va muy bien que no ha pensado en cambiarlo, está casada, su esposo es agente vendedor y también trabaja para un laboratorio, ella visita  las farmacias cada 15 o 30 días, deja a crédito, a pesar que tiene que  compra en efectivo todos los productos que necesita.

Sueña con hacer arreglos a su casa, es propia y por eso quiere hacerle mejoras que no vendrían nada mal afirma, también le gustaría viajar a otros países, conocer otras tierras y culturas.
texts.en:
You will find the capital of Los Manabitas, Portoviejo, in a beautiful valley full of tamarinds. It is a lovely city, which is inhabited by unassuming and supportive people. The people are hard-working and dream builders like Salome. She sells pharmaceutical products in the city of Portoviejo. She sells things like alcohol, belladonna cream, “Merthiolate” (an antiseptic), and other things. She works with her husband. He takes care of making the delivery to pharmacies. She has the business in her house, and she works filling orders. She has a vehicle, which is of vital importance to her when it is time to make delivery of the products. She requests items, according to what is selling, from laboratories or commercial houses that she works with. But now her stock is depleted. With the new loan she will be able to invest in stocking her business again. It has been ten years now. She tells us that it is going very well for her, and she has not thought of changing it. She is married, and her husband is a sales agent. He also works for a laboratory. She goes to the pharmacies every 15 or 30 days. She gives them credit even though she has to buy all of the products she needs for cash. She dreams of fixing up her house. It is her own, and she wants to make improvements so that nothing bad happens. She would also like to travel to other countries to know other lands and cultures.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alcohol, hydrogen peroxide, creams, and antiseptic, etc.

loans.name: Graciela Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Graciela L. tiene 27 años de edad, esta casada desde hace tiempo, tiene dos hijos pequeños y vive con su familia en su casa del Barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de Encarnación.
La señora Graciela es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir desde hace mas de 5 años, además de esta actividad ella junto con su esposo se dedican a la venta de pollos casero, y tienen mucha clientela de la zona de San Pedro y Encarnación. Mediante esta actividad ellos han podido mantener su hogar, educar a sus hijos y salir adelante, así también solventar cualquier gasto del hogar.
Ella hoy día esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mas mercaderías tanto de prendas de vestir como pollos.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela Lopez, 27, has been married for several years. She has two young children and lives with her family in the San Pedro neighborhood of Encarnacion. Sra. Graciela has earned an income selling clothing for 5 years. She and her husband also operate a business selling chicken that they prepare at home and sell to customers in the San Pedro and Encarnacion area. Thanks to this business, they have been able to pay everyday bills, educate their children and do a little better than their parents. Sra. Graciela is applying for a loan so that she can buy clothing for her clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods for resale.

loans.name: Mercy Fosua

texts.en: Mercy Fosua E. sells plastics bags, match sticks, colanders and frying pans in Abura. She has not received any formal education. She is married to a fuel attendant and has a child with him. She helps her husband to take care of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more goods, including saucepans, for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods, including saucepans, for resale

loans.name: Maame Ama

texts.en: Maame Ama N. is a hairdresser by profession at Abura. Maame Ama is single and has received a senior high education. Maame Ama has been a hairdresser for two years. She is responsible for herself in terms of accommodation, feeding and clothing. Her loan will be used to buy more hair products to fill her shop and to meet the demands of her customers. She wishes to use the fresh profits from her business to save to buy an additional hairdryer for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more hair products

loans.name: Fatima Del Consuelo

texts.es:
Fátima, como muchas mujeres trabajadoras está dedicada a su hogar y a su negocio, vive en la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos como se conoce también a Portoviejo, la capital de la provincia de Manabí.

 Ella se dedica al comercio de zapatos y de  carteras,  sale a visitar a las clientas, tiene  7 años dedicándose a este  negocio, está casada y tiene una hija de 21 años, viven en casa propia.

 A nuestra socia le va muy bien trabajando con la Fundación. La mercadería la compra en Guayaquil, también recibe de su prima mercadería pues ella tiene una boutique, la señora Fátima tiene muchas clientas, ella y su prima se ayudan mutuamente, y procura conseguir la mercadería que las clientas le pidan. El esposo trabaja en el Consejo Provincial y su hija estudia medicina en la universidad. Están conscientes que todo lo que hacen es por el bien de su hija, la aman y harían todo por ella  ya que la carrera que eligió genera muchos gastos.

Ver realizada a su hija, en todos los aspectos es el sueño de Fátima, por eso  a ella no le importan los sacrificios que tenga que hacer.
texts.en:
Fátima, like many hard-working women, is dedicated to her home and to her business. She lives in the city of Reales Tamarindos, also known as Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabí province. She sells shoes and purses, going out to visit customers in person, and has been in the business for 7 years. She is married, has a 21-year old daughter, and lives in her own house. Working in partnership with Fundación has gone very well for her. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil, which she also sells in her boutique. Fátima has a good customer base, gets help from a cousin, and procures the merchandise requested by her customers. Her husband works for the Province Council and her daughter is studying medicine at the university. They are conscious that everything they do is for the benefit of their daughter. They love her, and would do everything necessary for her, as the career she has chosen generates a great deal of expenses. Fátima’s dream is to see her daughter become fulfilled in every aspect. For that reason, she doesn’t mind any sacrifices she may have to make to realize this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase purses and shoes.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra V. es una señora de 29 años de edad, vecina de una comunidad rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. 
Con el deseo de mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia ella buscó alternativas diferentes y desde hace poco más de un año inició un negocio exactamente un bazar-librería en su casa, en el cual ofrece: diferentes tipos de papel, artículos para oficina como lapiceros, lápices, cuadernos, goma, además de servicio de fotocopiado entre otras muchas más cosas. Dice que le ha ido muy bien ya que en su comunidad ha tenido mucha aceptación puesto que antes no había un lugar que brindara ese servicio. 
En estos momentos lo que desea doña Sandra  es solicitar un préstamo  por ¢300,000 (trescientos  mil colones) para comprar mercadería para mejorar su inventario. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más  ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida. 
Sandra   es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN) una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  crédito  y con él tiene el deseo de mejorar la calidad de su servicio y en general de su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra V., 29, lives in a rural Costa Rican town called San Cristobal Norte, about 45 kilometers south of San Jose. San Cristobal is a somewhat mountainous area where residents work as merchants, farmers, artisans, ranchers and other jobs. With a strong wish to improve her income and her family's well-being, Sandra has looked at different kinds of businesses that she might operate and a little more than a year ago, she started a business selling office and school supplies. She now sells different kinds of paper and office supplies such as pens, pencils, notebooks, and erasers. She also provides a photocopying service. She says that the business is doing well because those products were not readily available in her town before. Sandra is now applying for a 300,000-colones loan to buy merchandise to improve her inventory. She expects the money to help her micro-business grow and generate more income so that she can improve her way of living. Sandra is a member of the Credito Comunal San Cristobal Norte (SACRIN), one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her second loan and it will allow her to improve the level of service that she provides.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. O. is married and has three children. She has a junior high education.  Grace E. cooks banku with two different kinds of soup such as okro and palmnut soup as well rice for sale at Abura.  Her husband is a chef.  Grace E. uses her income to help her husband to take care of her family.  Grace will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the new revenue from her extended business, Grace E. plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Gustavo Rubén

texts.es:
El señor Gustavo A. tiene 37 años de edad, esta casado desde hace tiempo con la señora Monica Lorena Martinez, tienen 2 hijos pequeños y viven en el Barrio San Roque de la ciudad de Encarnacion.

El señor Gustavo es sastre, tiene su taller de costura desde hace tiempo en su domicilio y tiene mucha clientela de la zona que concurre junto a el ya que realiza trabajos de buena calidad.
 Su esposa es docente, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo y gracias a esto ella también puede aportar ingresos a la unidad familiar.
 El señor Gustavo tiene proyectos de crecer con su microempresa y gracias a eso mejorar cada vez mas su nivel de vida.

El hoy dia esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mas telas e insumos para su trabajo ya que tiene muchos pedidos y quiere abastecer a todos por igual.
texts.en:
Sr. Gustavo A., 37, has been married to Sra. Monica Lorena Martinez for several years. They have 2 young children and live in the San Roque neighborhood of the city of Encarnacion. Sr. Gustavo is a tailor. He has had a workshop in his house for several years and he has many customers in the area who know his work and are happy with the quality of the service he provides. His wife is a long-time teacher, work that allows her to contribute to the family income. Sr. Gustavo plans to grow his micro-business and use the extra income it generates to improve his way of living. He is now applying for a loan so that he can buy cloth and other supplies for his business. He has a lot of orders and wants to stock everything he needs to meet the demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth and supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua S. sells fish, frozen meat and chicken at Abura.  Efua has received a junoir high education.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is a steel bender.
