Efua has been selling fresh and frozen fish and meat for six years. She helpd her husband in taking care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more fish and meat to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish and meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock her shop with merchandise

loans.name: Edel Maria

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí, una hermosa ciudad que se destaca sobre todo por estar rodeada de un valle y encontrar en ella gente muy honrada y trabajadora, los manabitas son muy solidarios y dedicados a sus trabajos, es así como podemos definir también a la señora Edel, una mujer dedicada y esforzada.

 Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa, es comerciante ambulante hace 14 años, para Edel  la mejor  temporada para el negocio es fin de año, deja muchas ingresos aunque también hay que trabajar más, pero es la mejor época y hay que aprovecharla,  vende pantalones, blusas, ropa para hombre y mujeres.

 Edel tiene tres hijos, vive con uno de ellos,su esposo se separo de ella y se fue a vivir a España, ahora ella vela por el bienestar de su hijo y desea que salga adelante, ha sido padre y madre desde que se quedo sola, ella trabaja mucho y lo hace con orgullo, sabe que es por el bien de ella y de su hijo, su forma de trabajar es recorriendo la ciudad y ofreciendo su mercadería por sectores, tiene clientes fijos;  viaja a Guayaquil a comprar la mercadería, por eso está solicitando un crédito para invertir en su negocio, necesita comprar variadas prendas de vestir al igual que zapatos y carteras.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabí, a beautiful city that stands out mostly for the surrounding valley and by its honorable and hard-working people. This is how we can also define Edel, a dedicated woman who puts forth a great effort to succeed. She sells shoes and clothing, and has been a street merchant for 14 years. The best season for Edel’s business is year-end, when she brings in a good income even though she has to work more. However, it is the best season, and one must take advantage of it. She sells pants, blouses, and men and women’s clothing. Edel has three children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband left her, and went to live in Spain. Now, she yearns for the well-being of her son and wants him to get ahead. She has played the role of both mother and father since she has been alone. She works a great deal, and does it with pride, knowing that it’s for her own good as well as her son’s. She carries out her work by traveling the city offering her wares in each sector. She has repeat customers. She travels to Guayaquil to buy merchandise, which is why she is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She needs to buy various types of clothing, as well as shoes and purses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, purses, and shoes.

loans.name: Maria Solanda

texts.es:
María Solanda, vive en Portoviejo, la capital de los manabitas, una ciudad prospera y hermosa, llena de bellos arrabales, habitada por gente honesta y trabajadora.

 Solanda se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y también compra directamente a los almacenes, en ocasiones le toca viajar a Huaquillas o Guayaquil donde están los grandes distribuidorres, también tiene  una pequeña librería en su casa,  el negocio de la ropa lo tiene hace 12 años, y la  librería 7 años, cuando sale a vender deja cerrada la librería, no le ha ido tan bien en esto, mejor le ha ido en la venta de ropa, la cual tiene que pagar al contado.

 Tiene 5 años en la fundación Espoir trabajando con los créditos,este ultimo lo va ha invertir en la compra de mercaderia.
 
El sueño de Solanda es crecer en su negocio, tener un bazar completo, así incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
María Solanda lives in Portoviejo, the capital Manabí, a prosperous and lovely city full of beautiful areas and inhabited by honest and hard-working residents. Solanda dedicates herself to selling clothing that she buys by catalog and also directly from the warehouses. On some occasions, she must travel to Huaquillas or Guayaquil where the big distributors are located. She also has a small bookstore in her house. She has had the clothing business for 12 years, and the bookstore for 7. When she goes out to sell, she closes the bookstore, a business that hasn’t gone as well as her clothing sales, which she must pay for in cash. She has been working with credit through the Fundación Espoir for 5 years. This most recent loan she will invest into the purchase of merchandise. Solanda’s dream is to grow her business and have a well-supplied store, in order to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blouses, pants, socks, undergarments.

loans.name: Judith Adele

texts.fr:
Femme celibataire de 36 ans, ayant en charge 3 personnes ,qui ne sont d'autres que ses neveux , les enfants de son defunt frere, mort durant la guerre ; commercante depuis l'age de 15 ans 
Des qu'elle est arrivee au lycee n'ayant personne pour la soutenir dans ses etudes elle s'est lancee dans la vente des produits divers, apres plusieurs annees d'epargne, elle s'est lancee enfin en 2002 dans la vente des ustensiles de cuisine
 Avec l'octroi de son credit elle a l'intention d'agrandir le stock des marchandises en achetant des ustensiles de cuisine, des marmites,des flutes pour champagne et beaucoup d'autres series de casseroles.Pour accroitre son activite,elle continue toujours a faire l'epargne parceque a la longue elle compte ouvrir une boutique et effectuer des voyages en chine pour s'approvisionner pour pouvoir soutenir ses neveux a faire des longues etudes
texts.en:
A single woman aged 36, with 3 people in her charge, who are none other than her nephews, the children of her late brother who died during the war. She has been a retailer from the age of 15. When she entered high school, having no one to support her with her school fees, she started selling various items. After saving during many years, at last she could start her retail business of kitchen utensils. Once she gets her loan, she intends to increase her stock of goods by purchasing kitchen utensils, pots, champagne flutes, and other sets of saucepans. In order to enlarge her business, she still keeps saving because in time she intends to open a shop and take trips to China to get supplies; this way she will be able to help her nephews to undertake long-term studies.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wholesale kitchen utensils, pots, glasses and cutlery

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis C. R. es un señor de 46 años de edad, vecino de  una comunidad  rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. 
Desde hace 6 años Don Luis se  inicio su propio negocio, con la confección de ropa principalmente uniformes deportivos. Gracias a la calidad de su producto el negocio fue creciendo cada vez mas al punto que ya su producción no abastece toda la demanda que tiene. Gracias a este proyecto que inicio como algo muy pequeño el ha logrado darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Don Luis desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢540.000 (quinientos cuarenta mil  colones) para comprar  una máquina de coser Industrial con la cual podrá incrementar su producción y hace su microempresa cada vez mas importante  
Don Luis  es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN) una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica,  además de un gran líder de la misma. Este será su undécimo crédito  y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Luis C. R. is a 46 year old man who lives in a rural community in Costa Rica located 45 kilometers to the south of San José called San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal is a mountainous region where the residents are engaged in trade, agricultural production (vegetables, coffee and other products), handicrafts, livestock and many other activities. Six years ago Don Luis started his own business making clothing, mainly sporting uniforms. Thanks to the quality of his products the business was growing more and more to the point that his production still did not meet all of the demand for his products. Thanks to this project, which started out as something very small, he has managed to give a better quality of life to his family. Don Luis wants to take out a small loan in the amount of 540,000 Costa Rican colones to buy an industrial sewing machine, with which he could increase his production and make his small business grow. Don Luis is a member and also leader of the community bank "Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN)," one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his eleventh loan, and he hopes to continue to grow both at a personal and economic level.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Lézia Héloise

texts.fr:
femme commerçante de quarante et un ans. Mariée et mère de deux enfants dans l'âge varie entre 21ans et 18 ans. Ayant cinq personnes en charge ,elle exerce son activité dans la vente des tissus qui l'aide à contribuer au responsabilité de son foyer.
elle quite son foyer chaque jours à 8h pouir se rendre au marché Moungali qui est l'un des marchés de Brazzaville et rentre chez elle à 16h00,D'ou ses potentiels client sont des couturiers ainsi que des particuliers. 
avec ce prêt elle veut élargir son activité en achetant des tissus tels que: velours, soie, laine et autre. Malgré les difficultés d'approvisionnement.Pour la croissance de son activité elle s'arrange toujours à  améliorer son étalage. ayant laisser sa scolarité jeune par manque de soutien, elle à débuter son commerce initial de vente de tissus avec un capital de 50.000 frs cfa. comme ambition elle compte importer la marchandise afin de s'acquerir une boutique de vente des tissus de qualité. elle veut aussi que ses enfants fassent des grandes études. pour son quartier elle est un model à suivre.
texts.en:
This is a 41-year-old woman merchant who is married and the mother of two children, aged 18 and 21.  With five people to support, she operates her business selling fabrics that helps her to meet her household responsibilities. She leaves home every day at 8:00 AM to go to the Moungali market, which is one of the markets of Brazzaville, and she returns home at 4:00 PM from the market, where her potential customers are clothiers, as well as individuals.  With this loan, she wants to expand her business by buying fabrics, such as velour, silk, wool, and more, despite the difficulties of getting supplies.  For growing her business, she is still sorting it out to improve her display of goods.  Having left school when young due to a lack of support, she started her initial business selling fabrics with 50,000 francs CFA in capital.  As for her ambitions, she plans on importing merchandise in order to acquire for herself a store for selling quality fabrics.  She also wants her children to have higher education.  In her neighborhood, she is an example to emulate. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Ena Susana

texts.es:
la sra. Ena Susana S. tiene 11 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de pan y rosquillas, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación con ayuda de una empleada, su producto lo distribuye en diferentes negocios de la zona.
con los ingresos que le genera el negocio le ayuda a su esposo a cubrir los gastos en el hogar, tiene tres  hijos a su cargo los cuales estan en la escuela de la localidad, 
Ena a logrado comprar un molino para moler el MAIZ para elaborar su producto facillitandole de este manera la elaboracion de su producto ya que antes tenia que pagar para moler maiz. 
su producto hoy en dia es bien buscado por su clientela.
Ena alquila la casa donde ella habita y es por eso que uno de sus sueños es tener su propia casa.
 su esposo es de gran ayuda, ya que trabajan los dos y se aytudan mutuamente para cumplir con los
compromisos y lograr que sus sueños se hagan realidad.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales para la fabricacion del pan y de las rosquillas.
texts.en:
Ena Susana S. has been making and selling bread and “rosquillas” (a ring-shaped cookie) for 11 years. She makes them in her house with help from an employee. She distributes her product to different businesses in the area. She uses the income that her business generates to help her husband with the household expenses. She has three children under her care, and they attend the local school. Ena bought a mill to grind corn in order to make her product. This way making her product is easier than before when she had to pay to grind the corn. Now her product is requested a lot by her customers. Ena rents the house where she lives. That is why one of her dreams is to have her own house. Her husband is a big help because they both work and help each other to fulfill their obligations and to make their dreams come true. She will use the loan to buy materials to make bread and rosquillas.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, flour, shortening, sweetener, eggs, sugar, cheese, and firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Calle Ocho Group

texts.es:
El grupo Calle Ocho está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es María del Carmen A. quien desde hace cuatro años puso una verdulería y comercializa leche, queso etc. El sueño de María es mejorar su casa la cual se encuentra en mal estado especialmente necesita un cambio de techo por las goteras.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Juana Isabel Martínez quien inicio hace diez años vendiendo nacatamales y luego invirtió en el comercio de cosméticos y Ileana del Carmen Q. quien tiene una tortilleria.

Este grupo ha participado en el proceso de capacitación de autoestima y empoderamiento empresarial donde según expresaron aprendieron hacer optimistas, la atención al cliente y administrar el negocio.
texts.en:
The group “Calle Ocho” (Eighth Street) consists of three hardworking women. One of them is María del Carmen A. who has been operating a produce stand for four years and also sells milk, cheese, and other products. María dreams of making improvements to her house since it is in bad condition. Specifically, she needs to replace the roof because it leaks.

Her fellow group members include Juana Isabel Martínez, who started selling nacatamales ten years ago and later invested in a cosmetics business. Ileana del Carmen Q. produces and sells tortillas.

This group has participated in self-improvement and business empowerment classes in which they learned positive thinking, customer service, and business management.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, cheese, cream, and other products

loans.name: Luciana Leoconda

texts.es:
La señora Luciana de 27 años forma parte del Banco Comunal Corazones Felices, este banco se reúnen en la bella capital manabita desde hace varios años, sus socias son mujeres dignas de una ciudad altiva y trabajadora.

La señora Luciana mantiene un compromiso, tiene 2 hijos, trabaja 8 horas diarias en un centro de desarrollo infantil, también es asesora de los productos Yanbal, vende a sus clientes  atreves de catalogo, una vez que tiene el pedido lo compra al contado y lo entrega a crédito;  en las noches estudia parvulario en la Universidad de la ciudad de Portoviejo cursa el quinto semestre.  Su suegra es de gran ayuda, es ella quien se encarga de cuidar a los niños cuando tiene que salir a trabajar. Una gran ventaja para nuestra socia es que la mayoría de sus clientas son las compañeras de trabajo y de estudio, así  no tiene salir a recorrer la ciudad.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Luciana podrá invertir en productos de belleza como maquillaje, bisutería y perfumes para caballeros que es lo que más vende. Uno de sus sueños es terminar su carrera y poder incursionar en otro negocio que sería la venta de sabanas.
texts.en:
Señora Luciana is 27 years old and is a member of the Happy Hearts Communal Bank. This group has been meeting in the beautiful, Manabí capital for several years. Its members are honorable women in a proud and hard-working city. Señora Luciana is in a relationship and has 2 children. She works 8 hours a day in a child development center. She is also a Yanbal products consultant. Her customers buy from a catalog. Once she has an order she places is all at one time on credit. At night she studies early childhood education at the university in Portoviejo. She is in her fifth semester. Her mother-in-law is a big help as she cares for her children when she has to work. A major advantage for our member is that the majority of her customers are her co-workers and fellow students. This way she does not have to sell door to door. With this new loan Señora Luciana will be able to buy beauty products like cosmetics, imitation jewelry and colognes for men, as this is what she sells the most of. One of her dreams is to retire from this line of work and to venture into another business, namely selling bed sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes and colognes, imitation jewelery and make-up

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
femme de 41 ans avec 3 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 22 ans et 13 ans.elle s'est interessee a la quincaillerie depuis 2001, generalement c'est une activite reservee aux hommes , comme etant tres courageuse et entreprenante elle a ose faire de la quincaillerie son travail.


  Elle a juste 35000f quand elle commence ,elle a elargie son activite 
 en multipliant ses efforts 
avec ce pret elle va
  renforcer les activites en achetant des serrures,crochets, materiels de plomberie;menuiserie, tuyauterie , des robinets et electricite; pointes et vis.
Tres strategique elle va s'approvisionner dans les grands magasins de quincaillerie sur place et soit a Pointe Noire, sa vente journaliere est de 20.000 a 25000 frs par jour, elle epargne toujours pour assurer son avenir et ameliorer les conditions de sa vie et celle des ces enfants.
texts.en:
This is a 41-year-old woman with three children to support whose ages range from13 to 22.  She became interested is hardware in 2001.  Generally, this is a business reserved for men.  But since she is very courageous and enterprising, she dared to make hardware her line of work. She only had 35,000 francs when she stared.  She expanded her business by doubling her efforts.  With this loan, she is going to bolster her business by buying some locks, hooks, and supplies for plumbing, carpentry, electricity, and piping, and some faucets, spark plugs, etc.  A very strategic woman, she is going to stock up at the big hardware stores locally and perhaps in Pointe Noire.  Her sales amount to 20,000 to 25,000 francs per day.  She is still saving money to ensure her future and to improve her and her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying locks, keys, saws, hooks

loans.name: Las Morenas 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Morenas 2 está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Janeth del Socorro Dávila A., coordinadora del grupo. Ella inicio vendiendo juguetes y ropa actualmente comercializa productos de belleza pero con este préstamo piensa invertir en ropa.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Alma Iris S.  quien inicio hace 1996 con la venta de hielo a las refresquerías y actualmente ha incursionado en el comercio de cosméticos y Elisabeth Jessenia L.  quien comercializa ropa interior.
texts.en:
The group “Las Morenas 2” consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Janeth del Socorro Dávila A., the group coordinator. She started selling toys and clothes, but she currently sells beauty products. However, she plans to use this loan to buy clothing.

Her fellow group members include Alma Iris S., who started in 1996 selling ice to snack bars but now has ventured into the cosmetics business. Elisabeth Jessenia L. sells undergarments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Martha Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Martha de 29 años de edad  es  una socia muy responsable del banco comunal Corazones Felices, de la ciudad de Portoviejo en la parroquia Andrés de Vera; nuestra socia está casada desde hace 9 años y tiene un niño de 7 años de edad, la actividad que ella realiza es la venta de alitas de pollos asadas,  los días sábados y domingos es cuando saca su negocio a una calle cercana a su casa, desde las 2 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche se dedica a la venta.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Martha podrá invertir en comprar el pollo, los pinchos y demás productos necesarios para el negocio, por lo general realiza las compras semanalmente, vende todo lo que cocina porque el sector donde vive es de gran afluencia de personas que se dan cita al lugar para hacer deporte, son aproximadamente 200 alitas de pollo que vende, cuenta la señora Martha que es de gran ayuda el negocio que tiene de esa manera aporta económicamente al hogar ya que el esposo solo tiene trabajos eventuales de chofer.

 Esta muy satisfecha nuestra socia con los créditos que ha recibido por parte de la Fundación, actualmente vive en casa de su suegra y está pensando a futuro tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Martha is 29 years old and a very responsable member of the “Corazones Felices” (Happy Hearts) communal bank, located in the city of Portiviejo, in the Andrés de Vera parish. She has been married for nine years and has a seven year old son. She sells grilled chicken on the weekends, when she sets up on a street near her home from 2:00pm to 7:00pm. This loan will allow Martha to invest in chicken and other supplies for her business. She normally stocks up once a week. She is able to sell everything that she prepares because the people in her sector have a great affinity for sports. She normally sells approximately 200 chicken wings. This business is of great economic help to her family, especially since her husband only gets periodic jobs as a driver. Martha is very happy with the previous loans she has gotten through the foundation. She currently lives in her mother-in-law’s home and is hoping to have a home of her own in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es:
Ubaldo de 58 años,  vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (la originalidad de este lugar fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Tiene 4 hijos. El es odontólogo comunitario en las Orquídeas. 

Hace años atrás el estudio odontología pero decidió utilizar sus conocimientos para la comunidad, y dar sus servicio odontológico a un bajo precio. Trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 17h00pm. Para tener mas implementos y ayudar mas a la comunidad necesita comprar un compresor y macillas. 

En el futuro quiere seguir ayudando a la gente en su negocio de odontología.
texts.en:
Ubaldo is 58 years old and lives in the urban area of Las Orquídeas (which originally was a field full of orchids) in Guayquil. He has four children. Ubaldo is a dentist who practices in the community of Las Orquídeas.

He studied dentistry several years ago, so he decided to utilize his knowledge to benefit the community by providing dental services at a low price. Ubaldo works from 9am until 5pm. In order to have the equipment he needs to help the community, he needs to buy a compressor and dental putty.

In the future, he wants to continue helping people through his dental practice.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a compressor & dental putty

loans.name: Beatriz Carmen

texts.es:
Beatriz Carmen P. P. tiene 22 años, es soltera, y vive con sus padres y 2 hijos, Moreo (9 años) y Juan David (4 años).  Ellos viven en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Beatriz es una socia de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que estan estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo.

Beatriz cultiva habas, papas y cebadas. Compras los productos que necesita en Guaranda cada semana y hace las ventas de sus productos en Guaranda cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para mejorar económicamente sus cultivos, comprar semillas y para ganadería.  Piensa que este crédito le ayudará a mejorar sus productos y cambiará su vida de familia. Su sueño es salir adelante con sus estudios y su trabajo. Quisiera tener un micro empresa.

Le gusta la costumbre del carnaval donde se come cuy, chancho, gallina, se toma y se baila durante 5 días.
texts.en:
Beatriz Carmen P. P. is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents and her two children, Moreo (age 9) and Juan David (age 4). They live in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Beatriz is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Yuyai” (New Idea), which is located 30 minutes from Guaranda. There are twelve members in total, all of whom are young and are studying and working in agriculture at the same time.

Beatriz grows beans, potatoes, and barley. She buys the merchandise she needs in Guaranda each week and then sells her products in Guaranda every six months.

She is requesting a loan so that she can improve her crops. Beatriz plans to buy seeds and use part of the money for raising cattle. She believes this loan will help improve her products and transform the life of her family. Her dream is to succeed in her studies and in her work. She hopes to have her own micro-enterprise.

Beatriz enjoys the Carnival tradition that involves eating (guinea pigs, pork, and chicken), drinking, and dancing for five days.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & invest part of the money in raising cattle

loans.name: Rebeca Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Rebeca  forma parte del Banco Comunal Corazones Felices, banco que se reúnen en la  parroquia del cantón Portoviejo llamada Andrés De Vera, su negocio es la venta de comida frente de su casa tiene mesas y sillas, ella mismo prepara la comida, trabaja desde las 2 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche, los platos que más vende son carne con menestra y arroz con pescado frito, lleva tres años con su negocio.

 Está casada tiene dos hijos, el esposo trabaja como obrero en construcciones , es poco lo que gana pero es de gran ayuda para el hogar, la decidió  poner este negocio ya que su  esposo no estaba ganado bien y empezaron a tener problemas económicos, pero desde entonces tiene su negocio y le ha ido muy bien.

 Con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en todo lo necesario para preparara los alimentos como; carnes, arroz y legumbres, sus clientes la buscan por su sazón, todos los días desde muy temprano se dedica a su trabajo y así sacarlo adelante.
texts.en:
Rebeca is part of the communal bank Corazones Felices. This bank meets in a parrish of the Portoviejo canton called Andrés De Vera. Her business is selling food in front of her house, where she has tables and chairs. She prepares the food herself. She works from 2 in the afternoon until 7 at night. The dishes she sells the most are meat and stewed beans and rice with fried fish. She has been at this business for three years. She is married and has two children. Her husband works in construction. She earns little but it really helps the household. She decided to start this business because her husband wasn't making very much money and they started having financial problems. Since she has had her business, things have gone well for her. With this new loan, she will be able to invest in everything she needs to prepare the food, such as: meat, rice and vegetables. Her customers seek her out for her seasoning. She starts work very early every day in order to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, fish, and vegetables

loans.name: Eva Julia

texts.es:
la sra. Eva Julia R. A. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad a la cual se dedica hace varios años, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos.
tambien tiene unos cuartos que alquila en su casa.
doña Eva es una persona bien querida por todos sus vecinos y tiene muchos clientes ya que sus tortillas son muy ricas, este es un aliemento basico en la dieta de los catrachos. Eva necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas y asi tener mayores ganancias. la meta de ella es poder hacer mas cuartos para alquilar ya que de esta forma es mas facil hacer dinero todos los meses porque ella se siente cansada por su edad.
texts.en:
Sra. Eva Julia R. A. has been producing and selling tortillas for several years. She is a widow and has two children. In addition, she has rooms in her house that she offers for rent.

Doña Eva is well-known among all of her neighbors and has many customers who enjoy the rich flavor of her tortillas since they are a basic staple of the Honduran diet. She needs a loan to buy more supplies used in making tortillas so that she can earn more income. Her goal is to build more rooms for rent so that it will be easier for her to earn money each month since she feels tired at her age.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood, lime, cornmeal, and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mirian Susana

texts.es:
Mirian Susana P. A. tiene 19 años de edad. Ella es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Guaranda, en la provincia de Bolívar.

Mirian es una socia de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que están estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo

Mirian esta trabajando en la agricultura desde muy joven, en la ganadería (vacas de leche). Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda. 

Solicita el crédito para mejorar la producción de queso y así solventar la situación económica. Espera que este crédito le ayudará a cambiar su trabajo y a haber más ganancia con más créditos de la Cooperativa San José. 

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios con las actividades que ella realiza al mismo tiempo, y tener una casa propia para poder vivir con su familia. 

Le gusta ver la televisión y escuchar música. Las costumbres en su comunidad son los carnavales. Dice que les realizan juntamente con sus familias en la actividad social.
texts.en:
Mirian Susana P. A. is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Mirian is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Yuyai” (New Idea), which is located 30 minutes from Guaranda. There are twelve members in total, all of whom are young and are studying and working in agriculture at the same time.

Mirian has been working in agriculture from a young age, primarily raising dairy cows. She buys and sells her products at the market in Guaranda.

She is requesting a loan to improve her production of cheese and stabilize her financial situation. Mirian hopes this loan will help transform her work and would like to receive additional loans from Cooperativa San José.

Mirian dreams of finishing her studies while engaging in her other activities. She also hopes of having her own house where she can live with her family. Mirian enjoys watching television and listening to music. The traditions in her community include the Carnival festivities. She says her family members celebrate together in this social activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her cheese production

loans.name: Proyecto Group

texts.es:
El grupo Proyecto está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Alexandra Vulizo L. P. quien inicio hace cuatro años vendiendo enchiladas y tajadas con queso negocio que con el trabajo arduo ha ido creciendo. En la actualidad comercializa carne asada, pollo, cerdo etc.

Sus compañeras de grupo son María Auxiliadora L. Gonzales  quien tiene una pulpería la que abrió hace 9 años con la venta de chiverías y ahora distribuye gran variedad de productos y Margina Elizabeth Monje Rodríguez desde hace 10 años se dedica al destace de cerdo de donde produce chicharrón, frito, moronga, nacatamales etc.
texts.en:
The “Proyecto” (Project) Group consists of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Alexandra Vulizo L. P., who started a business four years ago selling enchiladas and plantains with cheese. Through her hard work, her business has been increasing. Alexandra currently sells roasted beef, chicken, pork, and other foods.

Her fellow group members include María Auxiliadora L. Gonzales who has a grocery store she opened nine years ago where she sells yogurt products. She now distributes a large variety of products. Margina Elizabeth Monje Rodríguez has been butchering pigs for ten years in order to produce chicharrón, fried pork, blood sausage, nacatamales, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain, meat, oil, vegetables, and other products

loans.name: Yolanda Roció

texts.es:
Yolanda Roció P. P. tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Guaranda, en la provincia de Bolívar.

Yolanda es una socia de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que están estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo.

Yolanda estudia por la mañana y por la tarde realiza labores agropecuarias como crianza de cuyes, conejos, pollos, cerdos, borregos y vacas. Hace las compras y ventas de sus productos en Guaranda. 

Solicita el crédito para mejorar la vida económica, comprando animales, y así seguir adelante. Quisiera mas créditos para poder cambiar más su vida y su trabajo. Su sueño es graduarse como ingeniera en contabilidad, y que no le falta nada a su familia. Enfrenta desafíos en el campo que es bien duro, por que enfrentan lluvia, sol y viento para poder trabajar. 

Le gusta escuchar música en su tiempo libre. En su comunidad, tienen la costumbre de festejar el carnaval, la semana santa y el día de los difuntos (donde ellos van al cementerio para hacer una comida con los difuntos).
texts.en:
Yolanda Roció P. P. is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Yuyai” (New Idea), which is located 30 minutes from Guaranda. There are twelve members in total, all of whom are young and are studying and working in agriculture at the same time.

Yolanda studies in the morning and in the afternoon she engages in her chores that include raising guinea pigs, rabbits, chickens, pigs, sheep, and cows. She buys and sells her products in Guaranda.

Yolanda is requesting a loan to improve her financial situation. She plans to buy animals so that she can continue moving forward. Yolanda hopes to receive more loans so that she can improve both her life and her work even more. Her dream is to graduate and become an accountant so that her family lacks nothing. The farming-related challenges that she faces are difficult, which include having to work in the rain, the sun, and the wind.

She enjoys music in her free time. In her community, people celebrate Carnival, Holy Week, and the Day of the Dead (when many go to the cemetery to bring food for those who have passed away).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals

loans.name: Golondrina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Golondrina lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas Carolina P. de 20 años quien inicio vendiendo ropa y  con las ganancias invirtió en  una pulpería en la cual le ayuda su mamá. Ella es madre de dos gemelas de cinco años que son su razón de ser por las cuales desea salir adelante.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Jamileth C. quien tiene una pequeña venta y Rebeca del Rosario Urbina desde hace seis años tiene una tortillería y vende buñuelos postres a base de yuca y queso.
texts.en:
The Golondrina Group consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Carolina P.. At the age of 20, she started selling clothing and used the earnings to invest in a grocery store that her mother helps to manage. Carolina is the mother of five year old twins who are the reason behind her desire to get ahead.

Her fellow group members are Jamileth C., who has a grocery store, and Rebeca del Rosario Urbina, who has been selling tortillas and fritters made of cassava and cheese for the past six years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain, meat, yogurt, and other products

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz es una mujer muy emprendedora ella tiene 37 años de edad y vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia. Desde ya varios años se dedica a la venta de pan, rutina diaria que Mariluz comienza desde muy temprano en la mañana cuando debe ir a adquirir los panes para posteriormente venderlos por unidad, de esa manera pueda obtener ganancias. Ella se siente contenta con su trabajo pues le da los ingresos necesarios para poder sacar a su familia adelante, además de esta actividad ella también se dedica al tejido de prendas y confección de colchas, con lo cual obtiene un ingreso extra. En un futuro desea seguir trabajando para poner un negocio más estable como una bodega o algo relacionado para así obtener mejores ventas. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprar mayor cantidad de pan para así obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Mariluz is a very hard working woman who is 37 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own house. For several years she has worked selling bread, a daily routine that Mariluz begins in early morning when she must go to acquire the breads in order to sell them later individually, and in this way she is able to earn an income. She is content with her work since it provides the income necessary to be able to help her family get ahead. In addition, she also works making clothing and weaving items, to provide extra income. In the future she wants to keep working to create a more stable business like a store or something similar to increase her sales. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She has always been characterized as being very punctual with all her repayments. With the loan she is requesting she wants to buy a greater quantity of bread in order to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread in quantity in order to resell at retail

loans.name: Fabiola Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Fabiola forma parte del banco comunal Corazones Felices en la ciudad de Portoviejo, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijas, su esposo trabaja colocando cerámica pero su trabajo lo realiza cuando lo buscan Y no es constante, mientras que nuestra socia esta dedicada a trabajar de todo un poco, desde cocinar hasta vender ropa, sabanas, zapatillas, el tiempo lo sabe distribuir muy bien,  trabaja  recorriendo  diferentes lugares, dice que siempre ha trabajado en esto y le gusta mucho el comercio.

Lleva dos ciclos en la Fundación Espoir y los créditos le han sido de gran ayuda para solventar los gastos del hogar.

Nuestra socia con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en comprar sabanas y prendas de vestir, sus compras las realiza en Quito o en ocasiones en Guayaquil, ella siempre ha viajado y ha trabajado sola, la situación de nuestra socia no ha sido nada fácil ya que tiene que dejar a su niña pequeña en casa de la mamá para poder salir a vender, ella al igual que otras socias tiene  muchos sueños y uno de ellos es justamente ayudar a su mamá económicamente y seguir creciendo en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Fabiola is part of the Corazones Felices (Happy Hearts) Communal Bank in the city of Portoviejo. She is 32, married, and has three daughters. Her husband works putting down ceramic tile, but he does the work only when requested. It is not steady work. Our member works doing a little of everything from cooking to selling clothes, sheets, and athletic shoes. She knows very well how to allot her time. She works by traveling to different places. She says that she has always worked in this, and she likes commerce a lot. She has had two cycles with the Fundación Espoir. The loans have been a great help in paying the household expenses. With this loan our member will be able to buy sheets and clothing. She makes her purchases in Quito and sometimes in Guayaquil. She has always traveled and worked alone. Our member’s circumstances have not been easy because she has to leave her little daughter in her mother’s house to be able to leave to sell. She, like the other members, has many dreams. One of them is to rightly help her mother economically and to continue having her sales grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blouses, pants, shirts, and sheets

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira P. P. tiene 28 años de edad y vive con sus padres y 2 hijos, Cristian de 9 años y Sisa de 3 años. Ellos viven en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Rosa es una socia de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que están estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo.

Rosa trabaja en el campo agrícola y en la pecuaria, para un mejor rendimiento económico. Siembra papas, habas, cebada, y tiene vacas de leche que le permiten de hacer queso. Hace las ventas y compras en Guaranda. 

Solicita el crédito para mejorar su rendimiento económico, comprar semillas para el campo y lo que las vacas necesitan. Su sueño es tener una empresa y mejorar con el apoyo de la Cooperativa San José. Su familia la apoya siempre a seguir adelante.

Esta trabajando desde muy pequeña para mejorar la situación económica y la vida de su familia. Le gustan las fiestas como el carnaval de Guaranda, que es una actividad social importante para la comunidad y su cultura indígena.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira P. P. is 28 years old and lives with her parents and her two children, Cristian (age 9) and Sisa (age 3). They live in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Yuyai” (New Idea), which is located 30 minutes from Guaranda. There are twelve members in total, all of whom are young and are studying and working in agriculture at the same time.

Rosa engages in farming and raising livestock in order to improve her financial situation. She grows potatoes, beans, and barley. Rosa also has dairy cows, which allows her to make cheese. She buys and sells her products in Guaranda.

Rosa is requesting a loan to improve her financial situation. She will buy seeds for her field and also cows that she needs. Her dream is to have a business and continue improving with the support of Cooperativa San José. The help of her family always keeps her moving forward.

From a very young age, Rosa has worked to improve her financial condition and the life of her family. She enjoys festivities such as Carnival in Guaranda, which is an important social event for the community and its indigenous culture.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & cows

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
el sr. Miguel Angel Z. H. tiene 25 años de dedicarse a la fabricacion y venta de bloques de concreto para construccion de casas y edificios, este producto tiene mucha demanda en la zona ya que la mayoria de las construcciones emplean este tipo de material por ser mas barato, economico y resistente.
El Sr. Z. nos manifesto que este negocio le es de mucha bendicion ya que le ha generado ingresos para  
suplir sus gastos personales y las obligaciones finanacieras que el ha contraido.
 Don Michel como se le conoce en La ciudad de El Paraiso se ha visto en en la necesidad  a futuro de
comprar una maquina para la elaboracion de bloques lo que le facilitaria la elaboracion y calidad de su producto. esta maquina tiene un precio un poco caro y esta ahorrando para comprarla.
este credito lo utilizara para comprar mas material para la fabricacion de los bloques de concreto.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel Angel Z. H. has 25 years of experience in the manufacture of concrete blocks used in the construction of houses and buildings. There is a lot of demand for this product in his area because most construction uses this type of material since it is cheaper, economical, and tough.

Sr. Z. stated to us that this business has given him many blessings since it has generated income for meeting his personal expenses and the financial obligations he has acquired. Don Michel, as he is known in the city of El Paraiso, has seen the need in the future for a machine for manufacturing concrete blocks which would facilitate the fabrication of quality products. This machine is a little expensive, and he is saving to purchase it. This loan will be used to buy more material for manufacturing concrete blocks.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement and sand.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ángel Rodrigo

texts.es:
Ángel Rodrigo P. P. tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.  

Ángel es un socio de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que están estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo.

Ángel trabaja en la agricultura con sus padres, sembrando papas. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda. 

Solicita el préstamo para mejorar la situación económica de la familia y salir adelante, comprando semillas. Más crédito le ayudará para mejorar su situación económica y su actividad. 

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios, tener dinero para comprar una casa y un poco de terreno y seguir en las actividades del campo. Trabaja siempre en el campo con su familia, que es unida para mejorar su situación económica. 

Le gusta jugar futbol, escuchar música, y las costumbres del cantón como la fiesta de carnaval.
texts.en:
Ángel Rodrigo P. P. is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the district of Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Ángel is a partner of the rural "ventanilla Mushuc Yuyai" (New thinking), located half-an-hour from Guaranda. There are a total of 12 young partners who are studying and working in farming at the same time.

Ángel works in farming with his parents, planting potatoes. They buy and sell their products at the market of Guaranda.

He requests the loan to improve his family's economic situation and get ahead buying seeds. The loan will help him improve his economic situation and his activity.

It is his dream to finish his studies, to have money to buy a house and some land and continue the farming activities. He always works in the field with his family which is united to improve his economic situation.

He likes to play football, listen to music, and the traditions of his district such as the carnival.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Mirian Luzmila

texts.es:
Mirian Luzmila P. P. tiene 18 años, y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Mirian es una socia de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que están estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo.

Mirian trabaja desde pequeña en la agricultura y pecuaria, cultivando papas y habas, y cuidando ganado. Hace las compras y ventas de sus productos en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para mejorar su situación económica, comprando semillas. Sus sueños es cumplir con las actividades que realiza en el campo, seguir con sus estudios adelante, y realizar su propia empresa con más crédito. 

Le gusta escuchar música y la costumbre del carnaval que se celebra con toda la familia. Su familia es unida y siempre trabajan para mejorar su actividad económica
texts.en:
Mirian Luzmila P. P. is 18 years old and lives with her parents in the district of Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Mirian is a partner of the rural "ventanilla Mushuc Yuyai (New Thinking), located half-an-hour from Guaranda. There are a total of 12 young partners who are studying and working in farming at the same time.

Mirian has worked since very young in farming and livestock, planting potatoes and broad beans as well as taking care of livestock. She buys and sells her products in Guaranda.

He requests the loan to improve his economic situation buying seeds. It is her dream to carry out the activities in the field, continue her studies, and set up her own business with more loans.

She likes to listen to music and the tradition of the carnival which she enjoys with the entire family. Her family is united and always works to improve their economic activity.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Confianza Group

texts.es:
El grupo confianza está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Bertha U. Moraga, coordinadora del grupo. Ella tiene una carnicería la cual inicio su madre y actualmente administra desde 1993 y le ha proporcionado el sustento para sus hijos de 18 y 6 años.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Miriam S. quien vende comidas y refrescos desde hace 7 años y Martha Leonor B. de 57 años quien vende frutas, verduras y piñatas. Ellas han participado en las capacitaciones de autoestima y empoderamiento empresarial donde expresaron que fue muy bueno, se sintieron bien y aprendieron mucho.
texts.en:
The group "Confianza" is made up by three working women, one of them is Mrs. Bertha U. Moraga, coordinator of the group. She has a butcher's shop which was set up by her mother and has been administered by her since 1993 and has provided means of support for her children of 18 and 6.

Her group partners are Miriam S. who has been selling food and soft drinks for 7 years and Martha Leonor B. of 57 who sells fruits, vegetables, and piñatas. They have participated in workshops on self-esteem and entrepreneurial empowering, which they found very good, they felt fine and learned a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat

loans.name: Jenny Mariuxi

texts.es:
La señora Jenny de 31 años de edad es una de  las socias del Banco Comunal Corazones Felices, banco que se reúne en la ciudad de Portoviejo, esta comprometida hace 15 años, tiene 4 hijos el mayor tiene 13 años y los 3 son pequeños , ella se dedica a vender cervezas, lleva 3 años en su negocio que está ubicado en su casa.

El crédito que esta solicitando es para invertir en su negocio, antes trabajo  vendiendo varios productos pero lo dejo y se ha dedicado a este nuevo trabajo, así pasa más tiempo en casa, el negocio lo tomo porque su mamá ya vendía cervezas y fue ella quien la motivo.

Nuestra socia con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en comprar javas de cervezas y demás bebidas hay días en los que se vende todo pero también tiene los días difíciles en los que se vende poco, pero cuenta con el respaldo de su esposo que trabaja de albañil, de ese manera han podido salir adelante.

El sueño de la señora es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jenny, age 31, is a member of the Corazones Felices (Happy Hearts) Communal Bank. The group meets in the city of Portoviejo. She has been married for 15 years, and she has four children. The oldest is 13, and the other three are small. She has been selling beer for three years. Her business is located in her house. The requested loan is to invest in her business. She used to work selling various products, but she stopped that. Now she is devoted to her new work. That way she spends more time at home. She started this work because her mother sold beer. Her mother was the one that motivated her. This is our member’s ninth loan. She will be able to buy cases of beer and other drinks. There are days where everything is sold. But, there are also difficult days where little is sold. But, she has her husband’s support; he works as a bricklayer. That is the way they have been able to get ahead. Her dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer, colas, juices, and water

loans.name: Orfilia

texts.es: Orfilia tiene 53 años, sus dos hijos son ya mayores e independientes, vive con su madre Petronila, acaba de cumplir 100 años y por ello debe cuidarla más, juntas viven solas en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la variedad de trabajos para sacar adelante a sus hijos, es así que en la actualidad sin ya tener tantas responsabilidades, decidió solo cuidar de su madre, desde entonces se dedica a trabajar en varios oficios, como es la venta de paltillos y bocaditos. Asimismo vende productos energéticos y productos de belleza. es así que ha logrado obtener ganancias considerables que le ayuden a mantenerse ella misma y a su mamá. Por el momento continuará trabajando pero lo que le hace más feliz es que cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de belleza, además comprar dulces y abastecerse de más productos energéticos.
texts.en:
Orfilia is 53 years old. Her two children are already grown and independent. She lives with her mother Petronila. She just turned 100 years old and because of this she must take care of her more. They live alone together in their own house. Since she was very young, she has had a variety of jobs to get her children ahead. Now that she has fewer responsibilities, she has dedicated herself to taking care of her mother and she works at various things, such as selling snacks and sandwiches. She also sells energy and beauty products. In this way, she has been able to earn considerable income to help her support herself and her mother. At the moment, she will continue to work but what makes her the most happy is that she has her childrens' support. This is her eighth loan with MFP and she has always been characterized by making all of her payments on time. With the loan that she is asking for, she will buy beauty products as well as buy candies and energy product supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and energy products.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Kuña Guapa, se conformó en agosto del 2008, en la zona de Trinidad, comunidad desfavorecida económicamente,  donde no hay un sector comercial importante, por lo que sus habitantes se dedican en su mayoría al sector informal de la economía.
 Las señoras comentan que están muy conformes con el crédito recibido y tiene muchas ganas de seguir participando. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Francisca quien tiene una cantina con venta de bebidas y comestibles en general. 
Ella comenta que todas las señoras del grupo se encuentran muy contentas trabajando con el grupo.
En una casilla que posee frente a su domicilio ella coloca todos los productos que ofrece para sus clientes.
En la atención del negocio la ayudan sus hijos. Ella  esta desea seguir trabajando ya que los ingresos de su actividad ayudan con los gastos para la alimentación de la familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas como gaseosa, cervezas, vinos y otros, además para la compra de productos de usos domesticos.
texts.en:
The "Comité de Mujeres Kuña Guapa" was started in August, 2008 in the zone of Trinidad, a community economically unfavored with no important commercial sector, and therefore the majority of the inhabitants is involved in the informal sector of the economy. The ladies comment on being satisfied with the loan and want to continue participating. One of the members is Mrs. Francisca who has a bar where she sells beverages and food in general. She comments that all the ladies of the group are very happy working with the group. In facilities she owns in front of her house she places the products for her customers. Her children help with the business. She wishes to continue to work as the income helps with the expenses to feed the family. She requests the loan to buy beverages such as soft drinks, beer, wine and others as well as to buy products for domestic use.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pops, candy, cold meat, dairy products, cooking oil, vegetables, eggs, condiments, etc. for food preparation

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Manuela

texts.es:
María Manuela P. P. tiene 38 años.  Es casada y viva con su esposo y 2 niñas, Consuela (13) y Esther (11) en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

María es una socia de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que están estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo.

María se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando papas, habas y trigo. Tiene también 2 vacas de leche. Hace las compras y ventas cada semana, el sábado, en el mercado de Guaranda. 

Solicita el crédito para mejorar ganado, comprando otra vaca de leche. El préstamo le va a ayudar la familia para producir más leche y entonces mas queso. Sus sueños son más aumentar el producto y mandar al colegio las niñas. 
Enfrenta desafíos como falta de lluvia y enfermedades en los cultivos.

Le gustan las fiestas en el cantón y bailar.
texts.en:
María Manuela P. P. is 38 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 2 daughters, Consuela (13) and Esther (11) in the district of Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

María is a partner of the rural "ventanilla Mushuc Yuyai" (New Thinking), located half-an hour from Guaranda. There are a total of 12 young partners who are studying and working in farming at the same time.

María works in agriculture growing potatoes, broad beans, and wheat. She also has 2 milking cows. She buys and sells every week on Saturday at the market of Guaranda.

She requests the loan to improve her livestock buying another milking cow. The loan will help the family produce more milk and thus more cheese. Her dreams are to increase the production and send the girls to school. She faces the challenge of lack of rain and illness in the crops.

She enjoys the parties in the district and to dance.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase another milking cow.

loans.name: Elbia Alicia

texts.es:
Elbia Alicia M. P. tiene 19 años de edad. Es casada y vive con su esposo, sus suegros y su hija, Norma (2 años), el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Elbia es una socia de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que están estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo.

Trabaja en el campo desde 10 anos, cultivando papas, habas, cebollas, para venderlos en el mercado y para el consumo de la familia. También tiene ganadería y produce queso que va a vender también. Hace compras y ventas en los mercados de Guaranda. 

Solicito el crédito para invertir en la agricultura y ganadería, comprando semillas y ganado si puede. Quisiera invertir el dinero en un negocio más grande, para el buen vivir de su familia. 

Sus sueños son superarse más, que crece más el negocio, tener tiempo para estudiar y trabajar y tener un carro, casa y terreno en el futuro. Enfrenta desafíos como falta de dinero para el negocio y la familia. 

Su hobby es escuchar música y estudiar. A su esposo le gusta el futbol. A su hija le gusta jugar y escribir.
texts.en:
Elbia Alicia M. P. is 19 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, her parents in law, and her daughter Norma, who is 2. She lives in the Guaranda canton in the province Bolívar. Elbia is a member of the rural community bank Mushuc Yuyai (New Thought), located a half hour from Guaranda. There are 12 members in total, all young, who study and work in agriculture at the same time. She has worked in the field for 10 years, growing potatoes, beans, and onions to sell in the market and for family to eat. They also have cattle and produce cheese that she is going to sell as well. She buys and sells in the markets of Guaranda. She is asking for the loan to invest in agriculture and cattle, buying seed and cattle if she can. She would like to invest the money in a bigger business, for her family's wellbeing. Her dreams are to get ahead, for her business to grow more, and to have time to study and work and have a car, house and land in the future. She faces challenges like a lack of money for the business and for her family. Her hobby is listening to music and studying. Her husband likes soccer. Her daughter likes to play and write.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and cattle if she can

loans.name: Yamileth Argentina

texts.es:
la sra. Yamileth Argentina R. B. se dedica al comercio cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta de juguetes que opera bajo el nombre de ALFA Y OMEGA actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace mas de 6 años, esta 
casada es madre de familia. tiene un hijo.
con los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permiten suplir algunos personales y estudios universitarios ya que es pasante de la carrera de psicologia en la Universidad de Nicaragua.

el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en su negocio ya que se aproxima la feria juniana de su municipio en ocacion de celebrar el festival nacional del Café que es bien concurrida por propios y extranjeros, el cafe es el rubro de esta region Oriental de Honduras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yamileth Argentina R. B. works as a merchant. She has a small toy store that operates under the name of ALFA Y OMEGA. She has been doing this activity for more than 6 years. She is married and a mother of one child. The income that this business generates allows her to pay for some personal expenses and some university classes since she is a psycology major at the University of Nicaragua. She will use the loan to invest in her business, since the June holiday of her town is coming up and is the occasion to celebrate the national Coffee festival, which is well attended by the locals and by foreigners. Coffee is the main product of this eastern region of Honduras.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toys

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La señora Bertha ella es soltera, debido a que su esposo ya falleció, y tiene 2 hijas los cuales ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan económicamente. La señora se dedica a la sastrería, en su casa tiene varias maquinas de coser, las cuales utiliza y contrata a veces personas para la elaboración de trajes de damas, camisas, faldas, etc. Ella ya tiene 50 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual empezó gracias a que su mama la indujo a aprender este oficio desde los 16 años. Primeramente trabaja con su mama, luego quedo ella trabajando sola. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo realizar compras de materia prima, ya que actualmente posee varios pedidos de faldas y camisas de mujer. Su sueño siempre ha sido dejarles un buen negocio establecido a sus hijas para así como ella, puedan mantenerse con los ingresos del mismo.
texts.en:
Bertha is single because her husband passed away, and she has 2 daughters who are adults and who help her financially. She works as a tailor; in her home she has various sewing machines which she uses. At times she hires workers to make women's suits, shirts, skirts, etc. She has been in this business for 50 years. She started thanks to her mother, who led her to learn this trade when she was 16 years old. First, she worked with her mother, and later she was left working on her own. She wants to use this loan to purchase raw materials, since she currently has a number of orders for skirts and women's shirts. Her dream has always been to leave and established business to her daughters so that they, like her, could support themselves with the income it provides.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy raw materials for tailoring

loans.name: Rosario Katiuska

texts.es:
La señora Rosario de 25 años de edad se dedica a vender  semi joyas como: aretes, cadenas, lleva tres años en esta actividad,la manera de trabajar es  visitando a sus clientes por el sector donde vive.

Nuestra socia  esta  casada desde hace tres años, tiene 1 hijo, su esposo es albañil y trabaja en distintas partes, sale desde las 8:00 am hasta las 12:00 pm o de 1:00 pm hasta las 5:30 pm. En los actuales momentos ella alquila un departamento.

El crédito que solicita es para invertir en su negocio, su mercadería la compra el en centro de la ciudad de Portoviejo en una distribuidora, compra al contado, pero a sus clientes les deja a crédito, sus ganancias son buenas; ella invierte dependiendo de lo que venda o cuando le hacen pedidos, ella sale a recorrer por la mañana ya que su hijo a esa hora está en la escuela. Dice que la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho ya que ha podido adquirir muchas cosas, cuando no tiene su  esposo trabajo ella le ayuda económicamente.

El sueño de Rosario es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosario, 25, sells semi-precious jewelry such as earrings and chains. She has worked in this business for 3 years. She sells her products door-to-door in the neighborhood where she lives. Rosario has been married for 3 years. She has a son, and her husband is a bricklayer who works in various areas. He works from 8am until noon, or from 1pm until 5:30pm. At the current moment they rent an apartment. The loan she requests is to invest in her business. She buys her merchandise from a wholesaler in downtown Portoviejo. She buys on a cash basis, but she gives her customers credit, and her earnings are good. She invests according to what sells, or when her customers make orders. She goes out to sell in the morning, since that is when her son is in school. She says that the Fundación has helped her a lot, since she has been able to acquire many things, and when her husband is out of work she can help him financially. Rosario dreams of having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chains, rings and earrings

loans.name: Primitivo Baudillo

texts.es:
Primitivo de 56 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (la originalidad de este lugar fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. El tiene 6 hijos y tiene un taller de muebles. 

Hace 15 años atrás el tiene el taller de mueble, trabaja con 9 trabajadores haciendo muebles en su casa. No tiene un lugar fijo para su taller pero durante los 15 años a trabajado en el portal de su casa el hace mesas, sillas, sillones etc. 

Pero para hacer mas muebles el quiere comprar madera para su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa porque es actualmente de caña y ladrillos.
texts.en:
Primitivo is 56 years old and lives in the urban neighborhood of Las Orquídeas (“The Orchids”—the neighborhood was originally a field with many orchid flowers) in Guayaquil. He has 6 children and owns a furniture making business. Primitivo has had his furniture making business for 15 years. He and his 9 employees build furniture in Primitivo’s house. Primitivo does not have a permanent place for his workshop, but for the past 15 years has worked in the entrance hall of his home making tables, chairs, armchairs, etc. Now Primitivo wants to purchase wood so he can build more furniture for his business. In the future he wants to finish constructing his house, as it is currently made of bricks and reeds.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wood for his furniture making business

loans.name: Jose De Los Santos

texts.es:
el sr. Jose de los Santos D. C. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, tambien cosecha y vende café, bananos y platanos desde hace mas de 12 años, durante todo este tiempo el ha ido adquiriendo experiencia en sus cocechas.
con su negocio atesora el bienestar para su familia.
El Sr D. esta casado tiene una hija de 4 años la cual esta en La preparatoria en un kinder de la ciudad de Danli,  
con los ingresos de su negocio suple sus gastos familiares y las obligaciones finanacieras.

a mejorado significativamente su negocio lo que le hace lucir mejor. El credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi tener mas surtida su pulperia.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose de los Santos is a businessman selling from his small store located in his home. He has been growing and selling coffee, bananas and plantains for more than 12 years and increasing his harvest. With his business he has improved the welfare of his family. Mr. D. is married, has one four year old daughter in preschool in the city of Danli. With the income from his business he provides for his family’s expenses and financial obligations. His business has improved significantly making him shine. The loan would be used to purchase merchandise in order to have a well stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy “churros” (long doughnuts), coffee, glue, butter, bananas, plantains, soft drinks, juice, lard, oil, rice, beans, bread, cookies, tortillas, and milk

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas, junto con su esposo, siembra cereales y granos como trigo, cebada, maíz, habas, quinua y arveja, puesto que la venta de estos productos son los más rentables. Es así que durante la temporada de cosecha, lo vende al por mayor a los comerciantes de los mercados y trata de venderlo de manera directa sin intermediarios dependiendo de la ocasión y del precio a la que se oferta en el mercado.  Por tal razón cuida mucho de sus plantaciones, de esa manera logrará prevenir cualquier ataque de plagas. Desde entonces desea intensificar más el trabajo tanto en la siembra como en la cosecha, y por tanto desea adquirir más tierras para aumentar su producción. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos y espera serlo esta vez. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono para preparar sus terrenos de cultivo en la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Nancy is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in their own house. She has been working in agriculture since childhood and with her husband she grows cereals and grains such as wheat, barley, corn, beans, quinoa and peas. These are the most profitable products to sell. During the harvest season, she sells them wholesale to market traders and tries to sell them directly with no intermediaries, depending on the occasion and the market price. For this reason, she takes great care of her plantations in order to prevent pest attacks. From now onwards, she wishes to intensify both the sowing and harvesting work, and therefore wants to acquire more land in order to increase production. This is her fourth loan with MFP; she is very responsible with her payments and expects to be this time too. With the loan requested, she will buy sacks of fertiliser with which to prepare her cultivating plots during the next sowing season.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertiliser.

loans.name: Sandra Auxiliadora

texts.es:
la sra. Sandra Auxiliadora S. se dedica a la venta de joyería de plata, Sandra tiene más de 2 años de realizar esta actividad económica.  Es una persona muy conocida en el lugar por su espíritu de superación, solvencia moral y de buena conducta, se ha sabido ganar la clientela lo que le  ha generado mayor demanda de su producto ya que las ventas las realiza de contado y al crédito generándole de esta forma clientela permanente en todo el año. A la vez Sandra Auxiliadora trabaja como impulsadora de Corporación Unimer y es pasante universitaria de la carrera de Pedagogía facilitándole vender sus productos a sus compañeras de trabajo y de la universidad.  
En la actualidad, no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir su negocio y así brindarle a sus clientes mas variedad de productos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas joyas de plata.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra Auxiliadora S. has been selling silver jewelry for more than two years. She is well-known locally for her desire to succeed, her moral values, and the fine manner in which she conducts herself. Sandra has been able to attract customers because of increased demand for her products. Her sales are made for cash or on credit, which helps her maintain a steady flow of customers through the entire year. At one point, Sandra worked as a sales representative for the Unimer Corporation while she was studying for her degree in Education. She sold their products to her co-workers and classmates.

At the moment, she does not have sufficient operating capital to restock her business and provide her customers a wide variety of products. This loan will be used to buy more silver jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rings, chains, bracelets, necklaces, and earrings

loans.name: Sofia Suyapa

texts.es:
la sra. Sofia Suyapa S. V. se dedica al comercio cuenta con una venta de Ropa nueva que opera bajo el nombre de "VARIEDADES SOFIA” vende de contado y al credito lo que le permite tener clientela permanente.
Tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y se ve que le ha ido muy bien, su negocio  esta ubicado en un lugar estratégico y de mucha circulación de personas que vienen de diferentes lugares. 
con los ingresos que percibe de su negocio suple las necesidades de su familia y los compromisos adquiridos.
Sofia no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para realizar la compra de mas mercadería para satisfacer  la demanda de sus clientes, razón por la cual a el credito lo utilizara en comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en:
Sra. Sofia Suyapa S. V. has a business selling new clothing under the name “Variedades Sofia”. Her sales are made for cash or on credit, which allows her to have a steady flow of customers. She has been in business for four years and has done very well. Her business is situated in a strategic location where many people pass through from different places. With the income that her business generates, she is able to provide for the needs of her family and meet all of her commitments.

Sofia does not have enough operating capital to buy more merchandise to satisfy the demand of her customers. For this reason, she will use this loan to buy merchandise and have a well-stocked business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shoes for women, men, and children

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es: Viviano tiene 50 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, los tres estudian,su negocio es de elaboración, repación y venta de zapatos el cual lo inicio hace 19 años. El crédito que el solicita es pra comprar material para la elaboración de los zapatos y un mostrador. El sueño de Don Viviano es aumentar su negocio tener mas ventas para brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Viviano is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three children who are in school. He has been producing, repairing, and selling shoes for 19 years. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a countertop and materials for making shoes. Don Viviano dreams of expanding his business so that he can generate more sales to provide his family a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes & a work countertop

loans.name: Evelyn Cristina

texts.es:
la sra. Evelyn Cristina A. F. se dedica al comercio cuenta con  una venta de productos lácteos,  paletas y chorizos, su negocio esta ubicado en el barrio Las Lomitas, del Municipio de El Paraíso, La sra. A. tiene mas de 7 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, a ganado mucha experiencia y por lo tanto buena clientela siendo sus clientes los vecinos de su domicilio y de colonias cercanas a su comunidad.
el credito lo utilizara para surtir su negocio en lo que es la compra de materiales para fabricar las paletas, lácteos y carnes para elaborar chorizos y asi cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ventas y así lograr mejores ganancias para mejorar sus condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Evelyn Cristina A. F. sells dairy products, popsicles, and chorizo sausages. Her business is located in the neighborhood of Las Lomitas in the city of El Paraíso. Evelyn has been in business for more than seven years and has gained much experience. She has a good customer base that consists of neighbors who live near her home and other people from the areas surrounding her community.

This loan will be used to restock her business. She plans to buy supplies for making popsicles, dairy products, and meats used in making chorizo sausages so that she can meet the demand of her customers. This will allow her to improve her sales and earn more income to provide better living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, sugar, disposable cups, popsicle sticks, dairy products, and meats for making chorizo

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gerarda De La Asuncion

texts.es: Gerarda tiene 49 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es a la venta de hamacas y una pulpería, Gerarda fue ayudante de su mama cuando este trabajo elaborando hamacas, pues con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado realizar los financiamientos que tiene hasta el momento, pues siempre le ha gustado su actividad. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para la compra de  golosinas, refrescos, pan, jugos, galletas entre otras cosas. Sueña con mantener el negocio activo.
texts.en:
Gerarda, 49, makes hammocks and has a grocery store. She helped her mother when she made hammocks and as time went by got loans that made it possible for her to continue with this work that she enjoys very much.
