She is asking for funding to buy stock items like: snacks, beverages, bread, juices, cookies, etc. She dreams with keeping this business active.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, D. 43 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía D. su esposo y sus 5 hijos.Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las tareas del campo, y en la actualidad cultiva papa, maíz y habas en sus terrenos que son propios, y comercializa sus cosechas a los mayoristas D. la ciudad. Además paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta  periódica D. animales; después D. varios meses D. engordarlos y cuidarlos, los traslada  a la feria ganadera D. su ciudad, para venderlos a buen precio. Considera que la venta D. animales es más rentable porque  hay un mejor movimiento económico D. dinero, a comparación D. la agricultura, en la cual debe esperar un tiempo para esperar los  resultados.Es la oportunidad número 14 que tiene  un crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además  agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será muy útil en el  progreso D. su negocio.El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. varias  ovejas, pues tiene planeado continuar  vendiendo animales, y espera así obtener buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Carmen, 43, lives in her own home with her husband and their 5 children. She has been connected her entire life to rural work, and currently grows potatoes, corn and beans on her own lands, selling her crops to city wholesalers. She also periodically sells animals; after having fattened and cared for them for several months, she takes them to the livestock market in her city to sell them for a profit. She feels that the animal sales are more profitable, providing a better cash return than crops, where she has to wait so long to see the results. This is her 14th loan through MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She is very grateful to all the people who have maD. this loan possible, as it will be very useful for the progress of her business. She will invest the loan funds to purchase several sheep, as she intends to continue selling livestock, and hopes to obtain good results.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Filipense Group

texts.es:
El grupo Filipense está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas una de ellas es Karla Patricia R. R. quien vende tortillas y nacatamales. Ella aprendió este negocio con una tía  a la cual le ayudaba. 
R. tiene tres niños de 6, 13 y 14 años los cuales le ayudan en el negocio. Ella invertirá el crédito en materia prima como maíz y en los ingredientes para los nacatamales.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Damaris del Carmen Joaquín M. vende helados, fresco, ropa y chinelas, además cose y Reyna Isabel Acantara comercializa fresco, helado y repochetas.
texts.en:
The Filipense Group consists of three hardworking and determined women. One of them is Karla Patricia R. R. who sells tortillas and nacatamales. She learned this business from an aunt who helps her. Karla has three children (ages 14, 13, and 6) who also help with the business. She will invest her loan in supplies such as corn and other ingredients used in making nacatamales.

Her fellow group members include Damaris del Carmen Joaquín M. who sews and also sells ice cream, soft drinks, clothing, and slippers. Reyna Isabel A. sells soft drinks, ice cream, and “repochetas” (Nicaraguan appetizers similar to quesadillas).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn & other ingredients

loans.name: Jessica Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Jessica de 23 años de edad forma parte del banco comunal Las Cumbres en el puerto de Manta, está casada por ahora no tiene hijos por un problema de salud, pero no descarta la posibilidad de ser madre en algún momento.

El esposo de nuestra socia Jessica es de la ciudad de Esmeraldas se radicó en la provincia de Manabí cuando se caso, el tiene como negocio una ebanistería cuenta con su propio taller, realiza trabajo como mesas, puertas en fino acabado, también tiene un camión de mudanza y lo contratan  fuera de la ciudad.  La señora Jessica es una profesional se graduó de físico matemática pero nunca ejerció su carreara, ella no se quedo con los brazos cruzados porque tomó la iniciativa de vender productos de Avon y tener una tienda en su propia casa, el negocio de Avon lo tiene desde hace 2 años, la manera de vender es recorriendo la cuidad y vendiendo a sus amigas y conocidos del sector, dejando a crédito.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Jessica podrá invertir en sus negocios, una parte en los productos de Avon como perfumes, shampoo y maquillaje y surtir su tienda como en arroz, aceites, azúcar y demás productos necesarios, el sueño de nuestra socia es poder incrementar su negocio y poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jessica is 23 years old and is a member of the Las Cumbres (The Summits) Communal Bank, located in the port city of Manta. She is married and does not yet have any children due to a health problem, but she thinks she might like to be a mother in the future. Jessica's husband is originally from the city of Esmeraldas, but moved to Manabi province when they married. He has his own cabinet-making workshop, where he makes finely finished doors, tables and other items. He also has a moving truck, so he is often hired to work outside the city. Jessica has a professional degree in mathematical physics, but she has never worked in this field. However, she has never sat still, and took the initiative to start selling Avon products and open a store in her home. She has been selling Avon products for the past 2 years, and travels throughout the city to sell items on credit to her friends and acquaintances. With this loan, Jessica will invest in her businesses. She will use part of the money to buy Avon products like perfume, shampoo and makeup, and the other part to buy more merchandise for her store (like rice, sugar, oil, and other necessary products). Her dreams is to expand her business so that she can earn more in profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy makeup, shampoo, perfume, rice and sugar

loans.name: Ana Melva

texts.es:
Ana Melva es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector Cucungará, una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Cura Mori, un distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre. Se encuentra ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la preparación y venta de chicha y a la crianza y venta de animales. Ana Melva se vale de los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

La chicha es una bebida típica del país elaborada a base de harina de maíz. Se consume desde tiempos ancestrales, actualmente es consumida por los habitantes de zonas rurales en celebraciones y antes de empezar sus faenas, ya que creen que les da fuerza y vigor. Ana Melva prepara la chicha en su vivienda y la ofrece en venta a sus vecinos. Adicionalmente cría animales de corral en su vivienda, al igual que la mayoría de sus vecinos, ellos suelen venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona frecuentemente.

Ana Melva desea adquirir insumos para seguir preparando chicha y alimento balanceado para mejorar la calidad de sus animales. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ana Melva es una mujer que vela siempre por el bienestar de su familia y que trata de esforzarse para sacarlos adelante. Sus vecinos la consideran una persona activa y responsable.
texts.en:
Ana Melva is a 28 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children in the neighborhood of Cucungará, a marginalized urban area in the district of Cura Mori. This district is situated in the province and region of Piura, which is three hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past five years, Ana Melva has been buying and selling “chicha”, as well as raising and selling animals. The income she earns from these activities enables her to help her husband with the family expenses.

Chicha is a traditional Peruvian beverage made of corn that is consumed during ancestral ceremonies. Many people who live in rural areas drink it during parties and before starting their chores since they believe it provides strength and energy. Ana Melva prepares chicha in her home and offers it for sale to her neighbors. Like most of her neighbors, she also raises animals in a pen next to her home and sells them to merchants who frequently visit the area.

Ana Melva wants to acquire supplies for making chicha and purchase balanced feed to improve the quality of her animals. In order to accomplish these goals, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Ana Melva is a woman who always looks out for the welfare of her family and strives to get ahead. Her neighbors consider her to be an active and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making "chicha" & feed for her animals

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: Maria De La Concepción tiene 35 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio pues siempre vende al crédito y de contado por lo que le ha gustado ser una persona muy activa con su negocio, pues ha demostrado ser una persona consciente de lo que debe y le gusta pagar en tiempo y forma, también a pesar de las dificultades que enfrenta como es la falta de tiempo pues tiene que buscar los productos en los departamentos donde los encuentre más favorable. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como pintura de uñas, pintura de labios calzado y ropa interior. Desea realizarles mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
María De La Concepción, 35, sells general merchandise. She has had this business for over 2 years. She sells for both cash and credit and has always enjoyed being very active in her business. She has shown herself to be aware of what she owes and she likes to pay on time despite difficulties she must face like having to travel to other departments where her products are available at better prices. She will use the funds to buy merchandise like: nail polish, lipstick, shoes and underwear. She hopes to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nail polish, lipstick, shoes and underwear.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina, es una mujer muy trabajadora, es separada, vive con su hija en su casa propia. Hace más de 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, para ello posee terrenos de cultivo, asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales, donde diariamente sale al campo para que pasten sus ovejas y vacas que posee. Por lo general recibe la ayuda de su hija en donde la apoya en la venta de animales, también en la venta de los productos que cosecha, como es el cado: de papa y  maíz.  Pero el trabajo en el que más se intensifica es la crianza de animales, puesto que le genera más rentas. Por tal motivo seguirá  trabajando, con el fin de incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene. Este es su catorceavo crédito con MFP y asegura será muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más animales para aumentar la cantidad que tiene ensu establo.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a hard-working woman. She’s separated and lives with her daughter in her own home. She has been a farmer for over 30 years. She owns farmlands and also raises animals. She goes out daily to take her sheep and cows to pasture. Usually, her daughter helps her where animal and crop (potato and corn) sales are concerned. However, it’s the raising of animals that she stresses because this is where profits are higher. This is why she intends to continue working to increase her herd size. This is her 14th loan with MFP and she assures that she will be very responsible with her repayments. She will use the requested funds to buy more animals in order to increase her herd size.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more animals.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Antonia; Nuestra socia es  casada y ella tienen 52 años de edad, Nuestra socia es natural de Angostura, ella alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, La socia es muy buena cocinera, por lo que debido a su buena sazón tiene desde hace 12 años el negocio de venta de comida, Nuestra socia aprovecha el trabajo de su conyugue que es albañil de profesión y este a su vez recibe a diario o mientras están en obras la visita de su esposa a la hora de la comida con su taper  y junto a él sus compañeros de trabajo, ella vende comida a los compañeros de la obra y así se gana la vida. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y todos los ingredientes del mes para seguir cocinando rico, parte de esto la socia solicita para comprar algunos víveres y cosas para su hogar.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the “VIRGEN PURIFICADA – ANGOSTURA communal bank; she lives in Angostura district, Saylla province, Cusco department. Antonia, 52, is married; she’s from Angostura and she is a retail merchant. She’s a good cook and, thanks to her tasty preparations, she has had a food sales business for the past 12 years. She benefits from her husband’s job as a bricklayer and he receives from her every day at his work site a Tupperware with lunch for himself and his coworkers. She sells lunch to his coworkers and this is how she earns a living. She is asking for funds to buy ingredients for the month to continue cooking her delicious meals. Part of the loan will be used to buy some groceries and things for the home. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan because it allows her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life. She also pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals and part for home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase chickens & a freezer

loans.name: Carlos Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. M. M. Carlos Jesus vive en Lujaraja perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene su esposa y un hijo a su cargo. El Sr. M. trabaja como operario de producción en la fábrica IQF del Perú desde hace 6 meses. Vive en casa de sus padres quienes le han cedido una parte de la vivienda para que viva. El Sr. M. solicita el financiamiento para la construcción de un cuarto a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. El Sr. M. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesus Carlos M. M. lives in Lujaraja which is in the Santiago district. He supports his wife and one son. Mr. M. works as a production worker in the IQF factory of Peru where he has been for the past six months. His parents have granted him a part of their home as living quarters. Mr. M. is applying for financing for the building of a room so he may offer a better quality of life to his son. Mr. M. appreciates the support we are able to offer him through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvement

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 48 años, es separada y vive con sus 7 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace más de 30 años, se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, siembra  los cultivos oriundos de su zona como la papa y el maíz, y los comercializa a los mayoristas de la ciudad, que le compran todos sus productos.  Pero lo que mas le genera ganancias es la comercialización de su ganado vacuno y ovino, que lleva periódicamente a la feria  ganadera de su ciudad. Sus hijos la apoyan en las labores, durante  sus ratos libres, y su intensa labor ha permitido que con el paso del tiempo sus ganancias mejoren notablemente. En la actualidad tiene un capital  que le permite obtener más ganancias, y por eso desea seguir creciendo, y además adquirir mayor  cantidad de  animales ya que es su principal capital de trabajo.  Es la oportunidad número 14 que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con los pagos de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Para mas adelante tiene planeado invertir una parte del  dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono que necesita  para su próxima siembra, y la otra parte  la invertirá en la compra de algunas ovejas y  un becerro.
texts.en:
Gloria, 48, is separated and lives at her home, which she owns, with her seven children. For more than 30 years she has been engaged in agricultural work. She plants crops, which are native to her area such as potatoes and corn. She then sells her crops to wholesalers in the city who buy all of her products. But most of her income is generated through marketing her cattle and sheep, which she regularly takes to the city's cattle fair. In their free time, her children help her with her work. Over time, her hard work has made it possible for her to notably increase profits. Currently, Gloria has capital, which allows her to earn more profits. Therefore, she wishes to continue growing and also to acquire a greater number of animals, as this is her main working capital. This is her 14th loan with MFP and she is committed to responsibly making all payments. Also, she thanks all those who made the loan possible. It will be very useful in advancing her business. In the future she plans to invest a portion of the money borrowed to buy several bags of fertilizer, which she will need during the next planting season. The other portion will be put towards buying a few sheep and a calf.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and animals to further her business

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
Doña Luisa es madre de tres hijos, de edad de 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de poder ayudar siempre  a sus hijos. Su negocio es la venta de fritanga que día  a día hace por las tardes para vender, en frente de su casa, bajo un bajarete pone una mesa y sus comida de pollo frito, asado, carne, enchiladas, tajada verde y madura. 

Este negocio lo inicio hace varios años con el objetivo de poder ayudar a su familia a cubrir los gastos básicos de agua, luz y alimentación ya que la canasta Básica esta muy cara, y solo con el salario de su esposo no da. 
Con este préstamo invertirá en mas cantidad de carne, pollo, verduras, para hacer mas fritanga ya que por las ventas bajas a veces no vende toda la comida y es una perdida, es por eso necesita trabajar con mas capital para cubrir la demanda en su pequeño comedor.
Contenta por que a través de estos prestamos ha logrado la inversión.
texts.en:
Luisa, a mother of three, is 44 years old. She is a hard working woman and wants to be able to help her children. She sells the fried food she makes every afternoon just outside her home, where she displays fried chicken, roast, meat, enchiladas and vegetable slices on a table beneath a pergola. She started the business a few years ago to help her family meet water, power and food expenses as everything is very dear and her husband's salary wasn't enough. She will use the loan to buy more meat, chicken and vegetables to make more fried food, because sometimes due to low sales she doesn't sell all the food and it goes to waste so she needs more capital to meet the demand in her small food stand. She is happy because in the past she has managed to use the loans to invest.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, chicken, bananas and coal to increase the range of food she sells

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una madre de familia de 51 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Cura Mori, un distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre. Se encuentra ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayoría de mujeres de la zona se dedica desde hace veinte años a la preparación y venta de chicha y a la crianza y venta de animales. La chicha es una bebida típica del país elaborada a base de harina de maíz. Se consume desde tiempos ancestrales, actualmente es consumida por los habitantes de zonas rurales en celebraciones y antes de empezar sus faenas, ya que creen que les da fuerza y vigor. 

Isabel prepara la chicha en su vivienda dos veces por semana y la ofrece en venta a sus vecinos. Adicionalmente cría animales de corral en su vivienda para venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona con regularidad.

Isabel desea adquirir insumos para seguir preparando chicha y alimento balanceado para mejorar la calidad de sus animales y obtener mayores ganancias al momento de venderlos. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 51 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children in the district of Cura Mori. This district is part of the province and region of Piura, and is located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Like most of the women in the area, Isabel has been preparing and selling “chicha” for twenty years. She also raises and sells animals. Chicha is a traditional Peruvian beverage made of corn and is consumed during ancestral ceremonies. Many people who live in rural areas drink it during parties and before starting their chores since they believe it provides strength and energy.

Isabel prepares chicha twice a week in her home and sells it to her neighbors. She also raises farm animals at home to sell to the merchants who regularly pass through the area. Isabel wants to acquire supplies so that she can continue producing chicha. In addition, she wishes to purchase balanced feed to improve the quality of her animals and generate better earnings when she sells them. In order to accomplish this goal, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making "chicha" & feed for her animals

loans.name: Maria Eddy

texts.es: Maria Eddy tiene 48 años, ella se dedica a la compra, crianza y destace de cerdo. Pues hace más de 30 años que inicio este negocio, pus sus padres se dedicaban a la crianza de cerdos, pues ha sido el negocio familiar que ha permanecido por tanto tiempo pues con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan, para ella es muy importante sacara delante a su familia. Pues tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y tiene que hacerse cargo de ellos. El financiamiento que solicitan es para la compra de cerdos y alimentos pues tiene que mantenerlos muy gordos. Sueña con son de mantener este negocio para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Eddy, 48, earns her living buying, raising and butchering pigs. It has been 30 years since she began this business. Her parents also raised pigs for a living, thus it has been the family business and has lasted for such a long time due to considerable effort. She is always attentive to her customers' requests and her family's wellbeing is very important to her. She has three children for whom she is responsible and whom she must raise. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of pigs and feed since she must keep them very fat. She dreams of keeping up this business in order to keep up her family.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana de 44 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (lugar con montañas y caminos de tierra) de Guayaquil. Ella tiene una tienda de víveres ya hace algún tiempo la tiene y sus hijos de 17, 14 y 9 años le ayudan después que salen de la escuela. 

Comenzó vendiendo bebidas,  poco a poco con esfuerzo tuvo su pequeña tienda readecuando su casa y la ubico en la sala. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 20h00pm. Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar y leche.  

En el futuro quiere empastar su casa porque esta sin pintar, y surtir mas su tienda para que sea una de las mejores del sector.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old and lives the periurban area of Fortín (a mountainous place with dirt roads) in Guayaquil. She operates a grocery store that she started some time ago and has three children (ages 17, 14, and 9) who help her after they come home from school.

Ana started selling beverages, but with effort over time she remodeled her house and now runs her store out of her living room. She works from 6am until 8pm. In order to increase the inventory of her business, she wants to use her loan to buy rice, sugar, and milk.

In the future, she wants to finish her house since it is lacking paint. She also would like to have a well-stocked store so that it will be one of the best in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es:
A sus 40 años de edad el señor Carlos Adolfo E. M., dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo a desarrollar actividades agropecuarias como la siembra y manejo de cultivos agrícolas como granos básicos ( maíz, sorgo, ajonjolí ) también se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino, y aviar los que constituyen su principal fuente de ingresos, con los que mantiene a su familia y utiliza para financiar sus demás actividades productivas dichas actividades como hice mención ocupan la mayor parte de su tiempo durante el día, su esposa quien le ayuda a percibir cierta cantidad de ingresos al realizar trabajos de costura y vender ropa usada en su comunidad le constituye una gran ayuda para este cliente.
Ambos tienen un sueño el cual es llagar mejorar su casa y poder ayudar a sus dos pequeños hijos a terminar su estudios de secundaria y si es posible universitarios.
texts.en:
At 40 years of age, Sr. Carlos Adolfo E. M. devotes most of his time to farming activities. These include cultivating grains (corn, sorghum, and sesame) as well as raising cattle, pigs, and chickens which comprise the main source of income to support his family and invest in other activities. Farming takes up most of his day. His wife helps earn additional income by sewing and selling used clothing in their community. They both dream of making improvements to their home and helping their two children finish their high school studies and, if possible, move on to university.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other supplies

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel de 30 años de edad casado con casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias del  hogar es propietario de una despensa que cuenta con 3 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos.
El trabaja diariamente como obrero realizando diversas actividades mientras su esposa lo ayuda con la atención del negocio de esta manera ellos logram mantener a su familia con una buena calidad de vida.
El deseo de ellos es seguir trabajando y terminar la construcion de su vivienda.
Esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mercaderías traídas de  Posadas- Argentina que le estaría dejándo mayor margen de ganancia por las  compras  de artículos de limpieza, harina aceite yerba, azúcar, champú, jabón en polvo, etc.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 30 years old, married and owns a comfortable house. He has owned a grocery store for 3 years, which has a good customer base and is a good source of income. He works as labourer doing different jobs and his wife helps him with the running of the business. As a result, their family enjoys a good quality of life. Their wish is to continue to work and finish the construction of their own home. They request a loan to buy merchandise brought from Posadas, Argentina, which leaves them a greater margin from the purchases of cleaning products, flour, oil, herbs, sugar, shampoo, soap powder, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, flour, oil, herbs and cleaning products

loans.name: Marjorie Gisella

texts.es:
Marjorie de 25 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (la originalidad de este lugar fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil.  Ella tiene una tienda de víveres ya hace algún tiempo porque le gusto la atención al cliente. 

Comenzó vendiendo arroz en quintal,  poco a poco con esfuerzo tuvo su pequeña tienda readecuando su casa y la ubico afuera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm. Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo legumbres y bebidas. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa para darle una mejor vida a su única hija.
texts.en:
Marjorie, 25, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil called Orquideas (a name that comes from the fields of orquids that were once abundant here). She has operated a general business for some years and likes that she can provide a service to her customers. She began selling bulk quantities of rice and slowly built her store, first at a space in her house and later in a separate space. She works for 8:00am to 10:00pm. She will use the loan to stock her business with vegetables and drinks. In the future, she would like to finish building her house so that she can give her daughter a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Diego Boanerge

texts.es: Diego Boanerge tiene 55 años, su actividad es compra y venta de chatarra. Hace más de 5 años que tiene esta actividad pues anteriormente trabajaba en la alcaldía en donde se enfermo y decide con sus pocos ahorros comprar una camioneta e iniciara esta actividad, pues le ha sido muy útil ya que sus hijos 4 están a su cargo y que junto a su esposa los han sacado adelante proporcionándoles estudios. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de chatarra. Para el futuro quiere aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
55-year old Diego Boanerge buys and sells scrap metal. He’s had this job for more than five years; he used to work for city hall, but he became ill so decided to use the small amount of money he had saved to buy a truck and start the scrap metal business. It’s done well, so he and his wife have managed to give their four children a good start in life and educate them too. The loan he is asking for is to buy scrap metal. In the future he wishes to increase his working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy scrap metal

loans.name: Francisco Vidal

texts.es:
el sr. Francisco Vidal S. M. se dedica a la venta de medicina popular desde hace mas de 4 años aunque tiene una experiencia de mas de 40 años en diferentes tipos de negocios,  anteriormente  a esta actividad nos comento que tenia un puesto de venta de abarrotaría en el mercado, su producto lo distribuye de forma domiciliar y ambulante en las diferentes aldeas y comunidades vecinas al municipio de Las Trojes.
Su negocio le es rentable ya que la mayor parte de los medicamentos que el compra los adquiere en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa donde se compra a un buen precio lo que le permite tener mejores ganancias.
Gracias a ello el cubre sus gastos personales y otras obligaciones que tiene.
La demanda de sus productos ha crecido, es para eso que utilizara el credito, para invertir mas medicamentos y de esta manera satisfacer a su clientela.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco Vidal S. M. has operated a business selling natural medicines for more than 4 years. He has, though, more than 40 years experience operating different kinds of businesses. He tells us that before he started this business, he operated a stand selling basic grocery products at a local market. He now works as a street vendor, selling door-to-door and on the streets of Las Trojes. His business is profitable because he buys the majority of his products in Tegucigalpa where prices are low. The income from the business allows him to cover his personal expenses and the other obligations that he has. Demand for his products has increased and, consequently, he will use the loan to buy more natural medicines so that he can meet the demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 40 años, comparte su vida con esposo y sus 3 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 20 años se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, actividad que desarrolla con la ayuda de sus esposo e hijos. Es así que diariamente salen al campo a pastar a sus animales a su vez que también trabajan en sus campos agrícolas, cultivando papa y maíz. Su mercado son las ferias ganaderas, por ello, previamente a cebado a sus animales para asegurar una buena venta. Para Gladys y su familia, le es más rentable la venta de animales, debido a que no hay mucho riesgo en perder, ya sea por factores climáticos o por plagas. Por esta razón, que continuara desarrollándose en esta actividad. Este es su catorceavo crédito con MFP y por tal será responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de animales como ovejas y toros.
texts.en:
Gladys is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in their own house. For more than twenty years she has worked in agriculture and raised livestock, a job that she does with help from her husband and children. Every day they go out to their fields so the animals can graze there, and they also work on their farm where they grow potatoes and corn. Gladys sells the animals at the livestock markets once they have been fattened up so she can get a good price for them. It is a profitable business for Gladys and her family as there’s not much risk involved, just weather and disease. For this reason she is continuing with this venture. This is Gladys’ fourteenth loan with Kiva partner MFP so she will make the repayments as promised. With the money she is going to buy animals such as sheep and bulls.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheep and a bull

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: Casilda, D.  58 años, vive con el menor D. sus 7 hijos en su casa que es  propia.DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a las diversas tareas del campo, y en la actualidad comercializa ganado ovino que ella misma y su hijo  llevan a pastear al campo y también les brindan el cuidado necesario  en su establo. La manera D. trabajar D. Casilda es la siguiente, adquiere becerros, los alimenta, hasta que  obtienen un buen peso, y luego los venD.  en su mercado local.  Además cultiva papa y maíz, principalmente venD. a los mayoristas D. la ciudad.  Para ella es mucho más rentable la venta D. animales, que el cultivo, por lo que ha decidido incrementar la cantidad D. animales que tiene en la actualidad.Es la oportunidad número 14 que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será muy responsable en el pago D. sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que  le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio.Casilda tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D. varios sacos D. abono y también en  la compra D. cantidad D. ovejas para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Casilda, 58, lives with the youngest of her seven children in her own home. Since childhood she has labored in the various activities of the countrysiD., and currently sells sheep that she herself and her son take to graze in the countrysiD. as well as providing the necessary care in their stable. Casilda's work method is the following: she purchases lambs, feeds them until they have achieved a good weight, and then sells them in her local market. In addition she grows potatoes and corn which she mainly sells to wholesalers from the city. She has found it much more profitable to sell animals than cultivate crops, so she has decided to increase the number of animals she currently has. This is the 14th opportunity she has had to get a loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible in making her payments. She also thanks everyone who maD. the loan possible, as it will be very helpful to her in the progress of her business. Casilda plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of some bags of manure and also in the purchase of a number of sheep in order to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase manure and sheep for her business

loans.name: Santos Clementina

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Clementina M. H. se dedica a la venta de leche y sus derivados, tiene mas de 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su negocio funciona en su casa de habitación que esta ubicada en la Col. Brisas del Poteca del municipio de Las Trojes.  También renta cuartos y esta construyendo dos cuartos mas, su negocio le es rentable y con los ingresos que obtiene cubre los gastos personales.
el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para mejorar y terminar los cuartos que esta haciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos Clementina M. H. has operated a business selling milk and dairy products for more than 6 years. She operates the business at her house in Col. Brisas del Poteca neighborhood of Las Trojes. She also rents rooms and is building two more rooms. Her business is profitable and her income covers her personal expenses, etc. She will use the loan to buy materials to complete and improve the rooms that she rents.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for room-rental business.

loans.name: Carmen Yesenia

texts.es:
Carmen de 28 años, vive en las Orquídeas (la originalidad de este lugar fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil, es madre soltera y tiene un salón de belleza. 

Aprendió a ser estilista desde pequeña cuando veía a su mama cortar cabello, cuando creído y tuvo su hija tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en una peluquería para hacer lo que le gustaba y tener dinero. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener mas incremento de clientela necesita tener mas materiales por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar tratamientos de cabellos, secadora y plancha para alisados. En el futuro quiere incrementar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 28, lives in Las Orquídes (this place is named this way because the countryside had a lot of orchids) in Guayaquil. She is a single mother, and she has a beauty salon. She learned to be a stylist when she was little and she watched her mother cut hair. When she was grown she had her daughter. She had to invest her savings in a hair salon in order to do what she likes and to have money. She now works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. everyday. In order to have more customers she needs to have more materials. She wants to use the loan to buy hair treatments, a dryer, and an iron for straightening. In the future she wants to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hair treatments, a dryer, and an iron

loans.name: Yaira Lisbeth

texts.es:
La señora Yaira es soltera no tiene hijos forma parte del banco comunal Las Cumbres en la ciudad de Manta, hace algún tiempo atrás mantenía una relación pero se separó, ahora vive en casa de su ex cuñada quien le ha apoyó en sus momentos difíciles.

La actividad de nuestra socia  es la venta de comida rápida comparte el negocio con otras personas, por semana invierte un capital de cien dólares, compra carne, chorizo y demás alimentos necesarios, le ha ido muy bien en todo este tiempo y está muy agradecida con la Fundación por los créditos recibidos.

La señora Yaira con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir todo el dinero en su negocio, cuenta que tiene gran demanda en sus ventas ya que los clientes del local son fijos, tanto así que trabaja todo los días y noches vendiendo más de 50 chuzos ( carne en palito).

 El sueño de nuestra socia es poder terminar sus estudios ya que solo logró llegar hasta el quinto grado de la escuela.
texts.en:
Yaira is single and has no children. She is part of the communal bank Las Cumbres [The Mountaintops] in the city of Manta. Some time ago she was in a relationship but separated. Now she lives in the home of her ex sister-in-law who has supported her during difficult times. Our associate is in the fast food business in a venture she shares with others. She invests a weekly capital of 100 dollars in order to buy meat, sausage and other necessary ingredients. It has been going very well for her this entire time and she is very grateful to the Foundation for the loans she has received. Yaira will be able to invest the entire amount of this loan in her business. She reports that there is a strong demand in her business since the area customers are regulars, so much so that she works every day, all day and evening, selling over 50 chuzos (meat on a stick). Our associate's dream is to be able to finish her studies since she was only able to get to the fifth grade in school.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat, sausage, potatoes and rice

loans.name: Alba Libenia

texts.es:
la sra. Alba Libenia V. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia que esta ubicada en su casa de habitación en el Barrio Alfonso XIII del Municipio de Trojes. Tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.  se ve notablemente que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar y ganarse la clientela por la atención que les brinda.
Alba es casada tiene dos hijos.
Los ingresos que percibe de este negocio los a ido reinvirtiendo en su negocio aumentando poco a poco el volumen del mismo, su esposo tiene un taller de pintura automotriz y de esta forma se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante.  
el credito lo utilizara en la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio ya que teniendo un mejor surtido sin duda vendería mas, lo que le permitiría obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Alba is married and has 2 children. She sells popular consumer products from her small general store, located in her home in Barrio Alfonso XIII, in Trojes municipality. She has done this for 2 years. It is noteworthy that during this time she has learned administration and earned a clientèle by the attention she offers. The income Alba earns has been reinvested in the business, augmenting little by little, the volume of trade. Her husband has an automobile paint shop and in this way they mutually contribute to getting ahead. The loan will be used to buy merchandise to expand her business, since having a better selection will undoubtedly lead to more sales, permitting her to obtain more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING GROCERIES, INCLUDING RICE, OIL, BEANS, ETC., AND A VARIETY OF OTHER MERCHANDISE TO EXPAND HER GENERAL STORE

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Karina Yuniethz

texts.es: Karina Yuniethz tiene 35 años, su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 12 años que tiene esta actividad, pues ella vende en el mercado en donde tiene muchos clientes que visitan en su local, por lo que a pesar de sus enfermedades ha sabido muy bien cómo manejar su negocio, pues la buena administración es elemental. Se levanta temprano todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, momento en el que dejan de circular clientes. El financiamiento es para la compra de leche, cuajada, queso, crema y leche agria. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Karina Yuniethz is 35, and she sells dairy products. For over 12 years she has been doing this, and she sells in the market where she has many customers who visit her location. Despite her illnesses she has managed her business very well, as good administration is vital. She gets up early every day and works from 7 am to 5 pm, when customers stop circulating. The loan is for the purchase of milk, curd, cheese, cream and buttermilk. She wants to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
Juan Miguel tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive junto a su familia en el sector Cucungará, una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Cura Mori, un distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre. Se encuentra ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se gana la vida desde hace seis años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, el suele criar ganado ovino y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

Adicionalmente también trabaja preparando y vendiendo chicha en su domicilio. La chicha es una bebida típica del país elaborada a base de harina de maíz. Se consume desde tiempos ancestrales, actualmente es consumida por los habitantes de zonas rurales en celebraciones y antes de empezar sus faenas, ya que creen que les da fuerza y vigor. Juan Miguel prepara esta bebida tres veces por semana y la ofrece en venta a sus vecinos.

Juan Miguel desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentación de sus animales y venderlos a un mejor precio, asimismo desea adquirir insumos para seguir preparando chicha. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Juan Miguel es un joven honesto y trabajador, su mayor anhelo es dar lo mejor de si para lograr que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Miguel, age 27, is single and does not have children. He lives with his family in the Cucungará sector. This is an urban zone in the area outlying the Cura Mori district. The district belongs to the Piura province in the region of the same name. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For six years he has made his living raising and selling small animals that are located in the back part of his house. He usually raises sheep. When they have grown enough he sells them to the businessmen who always visit the area where he lives. He also works preparing and selling “chicha” in his home. “Chicha” is a drink typical to the country. It is made from a base of corn flour. It has been consumed since ancestral times. It is currently consumed by the inhabitants of rural zones during celebrations and before starting their work. They believe that it gives them strength and vigor. Juan Miguel prepares this drink three times a week, and he sells it to his neighbors. Juan Miguel wants to get balanced feel to improve the food for his animals and sell them for a better price. He also wants to get supplies to continue making chicha. In order to achieve his objected he has requested, for the first time, a loan for 800 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Juan Miguel is an honest and hard-working young man. His greatest wish is to give the best of himself so that his family will have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced feed in order to improve raising animals to sell

loans.name: Ximena Del Rocio

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Ximena es soltera y es  maestra de dibujo técnico en un colegio de la localidad de Manta primer puerto atunero del País, Ximena de 33 años de edad también tiene como actividad un bus escolar y se dedica al comercio informal de ropa.

Ximena esta muy agradecida con la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación con los créditos ya que con ellos ha podido mejorar su condición económica, como maestra tiene 3 años y sabe distribuir muy bien su tiempo para sus demás actividades, cuenta que en la mañana esta en el colegio  se da tiempo para salir a recoger a los alumnos en su bus escolar y el negocio de la ropa lo vende en el mismo colegio y a sus amigas del sector donde vive.

Con este nuevo crédito la señorita Ximena viajara a comprar mercadería para surtir su negocio, ira hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil, allí  tiene un lugar donde le venden con precio al por mayor para poder obtener mejores ganancias, tiene varios pedidos por entregar como pantalones, blusas e interiores,  esta segura que con este crédito podrá adquirir todo lo necesario para seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Ximena is single and a technical drawing teacher in a school in the Manta locality, the country’s first tuna fishing port. Ximena, 33 years old, also drives a school bus and has an informal business selling clothes. Ximena is very grateful for the opportunity that the Foundation provides through the loans. With the loans, she has been able to improve her financial situation. She has been a teacher for 3 years and knows how to allocate her time well among her activities. She explains that in the morning she is in the school, which gives her time to leave to pick up the students in the school bus. She sells clothes for her business in the same school and to her friends in the area where she lives. With this new loan, Ximena will travel to the city Guayaquil to purchase merchandise to stock her business. In this city, she can purchase things at the best prices to allow her to make the highest profits. She has several requests to fulfill for items such as pants, blouses, and undergarments. She is certain that with this loan, she will be able to obtain everything necessary to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pants, undergarments, blouses, t-shirts

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Estela ya tiene 8 años trabajando en su bodega,  algo que ha logrado con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo incansable sus inicios con el negocio no fueron nada fáciles empezó vendiendo en la puerta D. un colegio como ambulante y  con muy pocas cosas para vender ahorrando D. a pocos logro tener una bodega también considera que  pertenecer a “EDAPROSPO” fue D. mucha ayuda por que mediante sus prestamos pudo invertir en mercadería.
Durante todo este tiempo ha logrado tener una bodega mas granD. y surtida, también ha podido ayudar en la educación D. sus hijos para que sean profesionales, lo que mas desea para el futuro es mantener su bodega y surtirla con todo, su actual préstamo lo usara abastecerse D. mercadería, Estela ya tiene 1 año y medio en el grupo “MUJERES  RUMBO AL PROGRESO “es la tesorera y junto a sus compañeras  tratan D. salir adelante en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
Sra. Estela has been working in her grocery store for three years. She has succeeded with a lot of effort and ceaseless work.

The beginnings of her business were not easy. She began selling at the gate of a high school on an itinerant basis with very few things to sell. Saving small sums she succeeded in opening a shop and also considered joining EDAPROSPO, which provided a lot of help through loans she was able to invest in inventory.

She has succeeded in having a bigger and better stocked store. She has also been able to help with the education of her children so that they are professionals. What she wants for the future is to maintain her shop and stock it with all that it needs. She will use her current loan to supply it with merchandise. For a year and a half Estela has been a member of the “MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO “(Women Bound for Progress). She is the treasurer, and she and her colleagues try to make progress with their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia Maria tiene 33 años, ella se dedica a la venta de pollo, embutidos entre otros productos. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio con su Mama con una pequeña pulpería con el tiempo logro hacerse cargo personalmente del negocio pues con mucho esmero y esfuerzo que ha depositado en este negocio ha logrado sacar adelante esta actividad. Este crédito será para comprar pollo, salchichas, entre otras cosas. En un futuro desea establecer su negocio en donde circulen muchos clientes.
texts.en: Claudia Maria is 33 years old. For more than 4 years she has been selling different products, notably chicken and sausages. She started this business with her mother, running a small corner shop, and in time she succeeded in taking personal charge of the shop, and with the great care and effort she has put into her business she has succeeded in getting her shop off the ground. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy chicken and sausages among other products. In the future she wishes to set up her shop in an area with many customers. [[[Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura, pero desD. hace 4 años aproximadamente se dedica a la venta D. granos en las ferias comerciales que son aledañas a su comunidad. Es así que obtiene las ganancias por semana, además cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo y sus hijos. Su forma D. adquirir la mercadería es a través D. sus vecinos que son agricultores. El ver que este negocio es rentable, seguirá trabajando con miras a incrementar su capital D. trabajo. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, será muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. mas mercadería y D. esa manera incrementara su capital.
texts.en:
Dominga is 58 years old, she lives with her husband and her two children in a house she owns. She has been dedicating herself to agriculture since she was a child, but approximately 4 years ago she started selling grains in the traD. fairs bordering her community. This is how she earns a weekly wage, and she can also count on the help of her husband and children. She buys her products from her neighbors who are farmers. As this business has proved to be profitable, she will keep on working in this field, as her aim is to increase her working capital. This is the first time she has requested a loan to MFP. She will be very responsible with her payments and she is thankful to the people who will manage the loan she is requesting, which will be very useful to make her business grow. The loan will be used to buy more products and increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Asunción Del Socorro

texts.es:
Asunción del Socorro L. Álvarez de 30 años inicio en el 2002 con un pequeño canasto de caramelo el cual poco a poco y con arduo trabajo fue mejorando su negocio hasta poner una pequeña venta. Ella con el préstamo tiene pensado seguir mejorando su negocio logrando con mucho esfuerzo el sueño de convertir su negocio en una miscelánea.
L. es una señora que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo tanto económico, moral y laboral con el cual procreo tres hijos de catorce, ocho y tres años quienes son su razón de ser.
texts.en:
Asuncion del Socorro, who is 30 years old, started in business in 2002 with a small box of caramels, and little by little, and with arduous labor, she improved her business, finally launching a small store. With this loan she plans to continue improving the business, achieving with much effort, her dream of converting her business into a variety store. Asuncion del Socorro is a woman who can count on the help of her husband, economic as well as moral, and with labor. They have 3 children, 14, 8, and 3 years old, who are her reason for being.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING BASIC GRAINS, SWEETS, AND A VARIETY OF OTHER MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: Angela Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Ángela es socia del banco comunal Las Cumbres desde 3 ciclos, este banco se reúne en la ciudad de Manta cada quinde días, sus socias son muy responsables a la hora de hacer sus pagos, y la señora Ángela lo podría ser la excepción.

Nuestra socia tiene como actividad la venta informal de ropa interior, sabanas, pantalones buzos de hombres y ropa de niños, para poder surtir su negocio le toca viajara a otras ciudades donde se encuentran los grandes mayoristas viaja cada quince días. Está separada y sus dos hijas son independientes de ella, para nuestra socia las cosas no han sido de total felicidad, porque ha tenido que enfrentarse a problemas de salud, se sometió a una cirugía que la imposibilitó por un tiempo y tuvo que estar alejada de sus ventas, ahora ya ha recuperado a sus clientas que en su gran mayoría se encuentran en la parroquia de Tarqui.

  Este nuevo crédito podrá surtir  su negocio en ropa de niños, sabanas y toallas, el sueño de nuestra socia es  tener un bazar completo de mercadería para así dejar de recorrer las calles porque su salud no está nada bien, con las ganancias tiene que seguir comprando medicinas para continuar con los  tratamientos.
texts.en:
Sra. Ángela is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Cumbres” (The Summits) for three loan cycles. This bank meets in the city of Manta every fifteen days. The members are very responsible when submitting their payments and Sra. Ángela is no exception.

Ángela has an informal business selling undergarments, bed sheets, trousers, men’s sweatshirts, and children’s clothing. In order to restock her business, she travels to other cities to buy from the large wholesalers every fifteen days. She is separated from her husband and her two daughters live independently. Things have not been completely happy for Ángela because she has had to deal with health problems. She underwent surgery which made life impossible for a while, so she was not able to make sales. Now that she has recovered, she is able to meet with her customers who mostly live in the parish of Tarqui.

This new loan will be used to restock her business with children’s clothing, bed sheets, and towels. Her dream is to have a bazaar full of merchandise so that she can stop walking through the streets since her health is still not good. Her earnings will be used to buy medicines she needs to continue her treatment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children’s clothing, bed sheets, and towels

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es: Luisa Emilia tiene la venta de cuajadas, hace más de 15 años que tiene esta actividad ya que la mayoría de sus clientes viven en comarcas más lejanas así ellos pueden llegar a visitar a Luisa por lo que los recibe muy contenta además ellos siempre hablan de la buena atención que brinda, a pesar de tener ciertas en su vivienda desea realizarles mejorar con algunas ganancias que obtenga. El crédito será invertido en la compra de cremas y cuajada que es lo que más demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luisa Emilia has been selling cuajadas (a sort of junket made with milk curd) for more than 15 years. The majority of her customers lives in distant rural areas, and they come visit Luisa who always welcomes them with a smile; moreover they speak in very good terms of the good care with which she tend to them. Besides having some in her house, she also wishes to produce them and improve her life with part of the income she will gain. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy creams and cuajadas, the products her customers request more.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of nutrients and seeds necessary for the production of peppers

loans.name: María Liliana

texts.es:
María Liliana tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, vive en el distrito de Cura Mori, un distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre. Se encuentra ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se gana la vida desde hace tres años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, María cría ovejas  y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

Adicionalmente también trabaja preparando y vendiendo chicha en su domicilio. La chicha es una bebida típica del país elaborada a base de harina de maíz. Se consume desde tiempos ancestrales, actualmente es consumida por los habitantes de zonas rurales en celebraciones y antes de empezar sus faenas, ya que creen que les da fuerza y vigor. 

María desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentación de sus ovejas y venderlas a un mejor precio, asimismo desea adquirir insumos para seguir preparando chicha. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer luchadora y que siempre da lo mejor se si para sacar adelante a sus hijos, su mayor anhelo es verlos convertidos en personas de bien y exitosas.
texts.en:
María Liliana is 21 years old and is the single mother of two children. She lives in the district of Cura Mori, in the Piura province of the Piura region. Cura Mori is located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. María has earned a living for three years raising and selling small animals in pens located in the back of her home. She raises sheep and when they have reached a good size she sales them to buyers who frequently come to the area where she lives. She also works out of her home making and selling chicha. Chicha is a traditional beverage of the country produced from maize flour. Its been consumed since ancient times. Nowadays, it is consumed by inhabitants of rural areas during celebrations and before starting the day's labors, as they believe it gives them strength and energy. María wants to buy well-balanced feed to improve the diet of her sheep so that they can be sold at a better price. Also, she wants to buy ingredients to continue making chicha. To achieve her goal, she has requested her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of $200. María is a fighter and always gives her best to bring up her children. Her greatest desire is to see them become good and successful people.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animal feed to better raise animals which are to be sold.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca Rosa
texts.en: Blanca Rosa

loans.use: Raw materials like flour, sugar, and leavening, etc.

loans.name: Cleida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Cleida ella tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores la socia se dedica a administrar su tienda de abarrotes y a la crianza de animales menores, ella tiene cuyes y pollos, gallinas; La socia no vende sus animales, es para consumo. La socia sale en la foto junto a su asesor, ella está muy feliz de pertenecer a este banco comunal. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche al por mayor para la tienda abarrotes. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Banco Comunal Virgen Purificada - Angostura (Purified Virgin Communal Bank, Angostura). She lives in the Angostura district, located in Saylla, a province of the Cusco region. Her name is Cleida, she is 35 years old, she is married and has 2 young children. She dedicates herself to the managing of her grocery store and to the breeding of small animals: cuyes (Quechua for Guinea pigs), roosters and hens. She doesn't sell her animals, she breeds them for personal consumption. The man with her in the picture is her adviser, and she is very happy to be a member of this communal bank. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as rice, sugar, noodles and milk in bulk for her grocery store. She deeply values and is immensely grateful for the loan received, as this will help her improving her business and the quality of her life; at the same time, she commits to repaying her dues respecting the set deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Francy De La Concepción

texts.es:
Francy de la Concepción V.  O. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora. Ella 1993 inicio con poco capital a comercializar ropa usada luego con forme fue creciendo e invirtió en cosméticos de la marca Avon y Zermat, calzado y  ropa nueva.
Ella sueña con tener su propio local ya que ella vende de manera ambulante junto con su hija de 13 años quien le ayuda en el comercio después de clases.
texts.en:
Francy de la Concepción V. O. is a hard-working, dedicated, and enterprising woman. In 1993 she used a small amount of capital to start selling used clothes. Later, her business was growing and she invested in Avon and Zermant brands of cosmetics, footwear, and new clothes. She dreams of having her own place because she sells on foot. She sells with her 13 year old daughter, who helps her with the business after classes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics, clothes, and footwear

loans.name: Edita

texts.es: Edita, de 50 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa que es  propia.Desde hace más de 30 años, se dedica a las labores agrícolas, siembra papa y alverja, y en la actualidad sus hijos le  ayudan en esta tarea, cuando su cosecha esta lista la vende a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica también a la atención en  una pequeña tienda, trabaja durante todas las mañanas, y luego se va casi todo el día a  pastear a sus animales en el campo. Después de casi  2 meses de cuidar a sus becerros los vende en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Edita cuenta que el engorde  de sus animales requiere de mayor  tiempo, pero de todos modos  la venta de animales le genera mas rentas, por lo que ha decidido continuar con esta actividad e incrementar su  capital de trabajo.Es la oportunidad número 13 que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Para mas adelante tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de algunos becerros  y también adquirirá  abono  que necesita para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Edita is 50 years old and lives with her 2 children in a house that she owns. She has been farming for over 30 years. She grows potatoes and peas. Currently, her children help her with this. When her harvest is ready she sells it to wholesalers in the city. In addition to this, every morning she runs a small store, . Then, almost everyday, she goes to let her animals out to graze in the field. After almost 2 months of caring for her calves she sells them at the cattle market in her area. Edita realizes that the fattening of her animals requires more time, but of all of her jobs, the sale of animals generates the most income. Because of this she has decided to continue this activity and increase her working capital. This will be her 13th loan with MFP. She is committed to being responsible with her payments. Edita is grateful to everyone who has made this loan possible as it will be very useful in the advancement of her business. She plans to use the loan to buy more calves and fertilizer that she needs for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Melchora ella tiene 51 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos la socia estudio solo hasta la primaria completa y por motivos económicos no pudo continuar sus estudios;  La socia se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, la socia trabaja junto a su esposo en el campo cultivando diferentes variedades de papa y maíz, La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y vive en Saylla, ella y su esposo venden lo que producen a los diferentes restaurantes de la zona y en Cusco casa por casa en los barrios residenciales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de abono, semillas y limpiar el terreno para una nueva cosecha.
 
La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank Virgen Purificada - Angostura . She lives in the Angostura district in the Saylla Province in the department of Cusco. Señora Melchora is 51 years old. She is married and has 4 children. For economic reasons she did not study past primary school. She farms and raises animals for a living. She is a very hard-working woman and she lives in Saylla. She and her husband work together in the field growing different varieties of potatoes and corn. Together they sell what they produce to the different restaurants in the region and door to door in the residential neighborhoods of Cusco. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and to help clear the land for a new crop. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan since this will allow her business to grow and improve her quality of life. She is committed to repaying the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and to clear the land for a new crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy something for his home (kitchen)

loans.name: José

texts.en:
José T. B. is a 52-year-old pepper farmer and father of six who lives in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles de San Carlos, located in northern Costa Rica. The rural zone where José and his family live is one of the few places in Costa Rica without running water; the family must pump water from a nearby well as needed. José is working hard towards the sustenance of his family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labor.

José is a dedicated farmer and father. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvest of tabasco and cayenne peppers. He works in cooperation with his wife to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land they work is their own.

In addition to his agricultural activity, José works at a local orange-processing factory as a harvesting laborer in order to supplement his family’s income. The money he earns helps pay bills for electricity and food.

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which José and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All members of the Coquital community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of tabasco and cayenne peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of seedlings and necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by José with the help of his family members. José will need roughly one year before his peppers reach maturity and are ready for harvest.

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Coquital, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

In general, the work day is divided into mornings and afternoons. In the mornings, the domestic tasks are carried out such as cooking, cleaning and sending the children to school. Afternoons are generally dedicated to harvesting, planting, and working the land as needed. José spends some days working as a laborer in the nearby orange-processing factory but this work is sporadic.

José says the main factor that has stood in the way of increasing his production levels has been the Costa Rican government and various other institutions. Formal banks, lending agencies and government bodies have failed to recognize the producers of the Coquital region as legitimate producers, worthy of financial and governmental support and services. 

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA, represents a unique opportunity to José, his family and his community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, José wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented; he wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of peppers

loans.name: Yisel María

texts.es:
Yesel María P. R.  es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien hace dos años invirtió en  una comideria la cual  ha ido creciendo actualmente trabajan tres señores y  ella y su esposo.  Ella sueña con mejorar su negocio y seguir progresando hasta lograr cumplir su sueño tener un cadena de restaurantes de comida rápida.
P. con el crédito compra la materia prima para su negocio desde granos básicos, carne, repollo, lechuga etc.
texts.en:
Yesel is a hard-working, strong and enterprising woman. Two years ago, she invested in a restaurant which has been growing. Today, Yesel, her husband and three other women work there. She dreams of improving her business and progressing until fulfilling her dreams of having a chain of fast-food restaurants. With the loan, she will buy raw materials for her business, such as grains, meat, cabbage, lettuce, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials such as grains, meat, etc.

loans.name: Ediltruidis Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ediltrudis Del Socorro de 30 años,  tiene dos hijos un taller de costura. Hace mucho tiempo como ella no tenía posibilidades de trabajar en una empresa por lo que aprendió un nuevo negocio como es cocer. Aunque tuvo que esperar cinco años para tener bastante clientela ella continua trabajando, ahora ella trabaja desde muy temprano hasta que terminar de hacer todos los pedidos. 
Para tener más posibilidades de hacer ropa ella quiere comprar materia prima como es telas, zipper, botones e hilos. Pero en el futuro ella quiere que su taller se convierta en el más grande.
texts.en:
Ediltruidis del Socorro is 31 and has two children. She owns a tailoring shop. Many years ago she wasn't able to work in a company so she learned the trade of tailoring. Although she had to wait five years to have enough customers, she continued working and now she starts very early in the day and doesn't stop until she has finished all of the jobs. So that she can have more opportunities to make clothes, she would like to buy basic supplies such as cloth, zippers, buttons and thread. In the future she would like to have a bigger shop.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Lucrecia, ella tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es soltera y tiene 3 hijos menores la socia se dedica al comercio minorista en el distrito de Saylla, La socia tiene terrenos de cultivo, ella cultiva papa, maíz, hortalizas para la venta, La socia tiene sus compradores y ellos vienen a llevar toda la producción de la socia; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas para una nueva siembra. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucrecia is a member of the “Virgen Purificada Angostura” communal bank. She lives in the district of Angostura in the province of Saylla, in the department of Cusco. She is a 35 year old single woman with three young children. She works in the retail business in the district of Saylla. She owns farmland and grows potatoes, corn, and vegetables for sale. When her customers come to her farm, they buy her entire supply of produce. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for the new sowing season. She is immensely grateful for the loan as it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to make her payments according to the agreed upon term.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for the new sowing season.

loans.name: María Adelina

texts.es:
María Adelina tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el caserío Cruz de Médano una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre sí, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes productos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que viajar hacia el distrito de Mórrope, que se encuentra muy alejado. Consciente de la situación de su negocio y de la importancia que tiene para sus vecinos trata de brindarles siempre productos de buena calidad, los cuales adquiere en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
