El negocio cuenta con una buena acogida y la demanda por los productos que ofrece viene incrementando en los ultimos meses, María desea ampliarlo con la compra de mas productos para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias con las cuales pueda salir adelante. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para apoyar a su familia y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es una mujer amable y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a las personas que la necesitan.
texts.en:
María Adelina is 40 years old, married and lives with her husband and four children in the village of Cruz de Medano, a rural area of the Mórrope district known for having most of its population concentrated in rural areas spread far apart. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For over two years, she has been selling primary staples and groceries from a storeroom in her home. There she offers her clients products for daily use, which her clients would otherwise have to travel to the Mórrope district, which is far, to get. Aware of where her business is located and its importance to her neighbors, she is always trying to provide good quality products, which she acquires in the wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo. The business has been well received and demand for the products she offers has increased in the last few months. María wishes to expand her business by buying more products to increase her sales and receive more income with which to move forward. To achieve this objective, María has requested a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles from Alternative Edpyme. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman to support her family and provide them with a better quality of life. She is a friendly woman and always willing to help people in need.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of daily use products to expand her store which is based out of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio Crisologo pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; El socio vive en el ddistrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 54 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos es casado y se dedica junto a su esposa a prestar servicio de comidas, él tiene un negocio de preparación de todo tipo de comidas para eventos desde la decoración hasta la música. El socio solicita el préstamo para implementar algunos pequeños detalles en su negocio.

El socio agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Crisologo is a member of the communal bank YANAPAKUY. He lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. He's 54-years-old and has 4 children. He's married and, with his wife, he offers food service. He has a catering service which offers all types of foods for events, in addition to decorations and music. He's asking for the loan so that he can add a few small details to his business. Crisologo values and is infinitely grateful for this loan, and he promises to pay off the debt within the established period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adding a few small details to his business

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto P. de 26 años es una persona responsable, trabajadora y esforzada quien  tiene un pequeño negocio junto con su esposa el cual inicio hace cinco años con el propósito de salir adelante.  Ellos venden nacatamales, enchiladas,  carne asada y tacos desde viernes, sábado y domingo. 

P. invertirá en granos básicos, carne, maíz, carbón, leña, verduras…etc.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto P., 26 years old, is a responsible, hard working, determined person who has a small business with his wife which he began 5 years ago with a plan of getting ahead. They sell nacatamales [corn cakes filled with meat and vegetables and steamed in banana leaves], enchiladas, roast meat, and tacos on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. P. will invest in basic grains, meat, corn, charcoal, firewood, vegetables, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat, corn, charcoal, fire wood, and vegetabes.

loans.name: Ysmael

texts.es:
El socio Ysmael pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; El socio vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 51 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos es divorciado y se dedica a la mecánica, el socio vende accesorios de autos en San jerónimo, el socio estudio superior completa y es mecánico de automóviles,  el viene trabajando desde hace 31 años actualmente quiere mejorar su taller. El socio solicita el préstamo para implementar algunos accesorios para su taller de mecánica.

El socio agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the community bank Ysmael YANAPAKUY. He lives in the district of Santiago in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. He is 51 years old, divorced, and has four children. He is an auto mechanic and sells auto parts in San jerónimo. He completed a post-secondary education in auto mechanics. He has been working for about 31 years now, and would like to improve his workshop. He is requesting a loan so he can obtain some additional items for his workshop. He is infinitely grateful and appreciative of this loan, and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The borrower requests the loan so he can get some items for his auto mechanic's workshop.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a 43-year-old mother of five who lives with her family in San José Coronado, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Laura has a business selling various useful items from her home to members of her community. In her house, she has a kind of bazaar whereby she displays products for potential customers to peruse. Some of the products Laura sells include school supplies, perfumes, clothing, toys and cosmetics, among others. Laura says that her neighbourhood has been affected by drugs and other forms of crime. She says, ¨Men are selling drugs at night; many people have been assaulted as well.¨

Laura is a hardworking entrepreneur. She is open for business every day from 8 in the morning until 7 at night. She organizes her day by waking up early and sending the children to school in the morning. The rest of her day is dedicated to her business. In her spare time, Laura repairs clothing. 

Laura has applied for the current loan in an effort to increase the variety of products she can offer to her customers. An increase in working capital will allow Laura to invest in her stock of items in an effort to increase sales levels. Laura´s goals are to be successful in her business so that she can afford to keep her children in school. Specifically, she hopes to secure enough capital to keep her business afloat. Laura aims to ensure that her children complete as much schooling as possible.

loans.use: For the purchase of various items for resale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el sector San Nicolás, una zona rural del distrito de Zaña, el lugar se caracteriza por tener como principal actividad económica a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco a ños a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cuenta con varias cabezas de ganado ovino los cuales cría en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos animales ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona esporádicamente y a sus vecinos que los adquieren para consumirlos en fiestas y celebraciones.

Esta actividad le provee de algunos ingresos económicos que utiliza para apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares. Laura desea seguir apoyando a su familia a salir adelante y para ello desea mejorar la alimentación de sus ovejas para poder venderlas a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que planea invertir sembrando forraje para sus animales en un pequeño terreno de cultivo ubicado cerca de su vivienda.

Teresa es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 47-year-old mother who lives with her husband and son in San Nicolás, a rural area in the Zaña district. San Nicolás is located 45 minutes away from Chiclayo and most of its inhabitants are farmers. For the last five years Teresa has raised and sold animals. She has a number of sheep which she raises in a pen in her backyard. Once they are old enough, she sells them to one of the businessmen who periodically visit her area or to her neighbors who buy them for parties and celebrations. She uses the money from this endeavor to help her husband meet household expenses. Teresa wants to keep helping her family get ahead and she wants to improve the quality of feed that she gives her sheep so that she can sell them at a better price. She is asking for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa to meet this goal. She will use the 1000 Peruvian nuevos soles to invest in planting crops on a nearby field to use as food for her animals. Teresa is a hardworking and enterprising woman known to her neighbors and friends to be responsible and trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs related to planting crops to feed sheep

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Josefina tiene 25 años de edad y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años de edad, la socia es madre soltera y ella se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia vende ropa y también es dueña de un restaurante pequeño, ella alterna sus actividades de esta manera, la socia siempre vendía ropa a sus amistades y recientemente inauguró su restaurante, el sueño de ella es ahora poner una fotocopiadora frente a la universidad, este lugar le resulta estratégico por que los alumnos constantemente hacen uso de las fotocopiadoras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una fotocopiadora.
 
La socia agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Yanapakuy Communal Bank. She lives in the Santiago district in the Cusco province, Cusco department. Our member, Josefina, is 25 years old and has a four year old son. She is a single mother. She is a commercial businesswoman, and she sells clothes. She also has a small restaurant. She alternates these activities. She always sold clothes to her friends, and she recently started her restaurant. Her dream now is to place a photocopier in front of the university. This is a strategic location because the students always use photocopiers. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. She pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a photocopier

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Ignacia tiene 65 años de edad y tiene 6 hijo  la socia es casada y  ella se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia desde el año 2007 tiene un servicio de alimentos, ella trabaja arreglando los locales, y dando los diferentes platos y bocadillos, ve también las bebidas, música y arreglo de local ella trabaja con todo tipo de eventos, La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Yanapakuy Communal Bank. She lives in the Santiago district in the Cusco province, Cusco department. Ignacia is 65 years old. She is married and she has six children. She is a commercial businesswoman. She has been providing food service since 2007. She arranges the places and makes the different dishes and snacks. She also sees to the drinks, the music, and the locations. She works with all types of events. The member is requesting a loan to establish her business. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. She commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To establish her business

loans.name: Fausto Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Fausto C. es casado con una carga familiar de 5 personas, entre ellos 2 varones y dos mujeres todos en edad escolar. El es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 3 años donde se desempeña como recolector de basura en el tren de aseo de la Alcaldía, cubriendo varios barrios de la ciudad.
Don Fausto trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 2 años tiempo en el que se le han otorgado tres créditos y los cuales los ha utilizado para gastos agrícolas como alquiler de tierras y compra de insumos, ya que él es nacido y criado en una finca donde antes de laborar para la Alcaldía se dedicaba a la Agricultura.
texts.en:
Señor Fausto C. is married and is responsible for a family of five including two boys and two girls of school age. For the last three years he has worked for the Chichigalpa municipal government as a garbage collector, covering various neighborhoods of the city. Señor Fausto C. has worked with Kiva field partner, Ceprodel, for the last two years, during which time they have given him three loans that he has used to pay farming expenses such as renting land and buying supplies. He was born and brought up on a farm where he worked as a farmer before his current job with the municipal government.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay farming expenses including land rental and purchasing supplies

loans.name: Aurelia Bibiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Aurelia tiene 50 años de edad,  la socia es soltera y tiene una pequeña tienda abarrotes, ella se dedica a la administración de esta su tienda, la socia apoya a sus sobrinos, es una muy buena mujer y muy trabajadora. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Yanapakuy Communal Bank. She lives in the Santiago district in the Cusco province, Cusco department. Aurelia, the member, is 50 years old. She is single, and she has a small grocery store. She devotes herself to running her store. The member supports her nephews. She is a very good and hard-working woman. The member is requesting the loan to help her grocery store. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. She commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help her grocery store

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria tiene 35 años de edad,  la socia es madre soltera y tiene un 1 hijo de 15 años de edad; La socia tiene un pequeño restaurante y ella poco a poco lo hace crecer, es una mujer muy competente y muy decidida a triunfar, ella es madre y padre para su hijo y sola lo ayuda en los estudios y en todo lo que le pueda hacer falta, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una congeladora para su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank YANAPAKUY. She lives in the district of Santiago, in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. She's a 35-year-old single mother with a 15-year-old son. She has a small restaurant which is growing little by little. She's a competent woman who's very dedicated to success. She's mother and father to her son and she helps him all by herself with his studies and with anything else he might need. Maria is asking for this loan to buy a freezer for her restaurant. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan, and she promises to pay off the debt within the established period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer for her restaurant

loans.name: Luz Gladys

texts.es:
Luz Gladys tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Quemazón, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, el cual se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su poclación situada en áreas rurales que distan mucho entre sí. El lugar pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la crianza y comercialización de animales, especialmente de cerdos. Ella cría estos animales es espacios al aire libre situados cerca de su domicilio, y cuando ya han desarrollado lo suficiente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona adquiriendo animales para venderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Adicionalmente se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en su vivienda. Con estos ingresos ella ayuda al sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Luz Gladys desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de sus cerdos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Luz Gladys siempre está buscando formas de agenciarse de ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia, su mayor anhelo es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la fotografía nos muestra uno de sus cerdos listo para ser vendido.
texts.en:
Luz Gladys is 50 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with her family in the community of Quemazón, a rural area belonging to the district of Mórrope. It is characterized by having a large part of its population located in rural areas that are very far apart from each other. The place belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For ten years, she has been raising and selling animals, especially pigs. She raises these animals in outdoor areas located close to her residence. When they have developed enough, she offers them for sale to the merchants who always visit the area to adquire animals to sell them in the city of Chiclayo. In addition, she also sells basic necessity items and groceries in a small store in her residence. With this income, she helps to support her family. Luz Gladys wants to acquire feed to improve the raising of her pigs. For this, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 800 nuevos soles to help her acheive her goal. Luz Gladys is always looking for ways to acquire income that will allow her to get her family ahead. Her greatest wish is to offer them a better quality of life. One of the pigs that are ready to be sold is shown in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed to improve the raising of the pigs for sale.

loans.name: Soriano

texts.es:
Soriano es un padre de familia de 28 años de edad, tiene un hijo menor de edad y vive junto a su familia en el sector Lagunas del distrito de Mórrope, una distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población habitando en zonas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra. El lugar pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la comercialización de animales, el compra animales menores a sus vecinos y los termina de criar para luego venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona donde vive. Este negocio le provee de ingresos estables, adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola y con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza en el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares.

Soriano desea realizar algunas reparaciones en el techo de su vivienda ya que las pasadas lluvias lo debilitaron y el daño se hace más notorio conforme pasan los meses, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Soriano es bastante entregado a su joven familia, el siempre se esfuerza al máximo para verlos progresar, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien honrado y de confianza.
texts.en:
Soriano, age 28, is a father of a family; he has one young son and lives with his family in the Lagunas sector of the Mórrope district - a district where the majority of the population lives in rural areas that are far away from each other. It is a part of the Lambayeque province and is located an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo. For over three years, Soriano has been earning his living by raising livestock - he buys animals from his neighbors and then raises them till they are ready for sale to traveling merchants that visit the area where he lives. This business has provided Soriano with a steady income; additionally he works as a field laborer, and with the earnings from these two activities, he has been able to cover the expenses of his household. Soriano would like to make some repairs to the roof of his home which was weakened by recent rains. The damage is getting worse with each passing month, and, because of this, for the first time, Soriano turned to Edpyme Alternativa. He is seeking a loan of 500 sols which would allow him to achieve his goal of repairing the roof. Soriano is very committed to his young family; he always makes his very best efforts to see them progress in life. In the area where Soriano lives, his neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be an honorable person who is worthy of trust.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing the damage to the roof of his home

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Rosalia tiene 45 años de edad,  la socia es madre soltera y tiene un 1 hijo de 18 años de edad; La socia tiene un pequeño taller de costurería. La socia hace prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales de costura, ella comprara telas, hilos y otros.

La socia agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosalia belongs to the YANAPAKUY communal bank. She lives in the district of Santiago, in Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. She is 45 years old and the single mother of an 18-year-old son. She has a small tailoring workshop, where she creates clothing for men, women and children. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying materials for her tailoring business, including fabrics, thread and other supplies. Rosalia infinitely values and appreciates the loan offered to her, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics and thread to make clothing

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Rosa tiene 41 años de edad,  la socia es natural de Sicuani y tienen 3 hijos, La socia es madre soltera y ella se dedica a la venta de muebles, la socia tiene una tienda pequeñaen la feria de San Sebastian ella compra y vende diferentes modelos en muebles para todo tipo de ambientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de muebles y algunos materiales para los acabados.

La socia agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the YANAPAKUY communal bank. She lives in the district of Santiago in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. She is a native of Sicuani. She is a 41 year old single mother with three children. She has a small shop in the San Sebastian market where she buys and sells different styles of furniture for all types of rooms. She is requesting the loan to buy furniture and wood finishing products. She is immensely grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments according to the agreed upon term.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and wood finishing products

loans.name: Group 3

texts.en:
Jalou C. is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 20 years old and the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jalou is married and has one infant child. To make a living, she sells fresh fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $25 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Jalou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jalou is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida M. is from the city of Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Aida cooks and sells food for daily meals in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $770 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Aida is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Group 2

texts.en:
Nedilen O., from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental, is the 29-year-old group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Married with three school-aged children, Nedilen owns and operates a business venture that sells fresh fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nedilen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana S. D. R., es una señora muy trabajadora y responsable, la cual a sus 71 años D. edad se esfuerza día con día para obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante, vive  junto a su esposo quien es jubilado y junto a tres nietos D. 4, 9 y 18 años D. edad, los cuales se encuentran al cuidado D. Ana y con quienes vive en el municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. La señora Ana se dedica a la venta D. zapatos para mujeres, niños y hombres, así mismo sandalias para damas, calzado el cual comercializa en su casa D. habitación y así mismo las venD. visitando diferentes empresas gubernamentales en las cuales posee muchos clientes los cuales le compran sus productos ya sea al crédito como al contado, debido a que desD. hace varios años que ella se dedica a este trabajo, hay muchas personas las cuales cuentan con toda la confianza D. Ana para que les venda sus productos a crédito, lo cual le permite que le compran más zapatos. La señora Ana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. zapatos en diferentes estilos y colores, lo cual le permita contar con más clientes y D. esta forma con más ingresos para su hogar. Ana es una señora muy trabajadora, la cual a pesar D. sus años desea crecer como comerciante y D. esta forma poseer una vida estable y tranquila en su vejez.
texts.en:
Ana S. D. R. is a very hardworking and responsible woman. Though she is 71 years old, Ana works very hard, day after day, in order to obtain the income necessary to make ends meet. Ana lives with her husband, who is retired, and with her three grandchildren, who are 4, 9, and 18 years old. The grandchildren are in Ana's care, and they live all together in the municipality of Ilopango, located in the Department of San Salvador. Ana makes her living by selling shoes for men, women, and children, as well as sandals for ladies. She sells these products both from her home and door-to-door, visiting various public sector companies where she has a lot of clients. Ana has been doing this work for several years, and, as a result, has a lot of clients whom she trusts completely; this allows Ana to sell her products not only for cash but also on credit, and this, in turn, enables Ana to buy more shoes. Ana is seeking a loan in order to purchase a larger quantity of footwear in a variety of styles and colors. This would allow her to have more clients and thus greater income for her home. Ana is a very hardworking woman - despite her years, she wants to grow as a merchant and thus ensure that she has a stable and quiet life in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and sandals

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M. is a married woman who lives in Prk 2, Barangay Basak, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  Food vending and farming. Her husband Romeo M., who is 56 years old, works as a farmer and welder to earn his living.  He also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 5 children who range in age from 17 to  28 years old. 

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy ingredients and fertilizer so that she can continue to save to expand her land holdings and buy more livestock in the future.

Teresita M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through this program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To save toward expanding land holdings and buying livestock.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa B. is a 45-year old, married, and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures.  She buys & sells rice grains and also sells net repairing products. She lives in Prk2, Brgy. Tuyom, Cauayan , Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard selling rice rice grains and net repair products, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of Php10,000. 

Elisa is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that her can expand her rice selling business.  This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Elisa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda B. is a widow who lives in Prk. Santol, Sitio Malarong, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a food vending business. Nilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past thirteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nilda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 15,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP which she intends to use to improve her business so that she can continue to save up for the future. She will purchase new equipment that can be useful for her business. Nilda B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Charily

texts.en: Charily D. C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 2, Tuyom, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: buying and selling rice and a general store business. Her husband, Dionesio D. C., who is 58 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have 10 children who are 4 months to 26 years old. Charily joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Charily has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP - improving the family's standard of living. This time, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP which she intends to use as additional working capital and to buy fertilizer so that she can continue to save up for the future and purchase additional agricultural land. Charily D. C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is a 53-year-old married woman who lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Tuyom, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by farming and selling rice. Rosemarie’s husband, Nelson, is a farmer and pastor and they have seven children who are between 18 and 36 years old. They have one child who is currently going to school and also helps out with the business as part of their daily chores. Their other six children are already working.

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income with her rice business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities.

Rosemarie is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP was used to fund the operations of her rice business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 16th loan, in the amount of 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use on her farming activities. Rosemarie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

Rosemarie is shown in the accompanying photo with her stockpile of rice grains that she sells.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem  that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
Luzvisminda R. is a married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures :a General Store and Frozen foods sales. She lives in Gomez Street, La Castellana, Negros Occidental  with her husband and their 4 children who are 28, 30, 32 and 33 years of age.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her General store and Frozen foods businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php6,000.

Luzvisminda is now borrowing Php15,000 so that she can expand her businesses. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Luzviminda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess R.  is a 33-year old married woman who lives in Magallon Cadre, Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: buying and selling of scrap and raising pigs.

Maritess husband, Randy, is a baker and they have 4 children who are between 3 and 12 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Maritess  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999  in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in 2 businesses, buying and selling scrap and raising pigs. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php4,000 from her business activities.

Maritess  is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php16,000 was used to fund operations of her scrap business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 12th loan, the amount of Php19,000, which she intends to use as an additional working capital. Maritess  is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn V. is a 49-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. San Miguel, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and food vending.

Jocelyn’s husband, Roberto, is a laborer. They have six children who are between 9 and 28 years old. Four of their children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Their other two children are employed.

Jocelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store and food vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000 from her business activities.

Jocelyn is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 10th loan, the amount of PHP 12,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital. Jocelyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita B. is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Miranda, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing/fish vending.

Amelita’s 41-year-old husband, Dolphy, is a fisherman. They have three children who are between 16 and 19 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Amelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in the fishing/fish vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000 from her business activities.

Amelita is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 was used to fund operations of her fishing/fish vending, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 10th cycle loan, the amount of PHP 19,500, which she intends to use on her fishing/fish vending business. Amelita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is a 49-year-old married woman who lives in Prk 3, Brgy Cambarus, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by engaging in a general store business.

Cecilia’s 56-year-old husband, Mamerto, is a farmer. They have seven children who are between 7 and 24 years old. Five of their children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. The others work to help the family.

Cecilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income through the general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000 from her business activities.

Cecilia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 10th cycle loan, the amount of PHP 13,000, which she intends to use on her general store. Cecilia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is a 54-year-old married woman who supports her family by owning and operating a general store and by selling frozen products. She lives in DSB, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental with her 55-year-old husband, Domingo, who works as a foreman in a construction firm. They have six children who are between 14 and 32 years old. Two of them are currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and selling frozen products, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.

Helen is now borrowing PHP 24,500 so that she can use it as additional working capital for her business. This will be her 16th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Helen aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda G. is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Zone 4, Brgy Tabao, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by buying and selling scrap materials. She operates this business with her 36-year-old husband Roison. They have one infant child.

Rhoda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income through their scrap materials business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000 from her business activities.

Rhoda is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 was used to fund operations of her business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 4th cycle loan, the amount of PHP 11,000, which she intends to use on her scrap materials business.  Rhoda is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ronerie

texts.en:
Ronerie J. is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Zone 4, Brgy Tabao, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living owning and operating a general store.

Ronerie’s 29-year-old husband, Archie, is an employee of Sugar Central, and they have two children who are 6 and 7 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Ronerie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income through the general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000 from her business activities.

Ronerie is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 was used to fund operations for her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 13th cycle loan, the amount of PHP 10,000, which she intends to use on her general store. Ronerie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma D. is a 59-year-old married woman who supports her family with her general store. She lives in Brgy. Cambarus Pontevedra, Negros Occidental with her 67-year-old husband, Romulo, who is a retired employee and their five adult children. Thelma has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and by her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Thelma is now borrowing 20,000 PHP so that she can buy additional products to sell in her general store. This will be her tenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Thelma hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Yonasani

texts.en: Yonasani is a young man, age 25, who is hardworking with a zeal to succeed in his endeavors. He operates a retail shop in the small town of Bundibugyo, Uganda. He says he started off selling paraffin (kerosene) after which he was able to establish his retail shop which has now been in existence for five years. He says rent for the premises is still a challenge as it is high and ever increasing (as is the case in many parts of the country). Yonasani, like many retailers, would like to move into a wholesale business one day. This is his third loan cycle from HOFOKAM and Yonasani intends to use the loan funds to purchase sacks of sugar and liquor for reselling in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar and liquor for reselling in his shop

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a retailer based in Bundibugyo, Uganda. In his retail shop, James sells sugar, soap and cooking oil. As is the case with many retail shops in the area, he sells domestic items. In addition to his shop, James is also a farmer. Together with his wife, he is majorly involved in cocoa which he cultivates himself and also buys from other farmers for reselling at better prices. Actually, in James’s area, cocoa is a treasured crop ("cash crop") for income generation. 

This is James’s fourth loan and he is going to use the funds to purchase cocoa from other farmers for reselling and also sugar, soap and cooking oil for his retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil and cocoa for reselling

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is divorced and has a grown daughter. She sells toys and games at Angolenko market in Zaporozhye city. Galina owns two vending locations. She offers a flexible pricing policy and very friendly customer service which has helped her business grow and flourish. Galina has been in the trade for 15 years. Currently, she has about 20,000 UAH in inventory. Her monthly profit is about 5,000 UAH. 

Galina is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to purchase water games for the summer season. As a good manager, she has succeeded in managing all of her previous loans and repaid all of them in a timely fashion. Galina is thankful for the opportunity to use KIVA loans because they strengthen her trade and provide an important profit margin to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase water games for summer season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 30 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 10. All of her children are currently attending school.

She is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya where she has been farming for seven years. Her products are milk, eggs, tea, and chickens which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from the rental houses she owns in the same area. Her biggest challenge has been an inconsistent market for her milk, the high cost of medicine and the lack of enough food for her chickens and cows.

Joyce recently completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES and has requested this loan of 50,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will ease the burden of paying school fees for her children.

In the future, she would like to increase the number of her dairy cows and rental houses.

She would like Juhudi to reduce the interest rate on loans and re-introduce grace periods on second loans.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is 33 years old. He is married and has three children between the ages of 2 and 8. Two of the children are currently attending school.

He is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 12 years and has employed three people from his community. His products are milk, which he sells to the tea estate, and tea which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also earns income from his posho mill and a powersaw (used for cutting down trees and timber) which he hires out.

His major challenges have been a transportation problem since they live in the rural area, and lack of enough food for his cattle.

Wesley has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 80,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production and earn him more income. He will also be able to provide enough milk for his family and pay school fees for his children with the extra income.

In 5 years time, he would like to have six dairy cows of good quality.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 43 years old. He is married with eight children between the ages of 3 and 20. All the children except one are attending school.

He is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for 20 years and has three employees. His main product is milk which he sells to the local market. He is also a cash crop farmer and sells his tea to Kapset Tea Factory in the same area. He solely depends on the income from his farming activities to meet his family's needs.

His major challenges have been the lack of a proper market for his milk and a poor transport network.

Christopher recently completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES and has requested this loan of 80,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. Through this loan, his income will increase and he will be able to meet the family's needs and be able to repay the loan.

In the future, he would like to improve his dairy farming by purchasing an extra piece of land and improving the quality of the dairy animals to high yielding cows.

He is grateful to Juhudi for their good work.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She is 40 years old and married with ten children between the ages of 2 and 15. Five of the children are currently attending school.

She has been practicing mixed farming for over 10 years and her main product is milk which she sells to the local market. She is also a cash crop farmer and sells her tea to the local market. Her major challenges in this business are a lack of enough food for the dairy cows and insufficient water since there is no piped water and they have to rely on water from the river which is very far away.

Mary has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. With the income from the sale of milk, she will be able to provide food for her family and pay school fees for her children.

She would like to have five dairy cows in the next five years. She would also like to be assisted in sourcing for good quality dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Martha Georgina

texts.es:
La señora Martha es una mujer trabajadora que trabaja junto con su esposo para lograr mejores beneficios, desde hace varios año logro poner una pulpería que ha ido aumentando su inventario, a si como ayuda a su esposo en los cultivo, ya que tienen unas tierra, en donde están cultivando tomate y chiltoma. 

Ya están la mata creciendo pero necesitan dar mantenimiento para que puedan crecer bien.
Con el crédito anterior logro aumentar los productos de su negocio, y con este financiamiento lograra invertir en productos químicos, abonos, para aplicar a la cosecha y poder sacar a vender un buen tomate.

Lo que espera lograr ahorrar para hacer mejoras a su casa, y dar lo necesario a su hijo ya que todo ha aumentado en nuestro país, por la perdida de  muchas cosechas que se han perdido por muchas tormentas. Lo que espera no dañen los frutos para poder sacar lo invertido y obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha is a very hard-working woman who works with her husband to try to improve their income. A few years ago, they put up a small general store in their home and have continued to increase their inventory. She also helps her husband with the harvest on their land where they grow tomatoes and sweet peppers. The plants are growing but they need to fertilize it so it can grow better. Her previous loan was used to buy products for her store, but this loan will be invested in chemicals and fertilizers to improve their harvest and be able to sell more tomatoes. What they hope for now is to be able to improve their home and provide for their son since prices have gone up in the country; many have lost their crops due to bad storms. They hope they will be able to have a good harvest in order to earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and fertilizer to fumigate and fertilize their tomato and pepper plants; this will help them improve their income

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre en el caserío Valle San Juan del distrito de Tambogrande de la provincia de Piura, sus actividades económicas principales son la agricultura y la ganadería, se encuentra ubicado en la región Piura, a mas de tres horas de camino de la ciudad de  Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabaja como ganadero desde hace siete años, el cría vacas en un corral cercano a su vivienda y diariamente extrae la leche que estas producen y la ofrece en venta en la ciudad de Sullana. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre trata de darle a sus animales un buen cuidado y alimentación para que estos tengan una buena producción.

Roger desea mejorar la producción de su ganado brindándole una mejor alimentación, por ello desea adquirir alimento balanceado y pastos naturales con los cuales sus vacas producirán mas leche y aumentara sus ventas y ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Roger es una persona trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de evida. En la zona donde vive el es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Roger is 32 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in the community of Valle San Juan of the district of Tambogrande of the province of Piura. Its main economic activities are agriculture and cattle. It is located in the Piura region, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region. He has worked with cattle for more than seven years. He raises cows in a corral close to his residence and every day extracts the milk that they produce and offers it for sale in the city of Sullana. This business is the main source of income so he always tries to give good care and feed to his animals so they will always have good production. Roger wants to improve his cattle's production by offering them better feed. That is why he wants to acquire balanced feed and natural grasses with which his cows will produce more milk and his sales and earnings will increase. To acheive this goal, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. Roger is a hardworking person who is dedicated to his family. His greatest wish is to offer his mother a better quality of life. In the area where he lives, he is very well known and esteemed by his neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed and natural grasses to improve the feed and production of his dairy cattle.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Doña Yamileth es madre de familia de tres hijos, mujer dedicada al comercio, tiene la edad de 38 años, su negocio es un comedor que lleva varios años, vendiendo comida, gaseosas, pasteles, golosinas, que con ayuda de los financiamientos y aporte de su esposo ha logrado aumentar su inventario.
Este negocio lo inicio junto con su mama ya que era el medio de entradas para la familia. Ahora lleva varios años que lo administra sola, desde horas temprana se levanta para ofrecer sus ricos desayunos.

Lo que  necesita capital para mantener el equilibrio, de sus ventas, en donde comprara: granos básicos, carne, pollo, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, entre otros para preparar los alimentos día a día. Y poder sacar el pan de cada día. Ya que solo con el salario de su esposo no se ajusta.
texts.en:
Yamileth is 38 years old and the mother of 3 children. She is very dedicated to her work running a small restaurant--she sells food, soft drinks, pastries and snacks; with the help of various loans and the support of her husband she has increased her inventory. She started this business with her mother to earn money for the family. Now she runs it by herself and gets up early to sell her delicious breakfasts. She needs capital to balance her purchases and sales; she needs to buy basic grains, meat, chicken, vegetables, fruit, soft drinks, and other items to prepare her food and earn her living. Her husband's income is not enough for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food ingredients and drinks to meet demand; she has little capital to increase her production; this loan will help her buy what she needs to make her sales

loans.name: La Oportunidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo la oportunidad está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras provenientes de Masaya, cuna del folklor nicaragüense. La coordinadora es la señora Wendy Gutierres Vilchez quien en el 2007 empezó vendiendo tacos, enchiladas y tajadas con queso con forme el negocio fue creciendo invirtió en otros productos como carne, pollo hasta formar una pequeña fritanga.

La fritanga es un restaurante popular por excelencia en Nicaragua. Este consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos, que están preparados solo para poner en la parrilla, por lo generar se comprar para la cena.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Silvia Elena C. quien desde 1980 tiene un molino de carne  negocio con el que ha trabajado gran parte  de su vida y María Eugenia C. distribuye productos Avon, Zelsa y ropa desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
The La Oportunidad group is comprised of three hard-working women from Masaya, the cradle of Nicaraguan folklore. Wendy Gutierres Vilchez is the coordinator. In 2007 she started selling tacos, enchiladas, and fried plantain slices with cheese. As the business was growing she invested in other products like meat and chicken. She even set up a small “fritanga”. A “fritanga” is a Nicaraguan restaurant, which is popular due to its excellence. It consists of selling fried food, which is prepared to put on the grill. It is generally bought for dinner. Silvia Elena C., a colleague in the group, has had a meat grinding business since 1980. She has worked in this business for a great part of her life. María Eugenia C., another colleague, has been distributing Avon and Zelsa products and clothes for four years.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Meat, basic grains, oil, and bananas, etc.

loans.name: Las Méndez Group

texts.es:
El grupo los M. está conformado por cuatro féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras que se dedican desde hace años al comercio de frutas y verduras actividad de gran demanda en Nicaragua. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Jesenia del Carmen M. quien desde hace 10 años inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras con su esposo.

Sus compañeras de grupo son María del Socorro F. Muños comerciante del mercado oriental desde 1995, Miriam M. J. 1990 inicio a vender frutas y verduras y Esmilda del Carmen Martínez también comercializa perecederos en este populoso mercado.
texts.en:
The M. group consists of four hardworking and entrepreneurial women; for several years, they have been in the business of selling fruits and vegetables, something that is in great demand in Nicaragua. The coordinator of the group is Jesenia del Carmen M., who started selling fruits and vegetables with her husband ten years ago. Her fellow group members are María del Socorro F. Muños, who has been a vendor in the Eastern market since 1995; Miriam M. J., who started selling fruits and vegetables in 1990; and Esmilda del Carmen Martínez, who also sells perishable goods in this bustling market.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Eusebio Alfonso

texts.es:
Don Eusebio es un hombre trabajador, de 55 años de edad, es padre de familia de  seis hijos, y de pocos recursos económicos, pues a la fecha no ha logrado construir su casa de concreto ya que los trabajos que ha tenido han sido con sueldos bajos que solo ajusta para la alimentación. Trabaja como guarda de seguridad en un local de tragamonedas,  desde hace un año, ya que el recibe una pensión de su trabajo anterior en la policía nacional. 

Su esposa también trabaja en lavado y planchado para lograr ingresos para ajustar con los gastos básicos de agua, luz, y gastos de los niños. Parte de la pensión que recibe don Eusebio, da a su hijo mayor el pago de universidad para que pueda lograr una mejor educación, como lograr ayudar  a sus hermanos en el futuro.
Su objetivo es comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar a levantar las paredes de concreto poco a poco hasta poder terminar su casa y lograr un mejor techo. 
Para esto comprara: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro. Y comenzara la obra.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a hard-working man who's 55 years old and the father of 6. He has little money and to date, has not been able to construct a concrete home. Most of his jobs have had very low pay so he has only been able to afford food. He has worked as a security guard in a local casino for the past year and he receives a pension from his prior job as a policeman. His wife also works doing laundry in order to help with basic expenses like water, electricity and basics for the children. Eusebio gives part of his pension to his oldest son to support his university studies so he can get a better education which will hopefully help the other children in the future. He would like to buy constuction materials to start to put up concrete walls little by little for his home and put up a better roof. He will buy bricks, sand, cement, and steel and he will start the work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials like bricks, sand, cement, and steel to put up concrete walls for his home and put up a better roof
